title: 2019 pawsey supercomputing centre summer internships
description: do you like a challenge? are you interested in research? would you like to improve your computer skills? applications for the 2019-2020 pawsey supercomputing centre summer internship program are now open. we invite students ready to challenge themselves and/or try something new to apply. students from all fields and disciplines are encouraged to apply. the goal of the pawsey summer internship program is to enable undergraduate students to develop skills in computational science by providing the opportunity to be immersed in advanced computing research projects. we will provide access to high-performance computing, visualization facilities, large-scale data storage and high-speed communications along with expert help to make the best use of technology. researchers at pawsey partner institutions are submitting an impressive array of projects for you to work on. the internship program includes an intensive induction week. during this week, you will learn the basics of supercomputing, data management and scientific visualization and discuss impacts of those on research now and in the future. you will be supervised by leading researchers and undertake challenging research projects using the resources provided by the pawsey supercomputing centre. you will also learn from pawsey supercomputing centre staff about good practices of using pawsey resources, good practices for poster creation/presentation, techniques for business communication, and more. for more information, please see our website at pawsey supercomputing centre. projects: projects from across domains and disciplines are being sought. projects may include high-performance computing, cloud computing, data analytics, large-scale data storage, machine learning, high-speed interconnects/communication or scientific visualisation. location: perth, wa scholarship: au$1,559.85 per fortnight reference: 62907 pre-requisites/eligibility the internships are open to third year and higher undergraduate students (including honours) or master’s students at australian higher education institutions. the program runs for ten weeks over the summer period from 25 november 2019 through to 14 february 2020. to be eligible to apply you must be an australian or new zealand citizen, australian permanent resident or an international student who has full work rights for the 12 weeks duration (does not require visa sponsorship). apply online to apply for the internship program you will be required to: submit a resume/cv, motivational statement and letter of reference (as one document) in the ‘resume/cv’ field. in your motivational statement, tell us why you want to participate in a pawsey summer internship, the type of project work you want to be involved in, and what you want to learn. a letter of reference is a letter received from a university supervisor or professor, or manager in a related industry. upload your academic transcript in the ‘cover letter’ field; in the ‘education’ section select your university from the educational institute list; and in the ‘job-specific information’ section select ‘not applicable’ for both preference 1 and preference 2; and select ‘not applicable’ in the ‘gpa selection’ section. successful applicants will be invited to provide project preferences after the initial selection process. if you experience difficulties applying online call 1300 984 220 and someone will be able to assist you. outside business hours please email: careers.online@csiro.au. csiro’s commitment to diversity we’re working hard to recruit diverse people and ensure all our people feel supported to do their best work and empowered to let their ideas flourish. d&i strategy. about csiro at csiro you can be part of helping to solve big, complex problems that make a real difference to our future. we spark off each other, learn from each other, trust each other and collaborate to achieve more than we could individually in a supportive, rewarding, inclusive and truly flexible environment. applications close 20 september 2019 at 11:59pm aest

title: academic services officer
description: about the opportunity we are currently seeking a self-motivated, analytical academic services officer to join our team at laureate australia. this role spans the total course life cycle – from course accreditation, review, configuring courses in the student administration systems, providing reports and data, assisting with governance processes, and scheduling and attending a range of meetings. reporting to the academic services manager, you will be responsible for: providing outstanding service and exceptional support to the academic services manager, the dean, associate dean, program directors, academics and various on-campus stakeholders providing high-quality, accurate and timely processing of all academic services administration processes entering, updating and ensuring the accuracy of course and subject data in the student information system and course information documents editing documents and sorting, filtering and manipulating student and course data providing support, information and minute taking for faculty academic governance meetings as required providing accurate information for integrated campus staff regarding academic policies and procedures, ensuring adherence with group-wide approaches assisting in the preparation, smooth running and integrity of examinations this is a permanent full time position based across our fitzroy and flinders street campuses in melbourne cbd. about you to be successful in the academic services officer position you will possess: 1-2 years experience within an administration role preferably with experience in academic administration within the higher education industry superior verbal and written communication skills with ability to liaise with internal professional and academic stakeholders at all levels attention to detail and the ability to undertake high volumes of administrative tasks demonstrated data management skills with intermediate level microsoft excel the ability to interpret policies and procedures to ensure compliance and governance self-motivation and the ability to work both in a team and autonomously the ability or willingness to learn how to take minutes for academic meetings about us torrens university is committed to helping more people get the qualification they need to create a career that they love. our ambition is to revolutionise the world of education, increase student employability and make a positive impact. torrens university australia (tua), along with think colleges (tc) are part of laureate australia; we believe in the power of education to transform lives, and we put our people and students at the heart of everything we do. laureate australia is part of laureate international universities’; a network of passionate educators who believe in the transformative power of education to change individual lives, society and the world, for the better. we offer a number of staff benefits including tuition reduction on courses offered at torrens university and think colleges. ready to make your difference? join the laureate australia team by clicking “apply” now! please address your suitability against the skills and experience in a cover letter and submit along with your cv when applying. closing date: 5:00pm 27th august 2019 for recruitment process enquiries contact our talent acquisition team at yourcareer@laureate.net.au.job reference number: 2976168 please note: visa sponsorship is not available for this position. all applicants require current and valid working rights for australia.

title: data engineer
description: about me we’re not like other banks.  me was created by the industry super funds to be different from the pack – and we’re passionate about staying that way as we head into an exciting and progressive future.  we are building a bank, a company and a brand that we can be proud of – but to achieve that, we need the best people. to help me get there, you’ll challenge the status quo and share extraordinary ideas – and our size guarantees you’ll have the opportunity, support, and environment to be heard.  me’s core purpose is helping all australians get ahead – no conditions, asterisks or exceptions.  we believe everyone deserves the same opportunities in life, regardless of gender or identity, sexuality, ethnicity, disability or religion. this is why we’re so committed to an equal opportunity workplace – because we know our success won’t come from focusing on similarities, but by embracing and celebrating our diversity.  a little bit about the role we are at the start of an exciting digital journey so it is a great start to join me! we are seeking a data engineer who enjoys rolling up their sleeves, learning and growing. as part of our enterprise data team, you will ensure fit for purpose data warehouse solutions are built for use across the bank and by utilising best practise etl standards, you’ll ensure the data is trusted by our bi developers and key business consumers, oh, and you’ll get to work on microsoft technology stack too.  you will be involved with investigating data issues, keeping data feeds flowing and collaborating with different projects across the bank to deliver quality data solutions. how important does that sound? there is also the opportunity to move around and what’s really sensational is you will be working on cutting edge technologies and building a data warehouse from the ground up.  let’s chat about you you’re naturally a highly motivated and energetic person who thrives in a dynamic, collaborative team environment. ideally you have previous experience as an etl developer, data engineer or a bi developer, and if you have a degree in computer science or similar it would really put you ahead of the rest.  with your knowledge of sql coding language, microsoft technologies and understanding of warehouse concepts, plus having worked with data teams before, you’re ready to expand your horizons and launch your career into the world of it at me.  about the perks  at me, we believe that work should be a place that you can make the most of – and these are just some of the many reasons why people love it here:  popular culture – that’s not a claim, we’ve got the data to prove it. we genuinely care about each other and work in an encouraging and collaborative environment. the whole package – sure, we’re going to reward you well with your salary package – but there are also lots of other perks – including free health support, conveniently-located offices, plus much more. not afraid to fail? we embrace action-oriented people like you. that’s right, you can make mistakes here and it’s ok – so long as you learn from them. to be me, we need you – we’re building something really cool and you get to directly influence what that is. proudlyme – our internal pride network – has a swag of initiatives that show support, education, and passion toward our team and customers, demonstrating that me is a strong advocate on equal rights for the lgbtiq+ community. meet the execs – our executive team is fun and full of passion because we know great managers mean happy staff.  oh, and did we mention you get your very own me branded converse high-top shoes? now that’s a reason to get your foot in the door.  i was born to play this role  can’t see a closing date on the advert? that’s because we’re pretty efficient here at me and we may start looking at applications sooner rather than later, so if this role sounds like your jam, be sure to apply by submitting your resume today.  should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including police checks, reference checks, asic banned and disqualified persons and bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate\'s employment being confirmed. the outcomes of the background checks do not automatically bar candidates; however will be assessed against the inherent requirements of the job.

title: data scientist
description: racv head office, melbourne cbd competitive salary permanent full time role racv’s growth, strategy and analytics team’s mission is to guide, inspire and empower racv to be more member-centric. with a member base of over 2.1 million we have a wealth of member data. we’re looking for someone who will be responsible for the development and management of a delegated suite of propensity models, customer journey analytics and the completion of other advanced analytical projects. a day in the life reporting to the advanced analytics manager, you will work with structured and unstructured data to understand and predict members’ behaviours. you will be a proactive stakeholder collaborator and have the ability to deal with ambiguity and limited resources to produce the best possible result. in addition to expertise in statistical/ machine learning techniques and the use of software(s) for analytical purposes, this role requires the ability to apply critical thinking and clearly communicate with stakeholders at all levels of the organisation. as part of this process, we’ll help you grow your knowledge of customer experience and stakeholder relations in an industry-leading environment. we’re offering… a competitive salary discounts on selected racv products ongoing training and career development opportunities we’re looking for… tertiary qualifications which include mathematics, statistics, computer science, social science, and information technology higher tertiary qualifications with advanced statistical techniques and/or mathematical bias. (ph.d. degree in closely related field desirable) 3+ years’ experience with a bias towards data mining, predictive modelling, data engineering, direct marketing and other statistical/machine learning analysis modelling experience (with measurable results), including the ability to create predictive models from scratch, agreeing parameters, requirements and outputs with internal clients, making recommendations from the beginning of the process numeracy: ability to apply statistical methods and techniques to solve complex business problems proven experience using sas and r/python (or similar) software for predictive and descriptive analytics proficiency in data extraction and manipulation using sql knowledge of data engineering and dimensionality reduction of structured and unstructured data a little about us as victoria’s largest member organisation, we have a powerful organisational vision: to improve the lives of victorians by addressing their needs in the areas of mobility, home and leisure. it’s why we’ve spent more than 100 years creating products and solutions that serve people, not bottom lines. and our head office is at the forefront of this innovation. most recently, we’ve seen the launch of our new mobility app, arevo, along with the opening of our new racv cape schanck resort – a destination shaped by the landscape itself. you can learn more about the racv at racv.com.au/about-racv/our-people/work-at-racv . application process submit your cv and covering letter via the link below. please be aware racv carries out criminal background checks on applicants, in line with current legislation.

title: data conversion analyst
description: see yourself being part of a large, transformational change? this could be the role for you! who we are at iress, we believe technology should help people perform better every day. since our beginning in 1993, people across financial services have trusted us to take their performance to the next level. from the world’s most established financial brands to new and disruptive players, we help improve every aspect of our clients’ businesses so that they can work better, every day. iress is one of australia’s largest technology companies and employs more than 1,900 people across australia, united kingdom, south africa, canada, new zealand and asia. the role in this role you will work within our data transfer team to support the conversion of data from various financial planning, crm and portfolio software systems into xplan. what you will be doing utilise iress conversion tools and procedures to action and run conversion items on a daily basis data extraction, conversion and scripting identify and address differences between two databases during the data transfer to ensure data compatibility contribute as a team member to the maintenance and development of the database conversion process develop internal and external documentation to support conversion development report on progress and potential difficulties associated with conversion tasks complete conversion development and execution within agreed service standards what you will need experience in financial planning software or an understanding of the financial planning industry (mandatory) xplan knowledge would be an advantage, though not essential etl experience with a history of completing data conversions sql queries and scripting skills sql server admin (backups / restores, attaching databases, different dbms types (eg. oracle, db2, access) a strong understanding of windows server operating systems, sql server and database management tools, as well as microsoft office (word, excel and access). experience in a database programming function or similar information technology user services function ability to navigate enterprise server environments including familiarity with concepts associated with moving files between servers, accessing data over a network, security etc. windows operating system knowledge, command level experience and batch jobs key competencies demonstrated problem solving and analytical skills self-motivated and enjoy working in a team environment hold excellent interpersonal and communication skills strong attention to detail why work with us competitive remuneration global opportunities state-of-the-art offices casual dress, flexible work policy access to learning and development programs 3 days’ leave per year for charity initiatives global 36-hour hackathon table tennis, pool tables, meditation rooms up to 26 weeks’ paid parental leave for primary carers (up to 4 weeks for secondary carers), and the ability to work part-time when returning to work. employment type employee time type full time

title: document controller
description: overview / responsibilities wood is currently recruiting for two document controllers to join our team in melbourne. this role is responsible for providing all aspects of document control activities and ensuring that a high quality, customer focused service is provided to the organisation. controlling, issuing and distribution of all engineering and supplier documents completing document number requests, archiving and filing of hardcopies and scanning documents as required assist with the filing and project close-out of documents navigating and inputting data into a document management system receipt and control of information from client liaising with the client and other departments, giving recommendations as required promoting and providing general assistance of all aspects of document control activities skills / qualifications minimum of 2 years’ in an office administration system alignment with wood core values experience and detailed knowledge of supplier and epc project documentation processes significant computer literacy and knowledge of mainstream document management systems excellent attention to detail effective communication and relationship building skills candidates must have full work rights in australia to be considered for this role. if you’re an experienced document controller, ready for your next project, then we are keen to hear from you today. apply now and take the next step in your career with this exciting opportunity! company overview wood is a global leader in the delivery of project, engineering and technical services to energy and industrial markets. we operate in more than 60 countries, employing around 60,000 people, with revenues of over $10 billion. we provide performance-driven solutions throughout the asset life cycle, from concept to decommissioning across a broad range of industrial markets, including the upstream, midstream and downstream oil & gas, power & process, environment and infrastructure, clean energy, mining, nuclear, and general industrial sectors. www.woodplc.com diversity statement we are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. all suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: data scientist
description: the role as the data scientist, you will provides crucial support to our wider business as we devise a fully integrated and seamless customer experience through various online and offline marketing channels. reporting to the advanced analytics lead this unique role is integral in utilising advanced analytical techniques to assist in the delivery of strategic projects across the country road group and david jones brands. in this role you will: unlock incremental value within existing and new data assets through the use of advanced analytical technics such as; modelling for prediction modelling for discovery clustering and segmentation market mix modelling and basket/association modelling to inform and optimise decisions. advise and conduct analysis to support business decision making, including taking briefs, performing analysis and producing reports that enable effective decision making. manage the complete model life cycle (build, test, deploy, monitor) assist with commercial analysis as and when required mentor and share knowledge of techniques, applications and approaches with the wider analytical team the ideal candidate will have: proven data experience including segmentation, behavioural analysis and financial modelling expertise with coding in sas and r, and the use of bi and data visualisation tools (such as sas va). experience with other languages and platforms (e.g. python, lua, scala, tensorflow, matlab) would be advantageous. have demonstrated experience in successfully building, evaluating deploying and monitoring statistical models for data mining, predictive modelling, clustering, classification, deep learning, genetic algorithms, neural networks (mlp, convolutional, recurrent), nlp and text mining have demonstrated experience with big data and big data architecture (map reduce, hive, pig, spark) have developed expertise in database technologies and sql language for joining, querying and manipulating data sets are team oriented, and thrive in a collaborative and dynamic environment are comfortable operating in high change, ambiguous environments have excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, with the ability to influence stakeholders across the organisation why work for us? an opportunity to work with and learn from australia’s leading lifestyle/fashion retail group excellent career progression involving regular training and on the job development a genuine, open and high performing environment with a fun and energetic culture opportunity to become involved in our csr program, by supporting our community partnerships about us david jones and the country road group is australasia’s largest department store and fashion retail group comprising of iconic brands such as david jones, country road, politix, trenery, witchery and mimco. our values include being customer obsessed, collaborative, inspirational, responsible and dedicated to quality. we are looking for highly motivated and passionate individuals to be part of the group’s evolution and support each brand to realise their full potential.

title: administrative officer
description: reference: vg/20028319c state highway patrol (shp) (west) comes under the control of the assistant commissioner road policing command and forms part of the road policing operations and investigations division along with road policing drug and alcohol section (rpdas) and road crime investigations. the primary role of shp (west) is to provide low tolerance road enforcement across the state of victoria in cooperation with our road safety partners in an effort to reduce road trauma. it also provides a supporting role in emergency management when natural disasters occur, omcg focussed operations, regional road policing, large scale public events and diplomatic escorts. in this role you will be required to: ensure effective and expedient delivery of administrative support and activities associated within state highway patrol. report to the officer in charge (oic). state highway patrol (west). your duties will include: maintaining brief, correspondence and property entries in line with the harper application to ensure legislative compliance. maintaining and monitoring the movement of all returned/filed briefs with attached warrants of apprehension, including execution of warrants (ewok). approximately 24 separate activities per month. assisting in ensuring aim compliance. maintaining and monitoring accountable documents including register entries (infringement notice books, aim pads). assisting in the compilation of reportable monthly statistics. monitoring and compiling monthly report on budget spending. answering and directing/responding to phone enquiries. filing. liaising with tasking groups, complete rosters and tasking matrix preparing rosters for approval as the successful applicant, you will have: ability to maintain systematic and accurate administrative records. good computer skills, particularly in relation to word processing, data entry and software packages. proven ability in the prioritisation of work with minimal supervision. commitment and achievement in meeting a high level of customer service to all clients. good organisational skills with the ability to multi-task. requirements and relevant information: one (1) part time (0.5fte), ongoing position available. salary is pro-rata for part-time positions. your usual place of work within state highway patrol (west) located at the corio police complex. applicants must be an australian citizen, permanent resident or hold a valid work permit or visa. your application must include: resume, and; response to the key selection criteria – found in the position description attached to the job advertisement applications close midnight, thursday 22 august 2019 - no applications will be accepted via email. for further information on this role please contact: senior sergeant pat cleary on (03) 5273 9579 or via email partick.cleary@police.vic.gov.au if you have a disability/medical condition and require a copy of this advertisement and attached documentation in an accessible format or would like to discuss an access requirements/reasonable adjustment for the recruitment process, please contact vps recruitment via email vpsrecruitment@police.vic.gov.au or on (03) 9247 5113. about us: victoria police is a large organisation employing police, public servants and protective services officers. victoria police provides support to the community 24 hours a day, 365 days of the year. at victoria police our goal is for our workforce to reflect the diverse community we serve. we continually seek to attract and retain a diverse workforce which includes people of all genders, ages, religions, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and cultures including people of aboriginal and torres strait islander heritage. find out what it is like working as a victorian public servant for victoria police: https://www.police.vic.gov.au/vps  favourite job print share 11 jobs are currently listed for victoria police job type: part time job classification: vpsg2 contact: (03) 5273 9579 job attachments: 1. position description c0145.docx

title: permanent sso3 - east adelaide school - data manager
department: department for education and child development (decd)
description: position descriptor: please note the salary amount may differ from that advertised. salary is dependent upon your current employment status with the department for education, tenure and hours per week. the salary stated is based on an employee working 52 weeks per annum, full time equivalent. the successful applicant will be employed under the appropriate mode of employment. for application requirements, please refer to the application instructions. please note that part time and flexible arrangements will be considered. site: east adelaide school local partnership: adelaide - prospect tenure: 14/10/2019 ongoing hours per week: 37.5 roster: (may be negotiable) mon tue wed thu fri sat sun   starting 14/10/2019 7.50 7.50 7.50 7.50 7.50 0.00 0.00 classification: sso03 - sso level 3 conditions: $68,604 - $73,460 per annum fte / leave conditions major function(s) / skill(s): business manager / administrator school website: http://www.eas.sa.edu.au

title: data cleanser temp
description: who we are: jumpon.online is a new revolutionising online platform that redefines the way customers search and book for holidays online. the website is currently in the final stages of development and some finishing touches are needed.what are we looking for?the team at jumpon.online is looking for short term contract people who have a can do attitude, a keen eye for details, experience in data entry with a high level of accuracy and timeliness to join our fun and lively team on a temporary basis.what you\'ll need to succeed: proven ability to work in a team environment and independently as requiredaccurate and efficient data entry skillsstrong attention to detailhave a high level of computer literacyfast learnerability to commit to 3-4 weeks working monday to fridaywhat you\'ll get in return: in return you will receive an immediate start in atemporary role (3 – 4 weeks) within a leading tourism company, based in a modern office in central gold coast. casual rate of $25.91 per hour applies.what you need to do now: if this sounds like you and you are ready to hit the ground running, send us your application asap! interview start 19th august!applications close on august 21th, 2019no agents please.job type: temporary

title: hoyts sydney customer service
description: let’s talk about hoyts hoyts is creating the cinema of the future with customer service at the heart of the movie experience. our friendly and supportive agents are always available to lend a helping hand to ensure customer satisfaction. we are a hardworking bunch who get the job done with a smile on our face. the job: hoyts are on lookout for guest experience agents to join us in our sydney office. the role requires an excellent communicator with a can-do attitude, high attention to detail and a natural flair for customer service. daily you will utilising your problem solving skills to respond to emails, social media, web and phone queries relating to hoyts cinema. last year our team responded to over 50,000 customer queries with questions such as; “where can i park my helicopter at the cinema?”“i had an unhappy visit i made to the cinema in 1993 and would like a refund." no two days are the same and you will be joining a supportive and friendly team. the working hours are flexible and it’s a great way to expand your skill set. other key responsibilities include: reviewing and resolving complaints and enquiries in a timely, accurate and courteous mannerfollowing up on guest enquiries that aren’t immediately resolvedcompleting associated logs and reportsresearching misapplied payments and resolve in accordance with authority limitsrecognising and documenting trends in customer feedbacktraining, coaching and supporting other employees in customer servicehaving knowledge of products, prices, various promotional services and similar datamanaging the content for the hoyts customer service portal, zendesk who we are looking for: it goes without saying you’ll have a “can do” attitude and be an excellent communicator. organisation and time management are the keys to success in this position. the ideal candidate will also have: experience working in a professional environment or similar role is desirablecomputer literate with the ability to learn customer service software applicationsaccurate and efficient data entry abilitiesability to work under pressure to meet deadlinesexcellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skillsexpertise in prioritising goals, delivering key outcomes and having an analytical mindself-motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional teamability to work a 9am to 8pm rotating shift roster over 7 days, including weekends and weekdays, public holidays and peak holiday periods such as christmas, new years and easter benefits & culture: besides the incredible social events and networking opportunities, people love working at hoyts because it’s fun and lively with an unbeatable culture. most importantly you’ll be part of a hardworking and supportive team. if you’re not already sold, you’ll also receive 50c movie tickets and more amazing perks. think you’re up for it: if you are a people person and looking to join a creative team who are passionate about what they do and have a whole lot of fun along the way, then apply now! as part of the application upload a 60 second video to say hi and tell us why you are right for this role!

title: investigator
description: we offer our investigators a collaborative learning culture and hands-on knowledge and support to manage strategic compliance activities and meet key goals.  at least two ongoing positions base salary $68,884 plus 9.5% superannuation (vps grade 3) ballarat based the state revenue office we administer a range of taxes, duties, levies, grants and subsidies on behalf of the victorian government. the revenue we collect funds essential services including health care, education and social infrastructure. we are committed to excellence, customer service and developing our people and offer a collaborative and rewarding culture valuing teamwork and high performance. in return, you\'ll benefit from professional staff development, giving you the opportunity to learn, influence and contribute to your future and to the state revenue office. the role this investigator role, supported by senior mentors, conducts investigations which involve interpreting legislation, conducting research, and analysing data. in the role, you will make determinations on matters and produce accurate reports. key responsibilities reporting to a team leader investigations ballarat, you will be responsible for:  conducting investigations using audit and investigation skills, either individually or as part of a team. quantify liabilities under our revenue lines and explain the reasons for decisions to customers. produce accurate reports on investigations findings. the ideal candidate to be successful in this role, you will have:  the ability to interpret and apply legislation in a complex legal and commercial environment. theoretical knowledge and practical expertise in applying a range of investigative skills and techniques to obtain information and evidence. effective communication skills, with the ability to confidently communicate investigation outcomes to management and customers. a tertiary qualification or demonstrated commitment to tertiary studies in a relevant discipline is highly desirable. more information for more information, refer to the position description or phone shaun agius, area manager investigations ballarat, on 03 9628 6140. if you need a copy of this advertisement and attachments in an accessible format, such as large print, please email applications@sro.vic.gov.au. to apply to be considered for this role you must submit: a cover letter, completed application form (attached), and a current resume, via this website, by 5pm, friday 30 august 2019. if you are on seek, the position description and application form are available via the apply now button. note: as part of our selection process, we conduct pre-appointment checks including those related to references, identity, qualifications, work history, work visa, and police record history. there will be a probation review. if you are viewing this advertisement on seek, the position description and application form are available via the ‘apply now\' or ‘apply on company site\' buttons. these roles are being advertised internally and externally.

title: azure junior data engineer
description: job no: 504179 brand: travel experience network work type: full time location: queensland categories: business support job purpose the travel group (ttg), within the flight centre travel group (fctg), is on the hunt for our next junior azure data engineer gun. this is an exciting opportunity and for you to bring your energy and unique perspective to ttg, you will have the opportunity to grow with us professionally and personally and you will be part of a team that genuinely cares about helping you succeed. not to mention, you will be working with data that will impact our customers travel experience. you will be a part of the ttg business within the ttg it division. as a data engineer, you will use and be exposed to the latest microsoft tech! you will help collect, store and aid our data warehousing and data modelling crew to support business outcomes. you will be a critical part of the data supply chain, ensuring business partners have access to right analytics to help drive their business. you will also help design and build data pipelines utilising data factory and databricks notebooks to transform millions of records into action data models that enable data insights. to be successful, the candidate is expected to have: a passion for azure microsoft stack and willingness to grow knowledge of azure data factory, azure databricks, azure data lake, azure sql dw / sqldb, azure sql and t-sql ability to conduct data profiling, cataloging, data lineage and mapping for technical design and construction of technical data flows knowledge of dev-ops processes (including ci/cd) and infrastructure as code fundamentals knowledge of master data management (mdm) and data quality tools and processes working experience with vs code and git the team the ttg bi data warehousing team provides a range of services to ttg business partners and other internal stakeholders to fctg. the team is responsible for the ttg data warehouse development, devops (ci/cd) pipelines, etl development and are gate keepers of data within the ttg network. we ensure that our products are designed to meet best practice that exceeds internal customer expectations. to help achieve this we operate in an agile environment and we pride ourselves using the latest tech be it in devops or data engineering. accountabilities etl / data ingestion (data lake, blob, data bricks/factory) development of data pipelines and re-usable notebooks use of data factory and data bricks coding in sql/python, leveraging the spark processing engine. ensure design and structure of the data lake as per policy. develop and maintain data integration solutions to load and transform data. ensure standards to create reusable frameworks for data load and error handling is used. ensure incremental data loading patterns are applied. extracting data from various sources (api, sftp, azure blob, s3 bucket) assist in standard/governance and writing of technical documentation data warehouse work closely with internal bi team and domain knowledge experts to help scope upcoming technical work. assist technical scoping document on data sourcing, data structure and data model (conceptual, logical, and physical). learn to implement and maintain data warehouse (kimball) model and data marts knowledge on performance tuning on the data warehouse. ensuring data lineage is updated and assisting with mdm assisting with security, data protection and ensuring fctg policy is maintained devops and governance ensuring you operate within a structured environment (prod, stage and dev) and meet coding guidelines/standards working as an apart of agile development team with sprint planning and cycles manage develop and maintaining code within azure devops help maintain code quality, organisation and automation develop and execute test plans and scenarios including data design and data extract/transform be involved and complete qa items and peer reviews for sign off. ensure you learn and develop yourself to keep abreast of industry best practice skills and experience essential familiar with agile/scrum development life cycle process including analysis and design, software development, testing, implementation, maintenance, and support strong in sql, databases, and data modelling methodologies (kimball) knowledge of how changed data capture (cdc) works and how to make use of this within dwh knowledge of azure data factory, azure databricks, azure data lake, azure sql dw / sqldb, azure sql and t-sql ability to conduct data profiling, cataloging, data lineage and mapping for technical design and construction of technical data flows knowledge of master data management (mdm) and data quality tools and processes knowledge of dev-ops processes (including ci/cd) and infrastructure as code fundamentals version control – working knowledge of azure devops process, practical use of tools such as azure git working experience with visual studio and basic powershell scripting documentation – well vised in creating technical design documents, data flow diagrams recommended limitations in current technical development process and advised improvisations by eliminating redundant processes drafted technical specification documentations by mapping business requirements ensured all tasks met desired quality standards by using standardized development practices develop & support relational database (t-sql) and show recent querying experience degree/relevant qualification excellent verbal and written communication skill with a focus on customer service desirable workflow (jira, azure boards) & documentation (confluence) c#, phyton, usql, powershell and .net min 1-2 years’ experience in a commercial environment benefits include: generous remuneration structure travel discounts, in-house financial and health services, access to internal 24/7 gym global career opportunities in a network of brands and businesses ongoing training and professional development fun and flexible work environment proud corporate social responsibility platform through the flight centre foundation, responsible travel charter, and brighter futures programs monthly awards nights, conferences, industry/social events, and the opportunity to attend global balls we’re proud to have been recognised as an employer of choice in the australian business awards 2018, in addition to best agency group at the afta 2018 national travel industry awards

title: information & data solutions architect
description: about esta esta is the critical link between the victorian community and the state\'s emergency services agencies and it partners with the agencies to improve service delivery to the community. it provides victoria\'s 24-hour emergency call-taking and dispatch services for police, fire, ambulance and vicses and manages the provision of advanced, operational communications for police, ambulance, fire services and the ses. its vision is to be a high-performing team trusted by the community and our partners to deliver the right emergency response. and its central goal is to save lives and prevent harm through speed and accuracy in emergency operations. esta is currently implementing its integrated strategic plan (isp2023) setting esta\'s strategic direction, including a technology uplift and enablement. about the role this is an exciting time to join information technology services (its) team within esta. we launch our new information technology operating model to best meet the needs of esta and our stakeholders from july 2019 and your vision, experience and contribution as a senior member of the its team will be paramount to the success of esta now and into the future. as part of the its technical strategy and architecture team, this role will work closely with technology teams and with key business stakeholders and agency partners to drive information and data maturity across esta. with data integrity and data security at the forefront, this role will ensure that esta has a robust and strategic process in place for all collection and use of information through appropriate data governance and security. the variety and challenge in this role will come from the following duties:  lead information and data governance at esta by working closely with all relevant stakeholders and technical teams analyse and develop data processes to support the business review and approve new developments within the architecture design process establish an esta wide data strategy, data mapping process and define the data architecture which will have appropriate data models suitable for integrating our agency information develop, review and support systems and data solutions design and architectures work closely with project teams to ensure proposed changes are in line with our data governance processes and controls lead the development of business sme\'s and the maturity of information and data management with business stakeholders across esta as part of the its team, you may be required to travel or transfer between your primary work location and other esta sites to effectively carry out your duties. about you this is an exciting new role at esta for an experienced solutions architect within the information and data management domain. you have demonstrated experience in leading and developing information solutions, architecture and designs, ideally within an itil environment and 24 x 7 operation. you have working knowledge and experience with data management frameworks (dama dmbok) and strong analytical skills to translate your findings and analyse into data solutions and solution architecture designs. you will also have experience working with waterfall and agile methodologies. you are comfortable at presenting information to senior management and detailing your findings, with the ability to breakdown complex concepts to all levels of the business. for this reason, you must have excellent written and verbal communication skills. your confident interpersonal skills have the ability to influence others to change their current way of working, to new and improved business processes. please review the job description and criteria for further details before submitting your application. what we can offer you  a job that\'s challenging and exciting an opportunity to develop and grow a high performing team a role that makes a vital contribution to the victorian community through a high-performance workforce belong to a connected and highly supportive team competitive pay and benefits flexible working arrangements to work around our business needs and your lifestyle how to apply applicants should prepare a statement outlining their expression of interest and a current resume displaying relevant experience. this statement should outline why you are interested in the role, as well as addressing the selection criteria outlined in the position description. click the \'apply\' button to be taken to esta\'s online application portal. applications will close at midnight on sunday 1 september 2019.

title: the interagency graduate program
description: do your part for the communitymake your mark on industrybe a future leader in economic developmentthe department of mines, industry regulation and safety (dmirs) and the department of jobs, tourism, science and innovation (jtsi) have come together to create an award-winning interagency graduate program.our 18-month graduate program aims to build the skills, experience and networks required for a successful career in the public sector. a customised rotational plan exposes graduates to a range of opportunities both internal and external to the department. the graduates support team, includes a sponsor, a mentor, a coordinator and fellow graduate buddies who will guide participants through the experience alongside a comprehensive learning and development program. the program concludes with the opportunity for a permanent position. initial employment is on a fixed term contract with provision for permanent appointment following successful completion of the first twelve months of the program.to learn more about the interagency graduate program, visit our website.we are hiring 8 recent graduates with various bachelor degrees for our 2020 intake.the department of mines, industry regulation and safety (dmirs) are looking for graduates with a bachelor degree in the following fields:information management (record management) or business information systems – graduate officer corporate information managementindustrial or employment relations – graduate officer private sector labour relationsspatial science (spatial analytics) or computer science (software development) – graduate officer business innovationeconomics, computer science, data science or spatial science – graduate officer business systemscivil engineering with a focus on structural engineering - graduate officer building and energyengineering or science (relevant to the operations of highly complex safety critical industry sectors) – graduate officer dangerous goods and critical risksthe links above provide further detail on each position. to learn more about dmirs and what we have to offer, please visit our website.the department of jobs, tourism, science and innovation (jtsi) are looking for graduates with a bachelor degree in the following fields:economics, commerce, public policy or related equivalent with an interest in international markets and related statistics – graduate officer strategic policyarts (anthropology, history, politics, international relations), commerce, communication, economics, law, science or related equivalent – graduate officer science and innovationthe links above provide further detail on each position. to learn more about jtsi and what we have to offer, please visit our website.what are we looking for in a graduate?a willingness to take on feedback and develop expertise to deliver work outcomesthe ability to research, analyse and interpret informationa team player who builds positive relationshipsan effective communicator who can use a variety of mediums for a diverse audiencean individual who consistently demonstrates the values of being respectful, responsive, forward-thinking, transparent, fair and ethicalthe graduate program is an equity and diversity employment initiative. therefore we are actively looking for recent university graduates from any of the following diversity groups to be a part of our january 2020 intake:people 24 years and underpeople with disabilityaboriginal and/or torres strait islander peopleto be considered for the program, you must: be an australian citizen or permanent residenthave completed your bachelor degree in the current or preceding calendar year, in a discipline relevant to position you are applying forcomplete an online application form and attach a copy of your academic record, your cv including the names and contact details of two referees and provide a cover letter (maximum two - three pages). please note:  your cover letter must address the specific questions related to the position you are applying for. please read the specific job advertisement hyperlinked above.to find out more and to apply for a position: for detailed information on the different graduate officer positions available and the required application process, please read the individualised job advertisement for each graduate officer position hyperlinked above. you can apply direct through the individualised job advertisement using the ‘apply now’ button.alternatively, you can visit www.jobs.wa.gov.au,select ‘department of mines, industry regulation and safety’ or ‘department of jobs, tourism, science and innovation’ from the agency menu then select ‘graduate’ from the occupation menu.all applications are to be lodged through www.jobs.wa.gov.au. you can lodge your application directly through the individual position advertisement hyperlinked above.individuals interested in applying for more than one position, must submit a separate application for each position.your application submission must be complete by the closing time, applications that are in progress or submitted after this time will not be accepted. it is your responsibility to ensure your application is submitted on time.for more information about the graduate program, the application process or documents in an alternate format, please contact natalie garland, graduate program coordinator on (08) 9222 3866.to learn more about the department and what we have to offer, please visit our website.closing date: 4.00 pm on monday, 9 september 2019 (wst)job types: full-time, permanentsalary: $69,869.00 to $75,717.00 /year

title: big data architect - melbourne
description: introduction your role and responsibilities big data architect - melbourne  ibm global business services (gbs) is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences in cognitive, data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. with global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, ibm gbs empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge in the cognitive era in over 170 countries. as a big data architect for ibm, you will have the unique opportunity to bring ibm collateral and your experience together and enhance the value that we bring clients. in this position, you will work directly with internal ibm partners and external clients to determine their business issues and recommend information management solutions that drive business value. you will use your consulting skills, analytical expertise, and business knowledge to determine business objectives, as well as processes, measurements and appropriate tools for formulating hypotheses and testing conclusions that result in the best solution for business needs. what will i be doing? lead data solutioning, consulting, architecture and delivery engagements across industry sectors demonstrate leadership capabilities in strategy and architecture on complex engagements in global environments formulate a strategic vision and a tactical roadmap to address client\'s critical data requirements in conformance with overall corporate objectives serve as a subject matter expert available to accelerate sales and delivery in high growth analytics areas champion the use of data, cognitive and analytics to realize strategic insights to help drive cross-business unit initiatives focused primarily on revenues generation, effectiveness and efficiencies. a robust information architecture is a foundational capability to any analytics / ai program and this role will require strong linkage to the wider advanced analytics, ai and cognitive teams. what skills will i need? solid background in data and analytics space ability to size and develop / validate physical architecture of data platform working knowledge in business strategy and research ability to lead in a highly collaborative and team-oriented environment ability to manage multiple projects in parallel proven track record in pre-sales, consulting, architecture, solutioning and implementation what experience will i need? should have 8 to 10+ years of it working experience at least 4 years’ experience in complex architecture, strategy consulting and big data architecture work, information governance experience in developing enterprise information architecture experience in developing data lake / modern data platform solutions experience in data governance and data strategy work experience in developing architectures with open source tools and technologies for big data experience with major hadoop distributions - cloudera, hortonworks, mapr or cloud based hadoop distributions aws emr, azure hdinsight experience in sql, spark, python and scala good understanding and experience with the traditional dw architecture solutions experience in implementing use cases for hadoop - dw augmentation and data exploration experience and knowledge of traditional dw database platforms – db2, oracle, sql server, netezza and teradata must have ability to travel extensively, at short notices and perhaps extended time periods must have self-drive to lead initiatives and multitask permanent residency to live and work in australia ready to join us? to be part of a diverse and global team of thinkers and leaders - people who want to make an impact, share their expertise and collaborate with some of the world’s top business and technology professionals. keep reading. sign me up! if you tick these boxes and are ready to start your next challenge with a career at ibm – click “apply” today. to find out more, head to www.ibm.com.au/careers  required professional and technical expertise as above preferred professional and technical expertise as above about business unit your life @ ibm about ibm location statement being you @ ibm ibm is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. ibm is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: data communications apprenticeship
description: data communications apprenticeshipsneca careers & apprenticeships are not only recruiting candidates to commence data communications apprenticeships in september 2019, they are also encouraging apprentices of all year levels to apply.about the opportunitywork in an industry with a variety of career pathwaysearn while you learngain a nationally recognised qualificationbe part of a diverse, advanced industryreceive expert support & mentoringneca careers and apprenticeships (nca) was established by the national electrical and communications association (neca) of south australia / northern territory. nca is dedicated to the electrotechnology industry and is committed to providing the right people to fulfil the skills needs of today and for the future.as an apprentice you\'ll work with a host employer, earning a wage and working alongside experienced staff to gain job-specific skills. a dedicated apprentice coordinator will perform regular workplace visits, ensuring you are being trained, supported and developed in the workplace as well as being provided with extensive work health and safety support.you will have the opportunity to work with a range of different host employers and experience different aspects of the communications industry. apprentices also attend a registered training organisation (rto) to receive training and work towards nationally recognised qualifications.about youan australian citizen or permanent residentsuccessfully completed pre vocational program or vet in schools programhold a current drivers licence and have own transport or be prepared to obtainprepared to undertake a pre-employment medical assessment which may include a full functional capacity assessment and drug screenprepared to obtain a dcsi child related employment
