title: junior assistant
description: kerden haulage pty ltd is currently seeking a junior office clerk to work at our busy head office in south nowra. we are an establishedtransport company looking to employ a reliable, self-motivated individual who is willing to work as part of a team. this is a full time position.as a junior office assistant you will be the first point of contact for all customers. this is an excellent opportunity to grow your customer service experience, and build on your communication skills by developing strong relationships with our clients.duties will include but not limited to: customer servicecounter and phone salesdata entryadministrationaccounts assistantmoney handlingsuccessful candidates need to have: the ability to learn quickly and adapt to situations as required.excellent customer service skillsgood attention to detaila flexible approach whilst being both punctual and reliable.strong computer skills.job experience is not necessary.if this sounds like you, and you meet the above requirements then please click on the apply button below and submit your resume.please note: only applicants successful in making it through to the next recruitment stage will be contactedjob type: full-timework eligibility:the candidate can work permanently with no restriction on hours (required)job type: full-timework eligibility:no work eligibility is required, i am willing to sponsor the right candidate (e.g. visa) (preferred)

title: people data analyst
description: people data analyst - 6 month fixed term contract our story: the woolworths group has been focused on levering digital and data to create better team and customer experiences. we want to create shopping experiences that are personalised, seamless and convenient, and for that we need an empowered, engaged and capable team. to help achieve that goal, we have a people insights team that use our wealth of people data to better understand what our teams need to thrive. what we do: we are part of the people delivery office at woolworths - a team that gets work done while having fun and maintaining balance. as part of the people reporting and insights team, you will collaborate closely with a team of experienced people data analysts/scientists. together, we will make sense of excitingly complex and multifaceted data. we want to be known for delivering reports and insights that are timely, solid and impactful. given the complexity and volume of data that we work with (as a reminder, woolworths employs about 200.000 people), we increasingly need to rely on state-of-the-art and custom-built automated reports, dashboards and insights-generating algorithms. that is where you come in. where we are: our team is based at the eight mile plains technology park, a short drive south of brisbane. this new site has been designed to support flexible working with spaces that facilitate collaboration, video conferencing, brainstorming or just having a yarn. there is ample parking and the site can be reached by bike or public transport as well. what we are looking for: the purpose of this role is to develop and productionize reports, dashboards and algorithms to make sense of our people and performance data. working together with a team of experienced hr analysts and a data scientist, you will work out technical solutions that make more data available to the business while reducing manual work. you will also help the team out with ad hoc requests for data raised by culture and people partners and you will work on developing more advanced insights and solutions to automatically mine our wealth of data for relevant information. the roles key objectives include: develop, test and productionize automated reports and dashboards in gcp that were previously run out of successfactors, spinifex, salesforce or other people data source systems. organise automated access to reports and dashboards through detailed role-based permissions in gcp. assist others in the team in transitioning to state-of-the-art data mining and insights generation. make people data available to culture and people partners and other clients throughout the business. this involves keeping track of cases as they are raised through salesforce, engaging with clients to understand their needs in detail, and delivering the data safely and efficiently. design and develop new dashboards in collaboration with business clients and other analysts to replace commonly requested reports. this will include setting up automated processes for refreshing the data behind the dashboards and for keeping role-based permissions up to date. assist our data scientist by supporting the more complex work underway and/or drive your own data science initiative(s).  who you are: you are a team player who is driven to achieve the best result and is excited about digging through data and turning it into insights for a larger audience. you’re curious and empathetic, and the prospect of improving the working lives of thousands of australians through data energises you. you deal with complexity by collaborating with colleagues, listening to business partners, testing ideas and continuously learning. you take authorship for and pride in what you create, and are open to feedback when a work product needs to evolve. our business moves fast and moves often, so we all have to be nimble and able to work in an ambiguous and constantly changing environment. what\'s in it for you: the opportunity to contribute to the transformation of our people data team - which is part of one of the largest hr shared services centres in australia. experience that is increasingly wanted in the marketplace: leveraging people data is rising to the top of the priority list of many business leaders; your contributions to our transformation will serve your career well. training and education: we pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential and give you the opportunity to be innovative. you will have the opportunity to improve your skills in working with the google cloud platform (bigquery, datastudio, dataprep, etc.) and tableau; both are among the fastest growing analytics, big data and visualisation platforms available in the market. you will be given access to and time for attending relevant online courses, and go on a learning journey together with the rest of the team. a great working environment: the eight mile plains support office is a great place to work, located in a beautiful part of the country. we care for our team and their well-being and strive to maintain a healthy balance between work and fun. we’re social! - connect with us through linkedin #li , facebook or via www.wowcareers.com.au

title: production technician - high potent
description: production technician – high potent (full time | fixed term) operations department: high potent team (mulgrave location). limited fixed term technician positions available across all shifts: day, afternoon & night. enjoy the satisfaction and rewards of doing work with meaning – for now and the future. harness your resilience to take on challenges and turn them into opportunities. exciting opportunities have arisen for highly motivated and mechanically minded individuals to join the high potent operations team. in a dynamic world of pharmaceuticals, the production technician is key to our equipment maintenance and the manufacture of aseptic medically necessary products. if you are looking for a role that can find you a purpose in life and drive others to achieve, then keep reading and learn more about pfizer and our aspiring high performing operations teams. pfizer is the world\'s leading provider of injectable drugs and infusion technologies. through our broad, integrated portfolio, we continue to improve patient and caregiver safety while reducing healthcare costs. our mulgrave manufacturing facility is the flagship site for the supply of critical care of oncology and high potency sterile pharmaceuticals. as a proud australian manufacturer we continuously improve our quality, safety and technical capabilities to ensure we deliver affordable healthcare, reliable supply and effective products for critical care medicines around the world. a role at pfizer melbourne is unlike any other. offering talented individuals the opportunity to own a career with real impact, our people go to work each day in the knowledge that every development signifies real, positive progress. our team is made up of resilient leaders aiming to drive step change in a highly complex and innovative manufacturing environment to deliver high value product to our patients across the globe. if you have equipment experience, are passionate, inspiring, courageous, resilient and work collaboratively … then we want you in our team as we aim to improve the health of people across the globe!!! production technician performs duties similar to an operator, will include but are not limited to: maintaining training compliance and adhering to all relevant site procedures. maintain hygiene standards including gowning and aseptic techniques. follow processes and operate equipment in an efficient manner ensuring reliable and consistent operation producing quality output which meets all quality standards. execute production operator duties including vial washing, equipment/component preparation, product mixing, formulation, filling, in process testing, equipment, machine and room cleaning. working with qualified production operators to complete machine changeovers, set up, operation and adjustments. provide line support during operational start-up, be the first line of defense when technical variation or issues develop under normal production conditions, responding to and rectifying basic breakdowns in a timely manner. ensure proactive and on time completion of basic preventative maintenance activities during machine turnarounds based on the production schedule minimizing line downtime. assess overall equipment effectiveness (oee) and scheduled adherence program effectiveness against area targets using available process metrics (oee, right first time, run time efficiency) escalating when new parts/repairs are required based on machine performance and data. ensure the mean time between failure and basic repair of equipment is minimized and conduct predominately production activities, selected preventative maintenance, changeovers, basic fault diagnosis, basic repairs, condition monitoring and training (excluding electrical repairs which will be completed by a qualified electrician). accurate and timely documentation of works completed in batch records, logbooks and online systems relating to equipment repairs to preventative maintenance activities. support where possible original equipment manufacturer (oem) standards and train production staff in format change/equipment operation improvements. undertake an active role in the identification and implementation of process and equipment improvements and efficiencies to reduce cost/waste. work closely with maintenance/reliability/engineering escalating ongoing issues in a timely manner to minimize downtime and return to standard operation as quickly a possible. participate in m1 (root cause analysis, problem solving) equipment related investigations and share knowledge and experience with team members. identify any product or process nonconformance, taking appropriate escalation actions. post personal qualification assist in the continued delivery of training to new team members. this is a manual handling role with much of the day spent standing. to be considered you will have: completed year 12 or equivalent. trade qualification or on the job mechanical/electrical experience. qualification in engineering or equivalent experience in the pharmaceutical industry. proven ability to work collaboratively with maintenance and engineering departments. demonstrated ability to plan and organize self and others. demonstrated ability in working in a team environment to achieve production goals. excellent communication skills (verbal and written) and be results focused. a high degree of attention to detail, particularly in relation to documentation completion. sound interpersonal, decision making and problem solving skills. ability to work under pressure and to agreed timelines. understanding of quality systems as they apply to good manufacturing practice systems. basic computer skills. permanent rights to work within australia. pass a full police check and medical assessment with no known allergies to antibiotics. for night shift applicants you must have previous night shift experience. preferred qualifications and experience: demonstrated experience in production processes in the pharmaceutical or allied industries. demonstrated training experience. please include a cover letter addressing your suitability for the role, including confirmation of your permanent rights to work within australia and a current resume. by joining pfizer you will partner with colleagues of diverse backgrounds and abilities, people who contribute to all aspects of what we do —from drug development to marketing, technology to sales, and so much more. interested? then apply now . all applications will be considered based upon merit. applications close: friday 30th august 2019 pfizer is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.

title: parts assembly and warehouse hand
description: we are a 4wd parts supplier & manufacturer, we are looking for someone to join our warehouse team.duties will include:picking, packing, ordering from suppliers, checking inwards goods, assembling parts, cleaning, data entry and other warehousing duties.must be fit and capable of lifting heavy itemsplease send resume to the address listedjob type: full-timesalary: $40,000.00 to $50,000.00 /yearexperience:assembly & warehouse: 1 year (preferred)

title: administration and customer assistant
description: start a new journey of success with enttecwho we are: enttec is the leading australian manufacturer of lighting controllers and led solutions. enttec started as a family owned business that has flourished into an international masterpiece. with offices in australia, us and the uk, the company continues to grow and expand. enttec has a strong reputation not just for engineering expertise but for fine craftsmanship and technical innovation. enttec is leading the way to the future of led lighting solutions and lighting controllers.enttec prides itself on the diversity in the workplace. we believe that working alongside people of different backgrounds, experiences and working style creates a work environment where modern creative concepts can inspired. when a diverse team work together to reach a shared objective, perfection can be created. an inclusive culture where communication is open and done with sensitivity and integrity is very important to enttec. we operate as a cross-functional team using agile and lean practices to perfect our procedures.with open communication enttec gives freedom for employees to explore and try new things, encouraging employees to reflect on ways to improve and optimise different aspects of work.we believe our employees are our greatest asset and we appreciate each team members unique qualities, experience and knowledge.we are on the hunt for a like- minded individual to join the administration and customer service team as an administration and customer service assistant.the opportunity: as enttec’s new administration and customer service assistant you will complete administration duties and work on minor customer service responsibilities. you will have a willingness to learn and have strong skills in communication, prioritising and attention to detail. a large part of your responsibility will be liaising with the offices in the uk and the us ensuring that communication is tended to in a timely manner and their concerns are being addressed as well ensure orders are registered and meet the lead time required.what you’ll do: reporting to the customer service team leaderyou will be responsible for:liaising & customer service: liaising with the uk and the us offices as well as the production team to ensure orders are registered and co-ordinate dispatchliaising with international suppliers to follow up on orders, shipments and po’sdata entryprocessing new sales orders by entering orders in erp systementering and qualifying leads in sales forceorganise and book shipmentsproviding shipping information to customers, uk and us officesadministration & invoicing: answer phone and direct calls/ take messages where necessary, be the first point of contactcreate and modify customer invoices in various accounting platformsmaintain safe and clean reception areamonitor and maintain weekly stationary/ kitchen suppliesplace orders for consumable and other raw materialsbe aware of the company policies and methods of workmanaging rma (return material authorisation)follow up suppliers when neededmeet and greet visitorsgeneral administration dutieswhat you bring: 2-year experience in administration or similar roleadministrative qualificationsmastered the art of computer techniques specifically in excel, word, internet and office 365the ability to work unsupervised and show initiativeimpeccable verbal and written communication skillshigh attention to detailability to organise and manage multiple prioritiesnice to have: a technical background, or a keen interest in new technologies and led lightsaccounting and finance knowledgeknowledge of erp system and salesforceculture and perksworking environment that is designed to be diverse and engaginga culture of experimentation and creative freedoma full- time permanent role, starting asapknowledge sharing and cross-training when possibleworking with amazing peoplenot two days will be the samebe part of a team who care and support one anotherour valuesbe ahead of the curvebe proactive and seek solutionsalways innovate and improvecommit to excellence in everything we dodemonstrate an inclusive environment that embraces differencesthis is your chance to work in a creative and high achieving team, if you have what it takes, apply now!click on “apply now” and attached your application (cover letter and cv), telling us why you would be perfect for this role. can’t wait to hear from you!job types: full-time, permanentsalary: $40,000.00 to $45,000.00 /yearexperience:administration: 2 years (preferred)work eligibility:the candidate can work permanently with no restriction on hours (preferred)

title: junior graphic designer (typesetting / publication)
description: junior graphic designer (typesetting / publication) the company edrolo is a market-leading edtech startup based in melbourne. our founders shared a desire to improve education that began the company in 2013, and has sustained growth to well over 100 people today. we continue to work closely with schools and educators to constantly improve our platform, analytics, and resources. resources include our meticulously researched textbooks, question banks, and video theory – all with full syllabus coverage and designed to accommodate as wide a range of learning and teaching styles as possible. the role and requirements we\'re looking for individuals based in melbourne, to work onsite from our fitzroy office in a temporary capacity. those individuals would join a fast-paced, professional environment, with a culture that celebrates honest feedback, personal growth, and innovation. as part of a product team they will collaborate closely with designers, content producers, educators, and product managers to deliver a specialised textbook that integrates with our digital resources. we are partway through production and are looking to grow the team to improve our ability to deliver the best products we can to schools. the role involves a range of book production tasks, including layout design and typesetting, digital illustration (diagrams and other graphics), prepress preparation, and peer review quality assurance. you would be expected to autonomously pick up and complete work, collaboratively problem solve with your team, and keep relevant production spreadsheet data up to date. the focus of the role is the timely and accurate creation of print ready book pages in indesign using template stylesheets and specifications, and the design of illustrations to support the material. under guidance from the product manager, the individual would be expected to coordinate with their team and others to ensure their time is spent most effectively. we are looking for an individual who: is available to work onsite in office hours is passionate about typesetting is respectful and conscientious about their behaviour and conduct is confident, independent and self-motivated values both quality and efficiency is willing to take initiative and solve problems themselves has excellent verbal and written communication skills believes in our mission to improve education requisite skills and experience strong attention to detail strong collaborative problem solving skills knowledge of adobe indesign cc with a strong portfolio of publications work strong layout and typographic skills digital illustration experience with adobe illustrator design qualification (desirable: bachelor\'s degree in communication design) comfortable working in a rapidly evolving startup environment comfortable with computers and technology comfortable working under pressure and adhering to deadlines existing knowledge of prepress desirable, but not necessary the offer casual position 30 - 40 hrs p/w ideally fixed days in the week hourly rate determined based on experience + 9.5% super immediate start projected to last until november potential for ongoing work for exceptional designers, pending available work potential to expand into other areas of content production for interested candidate e.g. video editing, digital content publication flexible start and finish times use of a company laptop and software licenses can be provided if required regular team events, dinners, and drinks next steps if this role sounds exciting to you, we would love to see your application! submit your application by hitting the apply now button, or head over to the junior graphic designer listing at edrolo.com.au/jobs, and convince us you have what it takes to be successful in this role. while we appreciate all applications, being a small business means we cannot get back to all applicants, so only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: senior data network engineer
description: senior data network engineer - wireless reece is an australian icon. you probably know us as australia\'s largest supplier of plumbing and bathroom products. we have been around for almost 100 years. but that\'s just one side of us. we\'re a major public company with over 6,000 people, 600 locations and more than 10 business lines. we thrive on new ideas and have the courage to make them happen. our reecetech team work in a customer-focused, innovative way, collaborating with the wider business to improve the lives of our customers and our people by striving for greatness every day. we’re determined to lead the industry in software development and technology solutions, and constantly support our teams to explore and grow through experimentation, hackathons, learning and community involvement. about the role we are looking for an experienced senior data network engineer to join our voice & data network team for 6 months while we go through a period of growth and change to focus on our wireless network. key responsibilities of the role include but are not limited to: focus on the configuration review of the admin office and branches consolidation of wlcs for dcs and branches take responsibility and be the escalation point for wireless faults with a focus on improving performance and availability slas for connected endpoints process improvements for troubleshooting and analysis reporting improvements for client performance metrics work on enhancing our bau wireless network support get involved in projects around reducing/consolidating some of our wireless infrastructure across the business about you to be successful in this role you will have proven experience in wireless networks. essential to your success includes: the ability to establish strong relationships and work effectively in a team a proven track record and experience in a similar role with cisco wireless controller specialization wireless experience in large enterprise environments using both central and local switching demonstrable cisco wireless voice experience at least ccnp level certification with ccnp wireless preferred high level of experience in configuration and administration of cisco routers / switches (ios) high level of experience with qos and application visibility in enterprise wireless and wired networks with a focus on voice (cisco and skype for business / teams) sound ability to create and update existing documentation and create high and detailed design proposals demonstrable experience monitoring and troubleshooting client connectivity in high density cisco wireless networks (wlc) experience with 802.1x authentication solutions (acs / ise, clearpass) knowledge of cisco wireless networks (enterprise, flexconnect environment) and aruba wireless networks products if you have a strong client delivery focus, love a variety of work, have a professional attitude and approach and you are looking for a challenge that you can throw yourself into where you can really make a difference, please apply now! how can you build a career with reece. reece is different. we\'re a successful company that doesn\'t like to make a fuss of our success. we\'re a big business that works hard to retain the great things from when we were a small business. we value common sense as highly as a university degree. we encourage people to have a go and don\'t mind if they fail. we promote people based on performance, not age. reece is a place where people make a real difference. and that\'s the secret to our success - having the right people, with the right attitude in the right roles. we\'re looking for the right people now. people who like people. people who like to talk but also like to listen. people who like to perform. people who can recognise an opportunity and seize it. people who are prepared to promote themselves. read on. you will quickly discover whether you might be the right person, and whether we might be the right place for your career. if you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you\'ll enjoy your career with us!

title: business analyst - data
description: about the company terra firma has been engaged to deliver a large scale program of work and is building a team of business (data) analysts with previous experience delivering proof of concepts and working within large scale integration programs of work.  5+ years as a business (data) analyst extensive experience with data and the ability to analyse various platforms and systems to extract information to present in a detailed and simple format for key decision makers experience analysing various data sets to determine ongoing and upcoming trends, and providing recommendations experience in the extraction and transformation of large and complex datasets previous experience in data profiling, cleansing, quality, matching and transformation of data across multiple datasets and systems skills in business analysis requirements such as gathering and documentation, data specifications and dictionaries strong communication skills (oral, written and visual) with the ability to tailor your style to suit the audience you are working with. ability to identify and influence stakeholders at all levels to reach the desired outcome, enabling you to work effectively in complex environments. practical understanding of project delivery lifecycles, methodologies and governance practices (including agile). about you we\'re looking for talented business analysts with a background in data. you will need to be results-oriented and have a collaborative mindset about us at terra firma we aim to help you achieve your best by providing: a strong support networks interesting client work diverse clients fantastic employee benefits team member development opportunities a strong team culture if you possess the above skills and are looking for an opportunity to work with an exciting client and project please feel free to contact yael on (03) 8611 5099.

title: master scheduler
description: slade health is a national provider of sterile compounding services from its three tga licenced manufacturing facilities based in victoria, queensland and new south wales. as a well-established and respected industry name, slade has been producing aseptically compounded pharmaceutical products including chemotherapy, analgesic and antibiotic drugs, for use by patients in hospitals for over 50 years. slade health have a unique opportunity for a master scheduler/ planner with a difference. the bespoke and customised nature of our services, combined with short lead times and product expiries, provides unique challenges in the planning and scheduling of production. this role will be responsible for developing and implementing a suite of planning tools to be used routinely for decision making to realise the significant efficiency, wastage savings and capacity utilisation opportunities available. offered initially as a full time 12 month contract and reporting directly to the general manager, the successful outcome of the project will likely lead to a permanent position being created. there is flexibility for the role to be based at any of our sites; geebung qld, mount kuring-gai nsw or mount waverley vic. we’re looking for a curious and highly analytical individual who is able work with complex data, distil this into simple solutions and educate users. the role will work closely with key stakeholders in our production, systems and commercial teams. it’s essential that the successful candidate have significant experience and track record of delivering planning solutions in a similar production environment. this is not a push button planning role and will provide the successful candidate with an opportunity to apply advanced planning skills to a unique and rewarding set of challenges. an understanding of relational databases and specifically t-sql language queries would be highly regarded. if you think you have the qualities we are looking for, we want to hear from you! in submitting your application, please attach a resume and include a cover letter explaining what has attracted you to apply for the role. further information on our business can be found on our website www.sladehealth.com.au

title: data ethics and change lead
description: work in a fun, highly engaged, multidisciplinary squad to achieve incremental and innovative improvements be part of anz’s agile project practices empower, lead and coach your chapter team members location: 833 collins street, docklands vic role type: permanent full time opportunity enterprise data governance is a function within group data | digital, with a remit across the entire organisation to uplift the capability of data management and data governance through implementation of an effective data governance framework.  the role will involve the leadership of a team of experts in data culture and change, and in data ethics. with respect to data change, you will be responsible for creating the strategy, and delivering upon your strategy for implementing awareness and learning artefacts to continuously build on our enterprise knowledge of good data management practice. with respect to data ethics, you will be responsible for creating the strategy for building and implementing our data ethics guidelines for use across the organisation. this will require building a team of experts that are able to conduct research into where there are challenges in data ethics, investigate and document our data bias tolerances, define our lenses for ethical review such as invasiveness, surveillance and fairness, and transcribe that into guiderails for safe and ethical data use. this will be for both personal data ethics, and business data ethics.  what will be in your toolkit? you will possess strong leadership skills in maintaining an energised team that has a strong customer focus, excellent engagement skills and suitable expertise you will have an adaptive mindset, open to learning and mastering new skills you will have a strong track record in change strategy you have the ability to problem-solve with transparent structured thinking and synthesis of relevant details you will have excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to build strong stakeholder relationships both internally and externally you will have excellent time management and organisational capabilities  be part of our journey, it’s not just a job at anz, everything we do boils down to ‘why’ – our purpose – to shape a world where people and communities thrive. we\'re just as focused on seeing our people thrive as well as our customers. we\'ll give you every opportunity to develop your career. we are responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter the most, energising our people, eliminating waste and reducing bureaucracy.  anz has started to move to a new way of working, leveraging agile practices. to understand more about this new way of working and if this role is right for you, we strongly encourage you to take a look at the anz way vimeo channel where you’ll find ‘the anz way’ animation and the ‘new ways of working’ animation.

title: data warehousing engineer
description: data warehouse engineer – melbourne who is cyara? as the world’s leading customer journey management platform provider, cyara accelerates the delivery of flawless customer journeys across digital and voice channels while reducing the risk of customer-facing defects. every day, the most recognizable brands in the world trust the cyara platform to deliver customer smiles at scale. what we’re looking for: cyara is looking for a high performing data warehouse engineer to build a data warehouse and deliver infrastructure to produce data-driven insights to cyara customers about the performance of their customer journeys. this involves designing and building a data warehouse and associated analytical tools for a variety of user communities. data will be aggregated across many enterprises and to provide valuable insights to cyara and its customers. you will take ownership for the end-to-end data flow, processing and retention in the data warehouse and will empower cyara’s cloud operations team (including a partnering dba) to provide 24x7 vigilance over the warehouse and associated etl and purging processes. you will also participate in a larger team developing downstream applications and data visualization components. you will join a fast-paced agile/scrum product development process and work with cross-functional teams to design, build, document and roll-out products that execute a critical element in cyara’s corporate strategy to expand its market and become trusted thought leaders for our clients. specific experience and capabilities required experience in designing and maintaining data warehouses ability to create scalable etl jobs experience with event driven processing and tools such as apache kafka proven experience in data modeling and implementing data marts experience in setting up monitoring for etl jobs constant lookout and proven experience with evolving needs for sourcing, standardizing and cleansing data demonstrated understanding of data engineering and data integration ability to identify and troubleshoot operational issues within a warehouse environment coordinate with qa to produce test plans and test automation that ensures the accuracy of etl tasks and support system integration testing ability to collaborate cross-functionally and work well in a distributed, team-oriented environment experience with sql and nosql databases experience with cloud-based data warehouse and databases such as amazon redshift, postgresql, mysql, mongodb and others experience in design and development of sql server analysis services (ssas) cubes experience in working with dba’s on tuning queries and databases experience in integrating into production data backup processes understanding of best practices in managing enterprise data including master data, data quality, lineage and security strong verbal and written communication skills enthusiastic about evaluating new database technologies to gain competitive advantages throughout cyara’s data pipeline experience working with high volume non-relational event data ideally working in both the event stream capture, and complex data correlation and analytics. responsibilities: designing and developing high-performing data warehouses and etl processes working with a dba and noc in troubleshooting issues related to warehouses and etl processes/jobs setting up effective monitoring to make sure that data warehouse is always up and running and healthy write sql and stored procedures for reports and data aggregation optimizing and tuning data-cleansing algorithms, queries and databases contribute to ensuring the security of the data while in motion and at rest ability to work with technical precision under tight deadlines personal initiative and independence in achieving outcomes ability to work effectively within an agile team environment doing continuous testing ability to produce high quality, well documented software artefacts willingness to accept a wide range of responsibilities, including technical leadership of the corporate big data strategy  culture fit: you are the kind of person who acts with integrity in all you do, you value people and establish trusted relationships, you care deeply about the customer experience and pride yourself on delivering an elevated level of service, you are highly organized and responsive, you are proactive and always seeking improvement and never satisfied with the status quo, you have an eye for attention to detail, you are comfortable moving fast and making decisions quickly, you value individuals but are known for making teams come together across functional lines. our core values, an excerpt which is below from our company\'s internal website, are what we live by: customer obsession. we pride ourselves on our customer focus and commitment and our work hard, play hard culture! all our customers are referenceable due to the dedication of our team and their relentless effort to hold our customer’s hand throughout their journey until favorable outcomes have been delivered. innovation. don’t be afraid to bring new ideas, thinking, and approaches to cyara and question our existing approach, as we believe in constant learning and continuous improvement. we’re very innovative and take pride in doing things that have never been done before, no matter how impossible they may seem. humility. at cyara we’ve worked hard to try and build a flat, team-centric culture where everyone rolls their sleeves up to get the job at hand done even if it’s not in your job description. no task is too low-level or small for all of us to do. be confident but humble. quality. always put in your best effort and the results will take care of themselves! don’t compromise the quality of your work even though time pressures may exist we’ve grown every year of our existence. all of our customers can be referenced. our strength is in our core values. location: melbourne, australia education: be/btech/mca

title: transport analyst
description: full time, administration/clerical  about the position the government & defence business unit is currently seeking an experienced transport analyst to join the team based in essendon fields, victoria. as a transport analyst, you will be responsible for processing all customer pods using our client’s system, as well as addressing any customer service or sub-contractor inquires that arise. reporting to the distribution administration supervisor, the successful applicant will be responsible for: providing prompt payment and reporting to subcontractors providing data analysis for weekly reporting of financial inputs compiling and present all weekly costing activity for distribution services conducted identifying common and recurring billing and distribution issues providing timely solutions ensuring subcontractor compliance with all cor and linfox requirements providing continuous improvement of processes with focus on controls, revenue assurance and deficiencies identified by the commonwealth and defence smt about you the successful applicant will possess the following: experience performing the same functions in a similar role; strong time management skills and a proven self-starter; excellent people skills and the ability to build relationships; a confident communicator with excellent written communication skills and strong attention to detail; proficient with the microsoft office suite and ability to pick up new systems quickly further information you will be required to meet linfox\'s employment criteria which will include but not be limited to a criminal history check and full medical with a drug and alcohol test. applicants will require eligibility to obtain a minimum level of baseline security clearance as determined by the australian government security vetting agency (agsva), which may include ability to obtain australian citizenship. maintenance of this level of clearance at all times during employment in this position is an inherent requirement of the role. applications close 30/08/2019

title: analyst, data management & quantitative analysis
description: the corporate trust analytics specialist will be primarily responsible for understanding (via transaction documents) and then running and/or maintaining financial models for deals using proprietary systems on an on-going basis. central to this is the ability to communicate the resultant reports to stakeholders and field queries related to the reports. additional responsibilities include providing support to resolve deal specific issues related to the deal model or on-boarding and escalating appropriately, and developing deal specific models, reports, and user tools using in house systems and other supported applications. there may also be the possibility of reviewing other reporting analysts outputs and being involved in deal qa testing. the corporate trust analytics specialist must have and be able to demonstrate the following: the ability to comprehend, interpret and analyze legal documents on complex financial structures; highly developed pc desktop tools such as excel; the ability to communicate effectively with others including colleagues, business partners and other internal teams. time management (as reporting is time sensitive) project management (as the team often implements significant projects qualifications the preferred candidate may also have a degree and around 5 years in a financial services environment. ideal candidates would be people with corporate trust experience, operations experience or corporate actions experience. bny mellon is an equal employment opportunity employer. primary location: australia-new south wales-sydney job: corporate trust internal jobcode: 70128 organization: corporate trust-hr06320 requisition number: 1911201

title: senior data scientist
description: .  senior data scientist    our purpose is to use the power of communications to make a better world. for each other, for our customers, for society and our communities. we need you to help us do this. why this role matters  excited by using massive amounts of data to develop machine learning (ml) and deep learning (dl) applications? want to help the largest global enterprises tackle cyber security challenges through the adoption of artificial intelligence (ai)? eager to learn from many different enterprise’s use cases of ml/dl and big data in cyber security? thrilled to be key part of british telecom security, who has been investing in machine learning, pioneering and shaping the world’s analytics security technology? ambitious to contribute and lead data and analytics strategy for multinational company? at british telecom security, we are building ml and dl products to help large enterprises handle their cyber security problems by leveraging their massive cyber data. we are applying a wide spectrum of analytics techniques to large volumes of data and against a variety of security problems. we pride ourselves on being a cutting-edge global engineering team and highly focused on the success of our customers. if you have experience with ai, including building ml or dl applications on big data, we’d like to have you join our team. you will get to work with an innovative multinational company, with great teammates, and have a lot of fun. successful candidate enjoys diving deep into massive data, doing advanced analysis, and designing and building ai solutions for cyber security. the role holder is enthusiastic about understanding customers’ needs and challenges, market gaps and opportunities in order to design and implement innovative technical solutions that help clients set and exceed ambitious goals. the role holder loves to learn, practice and wants to innovate in the world of ai, big data and cyber security. the senior data scientist will be responsible for researching, developing, deploying, delivering and supporting cyber advanced analytics products and solutions for both bt and its clients globally to time, cost and quality. the senior data scientist will have in-depth knowledge and excellent expertise across a wide variety of data science and analytics techniques to provide influence and leadership in adapting these skills in the realm of advanced security services including but not limited to the domain of cyber security.  what you\'ll be doing  engineering: provide innovative and cutting-edge ideas including architectural design input into further developing the capabilities of bt’s principal advanced security platforms and offerings. design, build, validate, deliver, integrate and present the advanced analytical capabilities using statistical, ml and dl on large volumes of data for internal and external customers. contribute to conceptual, algorithmic and architectural design, documentation, experiment, prototype, development, testing and deployment of ml/dl solutions on big data platform. translate and interpret customer requirements to analytics opportunity to build analytics product and, articulate and present back the proposed solutions to client in simplified format. consultation participate in consultation activities for british telecom customers around the world by running knowledge transfer sessions, requirement engineering workshops, poc and rfi as required. participate in sales and pre-sales activities globally including sales meetings, poc, hld, lld and rfi to support account managers in the field of security analytics. manage and lead security analytics projects including requirement engineering, solution design, data analysis, poc and prototype for bt customers around the world. thought leadership participate in continuously evolving the top end of bt’s thinking and operational capability at the intersection of big data analytics, advanced analytics and cyber security. participate in roadmap and strategy of bt security around data and analytics through market research, customers interaction, competitor evaluation and vendor assessment. participate in design, practice and review of the best practice operation framework for bt security analytics team in relation to other business units with bt security. research and development maintain knowledge of current trends and latest applications in the fields of advanced data analytics, ml, dl, artificial intelligence, big data analytics, cyber security and intelligence platforms. design and practice innovation methods such as design thinking to explore new opportunities and build innovative and differentiative analytic capabilities. partner and engage with research arms like bt r&d, universities and research organizations and communities around the world to understand new trends in data, analytics and ai through attending and presenting in summits, conferences and workshops.  we\'ll also need to see these on your cv  skills/experience:  extensive knowledge and industry experience (5+ years) of machine learning techniques and the ability to implement them in big data platforms. extensive knowledge and industry experience (5+ years) with ml development using: scala, python and r and libraries like scikit-learn, sparkml, caret and mlr. adequate knowledge and industry experience (2+ years) with dl development using tensorflow, keras, mxnet, theano, cntk and caffe 2 and potentially gpus. adequate knowledge and industry experience (2+ years) with working on big data platforms such as hadoop, hdfs, kafka, spark and spark streaming, aws and google cloud stacks. experience of working in a complex technical development and integration environment to build software that will be deployed into production environments with high-quality documentation. experience of linux system administration and linux system troubleshooting desirable. demonstrable track record of leveraging data science skills to find innovative approaches to problems. demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment. demonstrable track record of leadership and managing a team of data scientists, machine learning engineers and data engineers. combination of deep technical skills and business savvy enough to interface with all levels and disciplines within our customer’s organization knowledge of security and cyber telemetry, log feeds and intelligence platforms is preferred. track record of scientific and business publications and presentation is preferred. authority/decision making: works under broad direction. full accountability for own technical work and project responsibilities. receives assignments in the form of objectives. work is often self-initiated. qualifications: a phd or master degree in a highly quantitative field (computer science, machine learning, operational research, statistics, mathematics, etc.) or equivalent industry experience.   we value different perspectives, skills and experiences. we’re creating an inclusive working culture where people from all backgrounds can succeed. that’s why we welcome applications from all parts of the community.

title: lecturer/senior lecturer statistics (data science)
description: job no: 0047798 work type: continuing location: parkville division/faculty: faculty of science department/school: school of mathematics and statistics salary: $126,128 - $145,431 (level c) role & superannuation rate: academic - full time - 17% super the school of mathematics and statistics is seeking to expand its expertise in the area of data science within the statistics research group. the successful applicant is expected to develop and maintain a high-level research program in statistics with emphasis on data science. melbourne provides an outstanding environment in which to develop innovative research in statistics/data science, with opportunities for collaborations with machine learning and bioinformatics researchers in the school of computing and information systems, biostatisticians in the melbourne school of population and global health, big data research in genomics in the melbourne integrative genomics (mig) research hub as well as applied and theoretical approaches to big data in the australian research council (arc) centre of excellence for mathematical and statistical frontiers (acems). the school has excellent computing facilities and access to super computers is available through spartan, the university’s local high performance computing service. beyond the statistics group, the school maintains activity in all areas of the mathematical sciences. it has research foci in many areas of algebra, analysis, geometry, topology, number theory, continuum modelling, mathematical biology, mathematical physics, discrete mathematics, operations research, mathematical and applied statistics, statistical genomics, stochastic modelling and probability theory. the applicant should also have a strong commitment to teaching and the supervision of research students. the incumbent will be involved in the teaching and development of a new data science curriculum at both the undergraduate and postgraduate levels. the successful candidate will be appointed at either academic level b or c, dependent upon the selection panel’s assessment of their application. the appointee will have a phd or equivalent research higher degree in statistics or related discipline. you will have demonstrated research excellence including a strong record of publication in data science and the ability to develop research links with other schools nationally and/or internationally. this is a full-time, continuing position. applications to be submitted by 25th october 2019. late applications will be accepted until 8th november 2019 but may not be fully considered. the university will only be accepting applications submitted via the mathjobs website. https://www.mathjobs.org/jobs advertised: 18 jul 2019 12:00 am aus eastern standard time applications close: 08 nov 2019 11:55 pm aus eastern daylight time

title: financial accountant
description: reference: 39486 about jessie mcpherson private hospital jessie mcpherson private hospital (jmph) is a 103 bed tertiary level private hospital which has been co-located at monash medical centre clayton since 1987. our co-location with monash health provides a unique opportunity for access to world-renowned research and teaching facilities. jessie mcpherson private hospital also has a wider official specialist role for greater melbourne, regional victoria and interstate in such specialties as cardiology, cardiothoracic surgery, neuro-surgery, gastro-surgical, high acuity maternity and neonatal services. about the role the role requires a professional, experienced in supporting financial decision making by collecting, analysing, investigating and reporting financial and business data. the key responsibilities are: financial analysis and reporting; end of month processing and reconciliations; support annual budget build; respond to financial enquiries by gathering, analysing, summarising and interpreting data; support annual financial reporting process; accounts payable and receivables management; and other related duties as defined from time to time by the finance manager and director corporate services.  about you essential experience profile high degree of self-direction, initiative and motivation. excellent attention to detail. relevant tertiary qualification, minimum of bachelor of business/commerce with accounting specialty. professional qualification or working towards ca or cpa is desirable. relevant professional or business experience. strong ability to negotiate and influence others. excellent communication skills. highly developed problem solving and stakeholder management skills. self-managed and able to set and work towards deadlines/milestones. ability to work with stakeholders in the facilitation of solutions, and to develop engagement and understanding. demonstrated experience in systems and business analysis. stakeholder engagement/management. business requirements and process documentation. ability to work under pressure and deliver to tight time frames. ability to work collaboratively across organisational boundaries and build strong working relationships with customers, vendors and team members.  desired experience profile knowledge of the healthcare environment flexibility and adaptability demonstrated ability to meet objectives in a changing and face paced environment experience with operations and change management strategic thinking skills  monash health recognises the value of equal employment opportunity and is committed to patient safety and promoting fairness, equity and diversity in the workplace. at monash health we are relentless in our pursuit of excellence and work to our six guiding principles. preferred candidates will require a clear police check and a current working with children’s check prior to any offers of employment being made. as part of our selection process, you may be invited by email to participate in an on-camera video interview. please note, applications will be accepted via the monash health online mercury system only. email applications will not be considered.  favourite job print share 102 jobs are currently listed for monash health job type: not provided job classification: not provided contact: michelle huynh - 9594 3944 michelle.huynh2@monashhealth.org

title: data engineer
description: applications open from: 15 may 2019 - 15 june 2019 we’re looking for outstanding data engineers at all levels to join our team in melbourne. you’ll join a consulting firm that offers a variety of projects with structured learning and development paths. the opportunity this is a great opportunity for data engineers to join a consulting firm that offers a variety of projects and structured learning and development paths. you will work alongside talented teams of consultants who share your passion in building great solutions and learning new skills. about you as a data engineer, you bring hands-on experience in building data workloads: infrastructure and software which use data to generate business value. you have experience working with at least a few of the following concepts and technologies: data movements are about bringing the right data to the right places. this could be data integration tools (informatica, talend, matillion, nifi) or data processing frameworks (spark, beam, ksql) using a range of programming languages (java, python, scala). data stores are about finding a home for your data. ranging from relational databases (mysql, postgres, sql server) and warehouse appliances (teradata, netezza, exadata) to data platforms (cloudera, databricks, aws emr) and cloud-based warehouses (bigquery, redshift, azure sql dw, snowflake). data serving is about providing usable data to people and systems. this covers topics such as event- and schedule-driven workflows, serialisation formats, data modelling and architecting for performance. you might have some exposure to the following: data governance - building integrity and trust in data information security - confidentiality, integrity and availability of data devops - practices and tools which accelerate delivery cloud-native computing - infrastructure as code, serverless computing, and more contemporary data architectures - data lakes, nosql stores, data fabrics you also bring these values to the team: curious and eager to learn: you are a curious individual who is eager to develop their skills and progress their career at every opportunity in a consulting environment team player: you thrive as a part of high performing teams and love sharing your knowledge with your peers and clients. what you can expect learning & development: as a naturally curious individual, you will have many opportunities to develop your technical and consulting skills. we run internal training on a weekly basis (knowledge sharing sessions, focus groups and our own toastmasters club!) as well as encourage and sponsor certifications. variety of projects: as a consultant, you will have the opportunity to work across multiple projects across our client base significantly increasing your skills and exposure in the industry. career progression: as a consulting firm, our leadership team is continually looking for technologists who want to develop their careers as people leaders and as senior advisors. you will have an opportunity to build your consulting skills as part of our team. about us servian is a professional services firm that puts our people at the heart of our strategy. we help customers challenge the status quo by working with them on implementing new and emerging technologies whilst enabling our consultants to continue to learn and acquire new skills. our business is structured across five key practices: data & analytics - bi/dw, big data analytics, data engineering, data science and advanced analytics artificial intelligence - natural language processing, computer vision, machine learning, deep learning customer engagement - marketing campaigns, campaign analysis, customer insights digital - full stack development, ui/ux design, mobile development cloud & technology - cloud services (aws, azure, google cloud platform), managed services alongside the above, we also provide employees with life and salary insurance and a sociable workplace that values its diversity. friday evenings in our offices consists of a variety of board games, pool playing, music, and a high level of entertaining and thought-provoking conversations. if you’re looking for the opportunity to step up into a leadership position and are excited by the thought of getting your hands dirty with the latest tech-stacks/methodologies, then look no further! apply now!

title: senior data scientist

valued entertainment experience. whether it’s a blockbuster sports match, a must-see reality episode, an election special, the newest hit movie or the most ambitious drama, foxtel brings together the title: economist
description: the economic policy group provides advice on macroeconomic conditions and policy; energy, environment and resources policy; and regulation, planning and local government policy. several ongoing opportunities exist for economists and senior economists in the macroeconomic strategy team. in these roles, you will: work constructively as part of a team to produce advice on complex issues including current and future macroeconomic conditions. prepare high-quality advice on the economy and the latest economic data to key stakeholders, often under tight deadlines. use modern data visualisation tools and mapping techniques to enhance economic data presentations. use quantitative and qualitative techniques to undertake research on the economy, and to update and maintain economic forecasting models. maintain effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders. to discuss this role further, please contact craig michaels on 9651 2035. your application should include a current resume and a cover letter (maximum of three pages) outlining your skills, knowledge and capabilities relating to this opportunity. applicants are not required to submit a separate statement addressing the key selection criteria. applications close on midnight 23 august 2019. you can apply by selecting the ‘apply now\' button

title: data engineer
description: cook medical, a global organisation in interventional medicine, is at the forefront of medical research and product development in minimally invasive health care devices. to support our continuing growth, we seek the services of an experienced data engineer to join the it team in our australian head office at eight mile plains, brisbane. about this role: the data engineer develops, implements and documents data systems that provide the technical solutions to meet specifications and business requirements defined by company objectives to promote effective, efficient, and compliant operations. responsibilities work as part of a project team to define and document data and data pipelines for a variety of solutions technical responsibility for data and data pipelines to ensure compliance with data standards, architectural standards, and achievement of documented requirements develop and maintain current state documentation and deliverables for data solutions maintain existing and new data solutions to ensure that they continue to meet user needs provide assistance to operational teams to ensure that they continue to meet user needs work with the data engineering community of practice to identify and implement continuous improvement opportunities qualifications bachelor’s degree in computer science (or related discipline) or demonstrable relevant experience experience with relational sql and nosql databases; experience with sql server, oracle, and/or mongodb preferred experience building data transformations, data structures, and data pipelines experience with data integration tools experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, balancing multiple priorities, and ensuring quality standards analytical approach to problem solving with innovative thinking (as applicable) highly organized with a focus on attention to detail proficient in english (reading, writing and speaking) must work and interact effectively and professionally with and for others throughout various levels of the global organization excellent problem solving skills and ability to work in collaborative and independent work situations and environments with minimal supervision cook can offer: an opportunity for you to join a company who is committed to improving medical care an attractive package including monthly bonus outstanding staff benefits including top hospital health cover cook as an employer: founded in 1963, cook medical pioneered many of the medical devices now commonly used to perform minimally invasive medical procedures throughout the body. today, the company integrates medical devices, drugs and biologics to enhance patient safety and improve clinical outcomes. since its inception, cook has operated as a private corporation. the australian head quarters is located in the brisbane technology park, eight mile plains, brisbane. our manufacturing operation is steadily growing and manufacturing more complex devices for our global markets. cook medical employs over 10,000 employees worldwide, operates directly in 39 countries and delivers products to 135 countries around the world. cook medical consists of nine business units and has over 7,000 products in stock. the future of medical care has never been more exciting. please note only applicants that have full working rights within australia are eligible to apply. shortlisting may commence immediately after advertisement posted.

title: match reporter
description: we are looking for match reporters who are able to communicate basic information over the phone to our call center.we are a leading sports data provider and need reporters to cover matches in state league football (soccer) around the country. all training will be provided over skype and through documents, and coverage will be through your mobile phone at venues close to you.pay is between 60-70 eur ($80-90) per match, depending on the league that is being covered, and on some occasions two games can be covered in one day.please note: this is not a journalist position and all people eligible to work in australia can apply.job type: commission

2019 supervisor / employee: ______ ______ position description: casual landfill attendant job summary directs and coordinates landfill activities concerned with solid waste disposal at the glen innes and rural landfill sites, by performing the following duties. duties and responsibilities  essential duties and responsibilities include the following: the duties and responsibilities listed here are considered essential to achieving the primary objectives of this job. other duties consistent with the functions and role of the position may be assigned. \uf0de maintains a current awareness of council landfill protocols and procedures, as set out in council’s relevant landfill management plan. \uf0de promotes the image of the council in a positive manner and actively works to promote good landfill management plan. \uf0de controls traffic movements in and around landfill areas to direct incoming vehicles to dumping areas and ensure safe and orderly usage of the centre by all persons. \uf0de examines loads of waste for recyclable material to control waste disposal activities and minimise the quantity of recyclable materials going into the landfill, including providing advice to customers and assisting them to identify and sort recyclables. \uf0de examines vehicle and trailer cargos to identify and prevent hazardous wastes from entering council’s landfill site. \uf0de ensures that waste disposal activities conform to relevant public health and environmental regulations as specified in council’s landfill management plan, and reports potential breaches of regulations to the supervisor. \uf0de identifies hazards at the landfill site and removes / controls hazards to maintain a safe environment, or promptly reports hazards to the supervisor. \uf0de collects landfill fees and charges, issues receipts as required, and ensures that cash takings balance against receipts issued at glen innes landfill. \uf0de operates the vehicle weighbridge at the landfill site, recording and maintaining data at glen innes landfill. \uf0de records all accidents and incidents at the landfill site and reports such incidents promptly to the supervisor. \uf0de observes housekeeping standards and maintains the landfill and surrounding areas by removing stray waste from non dumping areas and returning it to the landfill.  of 6 approved: ________________ date: 6 august 2019 title: project officer - supported temporary accommodation
description: work on the central coast work with a great organisation that assists people when most in need full-time permanent position access to excellent salary packaging benefits about the program join our vibrant, faith-based agency providing innovative social care services to 14,000+ children, young people, individuals and families in the northern metropolitan sydney and on the central coast. we are seeking a project officer to join our supported temporary accommodations (sta) team located on the central coast. this position exists to assist the project manager to develop and implement a 7 day a week and after-hour crisis response service to all homeless qualifying for temporary accommodation in the wyong and gosford areas. some of your responsibilities will include: reviewing sta procedures and discussing with coordinator any possible changes needed; engagement with clients to provide crisis accommodation develop relationships with preferred accommodation providers and external stakeholders; compliance with all government and reporting requirements for program adherence including data collection; as well as other duties specified in the attached position description. about you to be considered for this role you will : have tertiary qualifications in a related area such as social work, social science, psychology and/or demonstrated industry experience; be able to demonstrate an understanding of homelessness and its complexities; have an ability to work effectively with individuals in a crisis management process which includes undertaking assessments and reviewing case plans; possess excellent verbal and written communication skills; hold a valid working with children check clearance; have a valid nsw driver’s licence; as well as other criteria specified in the attached position description. working with catholiccare catholiccare offers a range of initiatives to actively promote your life/work balance and development of our employees through: working for a not for profit organisation who strive for a world where people are safe, happy, well and connected with each other in inclusive communities; great training and learning opportunities to help further your career; an employee assistance program offering free and confidential counselling and support; salary packaging benefits to receive up to $15,900 of your salary tax-free, as well as additional meal and entertainment benefits. to apply if you are a passionate person who realises the tremendous opportunity that this role offers and want to utilise your skills and passion in a rewarding environment, we want to hear from you! please provide a cover letter addressing the role requirements, complete your work history and education information on the application page and submit your resume. we encourage and welcome applications from aboriginal and torres strait islander people. please apply by 11 august 2019. apply now! catholiccare is a child-safe and child-friendly organisation – all staff must comply with our child-safe child-friendly policies and code of conduct. all child related roles are subject to a satisfactory working with children check clearance in accordance with the relevant provisions of the child protection (working with children) act 2012. completing a national criminal history record check clearance is a requirement of this position no recruitment agencies please
