description: about jasol jasol is the specialist cleaning and hygiene solutions division of george weston foods and our vision is to grow jasol into australia & new zealand\'s leading cleaning technology company. we will deliver this growth by building a market leading sales & service team for our chosen markets, demonstrating innovation through market focused technology development & leveraging chemical supply chain capability to sustain best in market cost position. to help us on this journey we are looking for an enthusiastic customer service representative to join our existing small passionate customer service team. about you we are seeking an experienced and passionate individual who knows what great customer service looks like and knows how to delivery it outside and within our business. you will be responsible for working with our customers to delivery against our difot target, as well as working across our business with service technicians, our supply chain to continual deliver service improvement. you will be responsible for: providing excellent customer service in a timely manner to our customers as well as within jasol coordinate and process customer orders using our erp system - pronto provide articulate and professional written correspondence via email to stakeholders and third parties liaise with suppliers and manufacturers to ensure a fast and accurate service build and maintain customer relationships problem solve and provide solutions where possible manage the full customer service process administration and data entry tasks as required what we are looking for proven experience working in a customer service and administration capacity in a fast-paced environment a self-starter and strong organisational skills strong written and verbal communication skills intermediate microsoft office and fast typing skills the ability to problem solve and create solutions enthusiasm and a professional "can-do" attitude motivated, flexible and reliable pronto experience is highly desirable what are the benefits? work close to home in braeside! (please note the first 6 months you will be located in port melbourne, some flexibility can be given until the relocation occurs, we are happy to discuss at time of interview) great opportunity to work for a reputable organisation, with career opportunities available in the broader george weston foods business’ professional yet relaxed business environment supportive and friendly work culture free car parking onsite our aim is to ensure our people can hit the ground running - so we provide company and site-specific induction with a focus on understanding jasol’s business, culture, values and behaviours as well as our number one priority - safety. we act like owners of our business and live our purpose which is: "we passionately deliver local hygiene solutions that keep people safe". if this opportunity sounds like your ideal role, we would love to hear from you. please send your application to terri dey: terri.dey@gwf.com.au by cob 19 aug 2019

title: cyber security analyst - third party
description: let’s talk about me we’re not like other banks. me was created by the industry super funds to be different from the pack – and we’re passionate about staying that way as we head into an exciting and progressive future. we are building a bank, a company and a brand that we can be proud of – but to achieve that, we need the best people.  to help me get there, you’ll challenge the status quo and share extraordinary ideas – and our size guarantees you’ll have the opportunity, support and environment to be heard. me’s core purpose is helping all australians get ahead – no conditions, asterisks or exceptions.  we believe everyone deserves the same opportunities in life, regardless of gender or identity, sexuality, ethnicity, religion or disability. this is why we’re so committed to an equal opportunity workplace – because we know our success won’t come from focusing on similarities, but by embracing and celebrating our diversity.  a bit about the role in cyber security, the enemy can by anyone and anywhere, so it takes out of the box thinking and a passion for protecting the business to keep us safe. excitingly, we have an opportunity for a cyber security analyst to join our ever-expanding cyber security team, working with our valued third party service providers. our third party providers are highly valued and seen as an important extension of all of the great stuff we do internally here at me. in this hands-on role, you’ll be helping me protect our information assets within our new and existing third party supplier partnerships and engagements. working with a large variety of suppliers, you will engage with them on an ongoing basis performing risk and security assessments to ensure all suppliers we engage with, who manage our information assets, work on and adhere to our me approved risk framework. if we haven’t partnered with them before, you get to run the initial analysis and work closely with our internal stakeholders to gather all the requirements, piece all the important stuff together, support negotiating security clauses and communicate outcomes. you then get to manage security assurance of supplier’s environment to contractually agreed requirements on an on-going basis. pretty important, right? about you first and foremost you are eager and always willing to have a swing – you aren’t afraid to make mistakes and learn from them! the idea of joining a small, fast-paced (growing) team is what you’re after, and you’re not one to shy away when the going gets tough. you’re the first person to call it out when it doesn’t look right, plus you get it and all that cyber- stuff. secondly as well as multi-tasking, you are a people person through and though. you know how to build relationships and work closely with external businesses so they can still feel part of our me family, even though they are working off-site. you’re a quick learner with strong communication and stakeholder management skills. when it comes to solving problems, you do this with ease and grace and your attention to detail is always on point.  lastly, you’re the type of person who can work independently and has no problems thinking outside the box, always taking a proactive approach to your role. negotiation is your key jam – you know how to get a good deal for all parties involved! about the perks at me, we believe that work should be a place that you can make the most of – and these are just some of the many reasons why people love it here: popular culture – that’s not a claim, we’ve got the data to prove it. we genuinely care about each other and work in an encouraging and collaborative environment. the whole package – sure, we’re going to reward you well with your salary package – but there are also lots of other perks – including discounted myki travel cards, free health support, conveniently-located offices, plus much more. not afraid to fail? we embrace action-oriented people like you. that’s right, you can make mistakes here and it’s ok – so long as you learn from them. to be me, we need you – we’re building something really cool and you get to directly influence what that is. proudlyme – our internal pride network – has a swag of initiatives that show support, education, and passion toward our team and customers, demonstrating that me is a strong advocate on equal rights for the lgbtiq+ community. meet the execs – our executive team is fun and full of passion because we know great managers mean happy staff. oh, and did we mention you get your very own me branded converse high-top shoes? now that’s a reason to get your foot in the door.  i want those converse (and the job) if this sounds like the perfect job for you, why wait? apply now by submitting your cover letter and resume today.  can’t see a closing date on the advert? that’s because we’re pretty efficient here at me and we may start looking at applications sooner rather than later, so if this role sounds like your jam, be sure to apply today.  me offers a modern and supportive work environment, including flexible work conditions. while this is a full time role, we’re also open to hearing from candidates that may be seeking a flexible work arrangement.  should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including police checks, reference checks, asic banned and disqualified persons and bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate\'s employment being confirmed. the outcomes of the background checks do not automatically bar candidates; however, will be assessed against the inherent requirements of the job.

title: people & culture officer (position description)
description: reporting to: chief people and culture officer directs reports: nil  key relationships: chief executive officer, executive, the leadership team and operations leaders position status: full time maximum term 1. primary objectives within the parameters of our constitution, service philosophy and the policy framework established by the safe steps board, and under the direction and supervision of the chief people and culture officer, the people and culture officer will ensure that safe steps employment practices comply with state and federal legislative requirements, whilst coordinating end to end recruitment activities, including all on boarding and off boarding processes;  2. organisational context safe steps family violence response centre (formally known as the women’s domestic violence crisis service) was set up in 1974 as the women’s refuge referral service to provide a 24 hour 7 days a week telephone helpline for women experiencing family violence. it is now a state-wide incorporated association funded primarily by, but not exclusively the department of health and human services to provide a range of services 24 hours 7 days a week for women and their children who experience family violence. safe steps is the primary contact and referral point for access to women’s refuges in victoria. it provides three complementary services:  a crisis telephone information, support, advocacy and referral service;  a trauma counselling service for women experiencing family violence and sexual assault;  a high security supported safe house accommodation service. the organisation has a strong social change agenda that operates across three key pillars; prevent, respond and recover and provides community education, advocacy and awareness raising. the organisation operates out of three separate work locations, one of which houses the 24/7 immediate response telephone service, another administration, and the other which provides accommodation. safe steps is governed by a constitution and a board of governance with ten members. the board elects its own chair and meets monthly to set the strategic direction and policy parameters for the organisation and its work. the organisation is managed by a chief executive officer who operates with a high degree of autonomy, and at the same time working closely and effectively with the board. she attends board meetings and services the work of the board. updated 31/7/19 1 the chief executive officer is responsible for ensuring effective relationships with our funding body and with sector partners, and for developing protocols to ensure that the best possible services are provided to the women and children who need them. safe steps is a lead organisation in a wider network of domestic violence services in victoria. the organisation has an annual budget turnover of more than $12 million; it employs more than 80 full- time staff, part-time staff, volunteers and students to support the work of the organisation. the people and culture officer is based at the safe steps head office in north melbourne, however, working across all sites maybe required.  the people and culture officer is expected to uphold organisation’s policies and procedures as well as the department of human services standards, which include the following obligations:  to respect client confidentiality  to obtain consent for the disclosure of information about a client  to inform any client who wishes to make a complaint about the organisation of their right to do so, and to assist them to initiate a complaint safe steps’ locations and unlisted telephone numbers may not be disclosed to any other person except in accordance with service procedures. the locations and unlisted telephone numbers of any high security refuges may not be disclosed to any other person other than in accordance with the instructions of each such service.  key responsibilities generalist hr  assist with the delivery of operational support/guidance to line managers and individual employees in areas such as employee relations/coaching, job design, performance management, remuneration and benefits, job evaluation, compliance, employee development, succession planning, and ensure effective communication with all staff to maintain ethical and transparent working relationships.  assist in the development of hr policies and procedures  provide data for and prepare management information reports  provide accurate advice and interpretation on terms and conditions in awards and collective agreements  provide policy interpretation, support and advice to staff, supervisors and managers in relation to day to day hr operational issues.  drive enhanced people leadership capabilities across the organisation by providing the appropriate tools, processes, coaching and advice that is fit for purpose  assisting in the research and development of human resources policy, projects and programs.  daily management of routine administrative duties for the p&c program area  processing of staff forms pertaining to: o change of employment status o generate contracts, starter packs & employee files for new employees o coordinate new employee’s induction and online compliance training  processing termination forms & sending out relevant correspondence  managing all employee personnel files including routine filing, retrieval of documents & archiving. updated 31/7/19 2   monitoring probation expiry periods recruitment and onboarding  support end-to-end recruitment including advertising, candidate application management, tracking, selection, on boarding and induction programs  coordinate new starter kits and ensure kits are issued to new staff  coordinate national police check and working with children check processes including monitoring of renewals whilst maintaining the data base  co-ordinate the induction program for all new staff  advise managers of current probation policies and procedures and coordinate reviews, providing advice where necessary on issues as raised  seek on boarding feedback from new employees and proactively assist with resolving any issues payroll  ensure timely and accurate processing of the fortnightly payroll in line with current enterprise agreements, contracts and modern awards  interpretation of awards/agreements and contract in relation to overtime and other allowances  maintain employee records/personnel files on payroll related matters  liaise with payroll provider in relation to the creation of payruns and changes to entitlements  extract payroll reports are required  work closely with the workforce planner in relation to timesheets and worked hours health, safety and wellbeing/workcover  develop and co-ordinate hsw activities to raise awareness including procedures, communication and consultation  create and maintain all hsw related forms, templates and guidelines  working with relevant stakeholders, take immediate action to rectify any unsafe situations or acts, reporting all incidents and near misses according to policy & procedure  collect, record and report all incidents/injuries within the incident register  assist with risk assessments and identifying and eliminating hazards to support us working safely.  coordinate first aid, fire warden and related ohs training and maintain records other requirements  ensure confidentiality at all times and only release confidential information in accordance with organisational policies and procedures  build and maintain positive relationships with a broad range of stakeholders  regularly attend and positively contribute to leadership team meetings and staff meetings  complete mandatory and other training as required  abide by all organisational policies and procedures, and workplace conduct and safety obligations 3. key selection criteria  tertiary qualifications in business, human resources or a related discipline  demonstrated experience providing accurate, timely, and strategically aligned human resource solutions to a range of stakeholders updated 31/7/19 3   demonstrated knowledge and understanding of a range of generalist human resources disciplines, legislative requirements and regulations  previous experience in human resources within social services settings, particularly women’s services or family violence (preferred)  demonstrated knowledge of employment related legislation & industrial instruments including interpretation of same  experience working with unions and enterprise agreements  experience managing a diverse range of stake holders  understanding of ohs and workcover legislation and its application to the workplace  problem solving: demonstrated ability to investigate and probes for the facts; liaises with stakeholders; analyses issues from different perspectives and draws sound inferences from information available; identifies and proposes workable solutions to problems  committed to the living expression of safe steps values; courageous, feminist*, empowering, ethical, respectful and reflective  willingness to undergo a police check and working with children check 5. equal opportunity exemption safe steps has an equal opportunity exemption to employ only women —eo exemption a366/2011 6. important inormation all offers of employment are subject to satisfactory background checks including a national police check (including an international police check if resided continuously in an overseas country for 12 months or more in the last ten years), working with children check, disclosure of previous or current disciplinary action, referee checks, proof of eligibility to work in australia and qualification checks. where background checks are not to the satisfaction of safe steps in its absolute discretion, the offer of employment may be retracted or terminated.  if you are offered employment with safe steps and are not currently an existing employee, you will be required to disclose full details of any pre-existing injuries or illness that may be affected by the work and/or undergo a health assessment. the disclosure/health assessment is conducted to ensure you have the health and mental capacity to meet the requirements of the position and to identify any adjustments that may need to be made in the workplace. failing to notify or hiding a pre-existing injury or illness which might be affected by the nature of the proposed employment, could result in that injury or illness being ineligible for future compensation claims. 7. staff acknowledgment i have received, reviewed and fully understand the position description. employee name employee signature date updated 31/7/19 4

title: data and voice communications apprentice (junior) x 2
description: atc work smart/atc midwest are inviting applications from suitable applicants who meet the minimum job requirements for the position of data and voice communications apprentice (junior pay rates are applicable to this job). the successful applicants will be employed by atc midwest and will commence work with a host employer in a work assignment at a well-established local operation, whilst also undertaking cert iii in data and voice communications. this is a fantastic opportunity for applicants to gain a role where experience and study are completed in conjunction, providing solid work experience and a nationally accredited qualification upon successful completion. the positions are full-time and based in geraldton. duties will include: servicing, installation and maintenance of electronic equipment routing cables through roof spaces, cavity walls and support structures, following australian standards conducting regular fault finding configuration, repair and servicing of equipment providing excellent customer service and completing administration duties  job requirements: a willingness to learn and enthusiasm and passion for electronics and the data communications industry it and computer skills have excellent time management and be able to follow instructions manual drivers licence (preferred) able to obtain police clearance must be able to pass a drug & alcohol screen junior – refers to someone under the age of 21 hold a previous it or electronics course (desirable)  how to apply: to apply for the job you will need to write a cover letter introducing yourself, outlining your personal achievements to date and letting us know what makes you a good candidate for this apprenticeship, including your interest in electronics. your achievements might include those related to your education or schooling, your sporting achievements, your involvement in your community or anything else you feel proud of having accomplished up to now. other documents required (where applicable): copy of your birth certificate, passport or citizenship certificate copies of your school reports from the last 2 years you attended school references from past or current employers references from employers who may have hosted you on work experience placements certificates or awards presented to you in recognition of achievement please email your resume, cover letter and required documents directly to jobs@atc-midwest.com.au applications will close when enough suitable applicants have been sourced. apply early, with all documentation, to avoid disappointment.

title: application support engineer
description: permanent role south melbourne location showcase your technical support skills! our client provides a fully integrated financial solution under one roof to the medical industry. they help educate their customers to make the right financial decisions to achieve their financial goals. they are presently looking for an application support engineer to support and maintain their existing software platforms. responsibilities include: ensure report and letter templates are accurately updated, published, printed and delivered data import/export jobs maintained and executed application and service errors are closely monitored and addressed application support issues are solved in a timely manner application support tickets are updated accordingly required experience: 4+ years application support experience must have strong analytical skills must have strong diagnostics skills must have strong problem-solving skills must be dynamic and resourceful great commutation skills tertiary qualifications in computer science, engineering, mathematics or related field. experience within agile teams preferred coding experience with vb, vb.net and c# preferred 1-2 years financial services industry experience preferred  must be proficient in the following technical areas: ms sql server 2012 and/or above t-sql, stored procedure, functions, writing complex queries visual studio 2013 and/or above ms reporting services 2012 and/or above ssrs report designer telerik report designer you will ideally have financial services experience in at least one of the following areas: personal insurance superannuation taxation and accounting wealth management banking who is ps+c? an asx listed company, we as ps+c are one of the leading ict consultancies in australia, with over 400 expert consultants across our people, security and communication businesses. we design and develop solutions that connect our clients with their customers, strengthen the security of their operations, improve and streamline their processes and create competitive advantage. through our knowledge, platforms and processes, we contribute to making the world a smaller, more connected place. how to apply ps+c group (asx:psz) are an equal opportunity employer, to be considered you must have valid australian working rights.

title: appointment setter
description: job descriptionabout the businesswe are a trusted managed print services that serve a private, public and social business sector.based in sydney, printech solutions has been in operation since 2014 offering a comprehensive range of print services and solutions australia wide. we are innovative, results-driven and most importantly, we are one of the leading providers of technology across australia.through our partnerships with market-leading brands including, hp, samsung, kyocera, and canon, we are able to offer a new approach to technology adoption and create value for our customers. we live and breathe our purpose "to deliver more than you expect" and our customers are at the heart of everything we doabout the roleto generate leads and book appointmentscleanse/update data using salesforcenurture ongoing opportunitiesresponsible for managing leadscold callingdelivering the required number of qualified leadsbenefitscompetitive remuneration packagesouthwest base office or satellite sales office melbournesupportive and fun cultureskills and experienceexceptional communication skillsfluent englishself-motivated & drivenprevious experience with salesforce preferredjob type: full-timesalary: $50,000.00 to $60,000.00 /yearjob type: full-timesalary: $50,000.00 /yearwork eligibility:no work eligibility is required, i am willing to sponsor the right candidate (e.g. visa) (preferred)

title: budget and forecast specialist
description: david jones wants to inspire people by providing an exceptional experience. as one of the leading international retailers, we’ve done this by curating the world\'s leading brands across fashion, beauty, home and food. by enabling and empowering our employees, david jones ensures that we are a destination for endless possibilities. we have a fantastic opportunity available within our central planning team for a budget and forecast specialist. reporting into the merchandise trade manager, this role has ownership of integration to the budget and forecast process of the merchandise strategy. please note this will be a contract position, ending july 2020. in this role you will: provide key support to ensure effective end to end management of the budget and forecast processes provide planning administration and process support to the merchandise team, updating and maintaining data integrity be the key coordinator between merchandise and marketing for promotional activity be responsible for establishing and maintaining promotional loading and support be exposed to all product groups and company divisions whilst learning and developing across the planning function update and communicate all the merchandise inputs in conjunction with finance work cross functionally across all david jones business units to support and achieve company outcomes provide analysis to support the merchandise planning needs of the business update and communicate the clearance planning timeline and tools we are looking for that little bit extra, so join us if you: have excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, with the ability to influence stakeholders across the organisation have a demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and work within a fast paced environment whilst balancing competing interests have demonstrated experience within a similar capacity, in retail or related industry possess strong numerical and analytical skills possess a strong retail and commercial acumen have a demonstrated ability to work alongside a range of key senior stakeholders in order to achieve business outcomes are a lateral thinker, use creative thinking and analytical skills to problem solve have strong computer literacy in microsoft office (excel) at david jones we go the extra mile. we offer; opportunities to work with premium exclusive fashion, beauty, home and food products an opportunity to work with a trusted iconic brand david jones employee discounts and a highly competitive incentive scheme a merchandise range and selection which is fresh and exclusive ongoing training and development in order to pursue excellence to begin a career with endless possibilities, we invite you to begin your application now.

title: detail scheduler
description: we have come a long way in 65 years of operation in australia. on top of a strong underlying business, having been selected to deliver the next generation of advanced anti-submarine warships, the jorn phase 6 radar upgrade and sustainment program and as the tier 1 f-35 joint strike fighter program partner, the future is bright for our more than 3,500 employees. in terms of our culture, it is inclusive and safety focused. we call it an ‘everyone culture\'. for us that means ensuring that the voices and talents of every employee are valued and that everyone has a sense of belonging. it also means providing a family friendly, flexible and supportive place to work. as the detail scheduler, you will establish and coordinate production activity within the established material requirements planning (mrp) system, between the project and manufacturing in pursuit of the agreed deliverable milestones at our henderson (wa) site. in more specific terms you will: develop and maintain level 5/6 detail production schedule as per installation work package, work instructions and job cards manage weekly schedule progress, phasing with production inputs and providing schedule analysis including risk, negative and positive schedule variances manage weekly baseline updates, including new engineering changes, maintenance tasks and growth work, providing project schedule analysis impact ensure the sales order schedule meets the project milestone dates authorise assembly and integration work centre activities through the release of work orders in alignment with project cost codes and agreed production schedule liaise with team leads for the release of work orders in line with available resources coordinate and prioritise material requirements and expedite when required manage all adjustments and amendments to material lists to maintain product traceability review all planned work and determine validity, accuracy, and assist the project planners to determine priorities if conflicting requirements occur manage the stock control between multiple projects compile and maintain product status reports and problems affecting schedule generate a forward load estimate against all assembly and integration work centres, to support labour resource planning provide project reporting, data analysis and schedule input into any change management as the ideal applicant, you will have: tertiary qualification in project management or trade related discipline demonstrated production scheduling experience knowledge and experience in manufacturing capabilities (process technologies and related business information systems), preferably within the defence or maritime environment intermediate to advanced ms office skills, particularly in excel and project ability to interact effectively with internal and external stakeholders and work closely in collaboration with projects and function well-developed self-management skills and ability to work under own initiative to deliver outputs to time, quality and cost applications should be addressed to shane blogg, talent acquisition specialist. please ensure you attach a current resume and copy of your relevant qualification(s) to your application. a cover letter is preferred. we welcome and strongly encourage applications from women, aboriginal and torres strait islanders for these opportunities. an inclusive culture and an exciting, supportive career opportunity awaits. we are also proud to be a work180 endorsed employer for women. if you would like to know more information about how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives here: https://tinyurl.com/work180bae-systems-australia further information regarding clearances is available at: https://careers.au.baesystems.com/opportunity.html bae systems australia will never request money from you during the recruitment process. please be aware of scam messages asking for money for an administration fee, visa or similar. if you receive such a message please report it to scam watch www.scamwatch.gov.au/report-a-scam. job applications should only be submitted via the bae systems australia website and not via email. if you receive an email from bae systems that does not utilise “@baesystems.com” as the domain, it is not legitimate. bae systems does not use gmail, aol, hotmail or similar accounts.

title: medical administrative assistant
description: remedy healthcare is seeking two professional and highly motivated medical administration assistants to join a busy, thriving team - supporting the delivery of optimal client care australia wide. full time (monday - friday) & casual opportunities available work close to public transport at our brand new head office in melbourne cbd ( 3 minute walk from parliament station ) enjoy flexible working conditions and engage in a supportive network of healthcare professionals. remedy healthcare is a major health care partner and wholly owned subsidiary of australian unity. we’re a leading provider of highly targeted, evidence-based self-management and health coaching programs. our multi-disciplinary team comprises of exercise physiologists, dietitians, diabetes educators, physiotherapists, occupational therapists, nurses and health coaches. the clinical environment is driven by individualised, holistic, evidence-based care and supported by a strong professional development program. about the medical administration opportunity we are seeking two experienced and enthusiastic medical administrators to support the delivery of client care. the opportunities are for a full-time position, and casual position. you will be responsible for applying excellent customer service to in-bound and out-bound telephone and email enquiries for remedy referrers, service providers, clients and other stakeholders, as well as working closely with remedy\'s nursing, and allied health team. this is a key role managing multidisciplinary client services within the client management system, liaising closely with the nursing and allied health team, mapping programs, and sending details of referrals. you will also provide high quality administrative support to the team with timely and accurate reporting, document processing, and client data management. your rewards and benefits: in return for your hard work and dedication we offer: career progression as well as ongoing training and support. competitive salary package, in addition to eligibility for annual bonus scheme. flexible working arrangements. corporate discounts – health & general insurance, gym memberships, optical, etc. central location friendly and supportive working environment join an organisation that values well-being in both the services they provide, and how they operate from within! about you : you will be a self-motivated medical/ office administrator who provides superior customer service to our internal and external stakeholders. to be the successful in this role you demonstrate the following: proven experience of effective and efficient management of inbound phone and email enquiries excellent customer service and rapport building skills. exceptional verbal and written communication skills. apply complete professionalism and sensitivity. proven ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment with a high attention to detail ability to work as part of a collaborative team able to learn and operate new software and systems. competent with the use of microsoft office and crm software applications. at remedy healthcare we seek to create a work environment that supports you to thrive in your career. we operate with commercial principles and a strong social purpose to create community value. we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  join us and thrive! for more information on this role please contact lisa woodruff (talent acquisition specialist) via email at lwoodruff@australianunity.com.au to apply for this role, please click the ‘apply now’ button below.

title: data and intelligence analyst
description: bolster is a digital, creative and product agency specialising in music, events and entertainment. we’re incredibly passionate about our clients and, hopefully, they’re on your radar too. we’re talking teams like splendour in the grass, st. jerome’s laneway festival, falls festival, chugg entertainment, fairfax events, pinot palooza and future classic, plus global lifestyle brands such as youtube, jbl, sapporo, blundstone and redbull music. we design and develop digital products for ourselves and our clients. some notable mentions include linktree, (an instagram tool with 3 million users) and two webby award nominated projects: buzz and lnwy - an online music publication we built in collaboration with the laneway festival we’re looking for a data analyst help lead a major change in the way the music industry consumes and understands data. you’ll work with a data engineer to: analyse bolster’s significant set of industry data from sources like facebook, adwords, analytics and spotify to find insights, inform campaigns and present in industry publications. develop and maintain valuable client facing dashboard visualisations help the business grow through maintaining, modelling and presenting insights from our data warehouse. help build analytics features for linktree. linktree has gained massive popularity in the last year, with 3m users and gaining over 12000+ new signups a day. some key users are alicia keys, eminem, the grammys, starbucks, crossfit, jamie oliver, vice, guardian, perez hilton, fender + expedia. our dream candidate will possess all of the following qualities : advanced sql with working experience in dimensional modelling experience with a web analytics tools visual design experience, particularly with data visualisation familiar with modern bi tools (looker, mode, metabase, periscope, tableau) basic familiarity with javascript (particularly front end tracking) an interest in music, tech and the wider industry personable, clear and constructive communication skills. bonus points : experience with python or r statistics experience an interest in machine learning and predictive analytics (experience even better!) knowledge of nosql, particularly elasticsearch highly desired knowledge of the big data tooling landscape and best practices

title: assistant valuer - commercial
description: opteon is an international provider of valuations, advisory and specialist property services in the australian and new zealand market. recognised as the largest valuation professional services firm in these regions, we deliver meaningful solutions for our clients across all property types and market sectors. we are experiencing an exciting period of growth and change, positioning the company as one of the most prominent property services providers. our future growth strategy is for organic growth, diversification and international expansion. about the role we have a new position for a property graduate keen to further develop their career in the commercial valuations industry. you will be involved in a rotational role working across a variety of asset classes including industrial, retail, office and mixed-use complexes and working closely with directors within the department. working with opteon\'s best in market proprietary property software and systems enables our valuers to maximise their time in the field and reporting data capture. we have significant work volumes, so this is a great opportunity to take over an existing workload with future growth available. about you we are seeking driven, commercially focussed professionals who are seeking a career in commercial valuations and have exceptional communication skills with a business development and customer focused mindset. a team player with a commitment to personal professional development is essential together with: degree in business (property) or equivalent qualifications strong attention to detail, report writing and analytical skills ability to work in and contribute to a harmonious team environment previous property experience beneficial  what we offer  a structed program and path to achieving certified practicing valuer (cpv) status industry leading technology and a national operational support system that enable you to provide exceptional service levels development opportunities for high performers join a growing company how to apply this is an immediate start for the right candidate. if this sounds like you apply today!

title: senior spatial information officer
description: lead project teams and work independently in the timely, efficient and effective provision of geographic information to support land and spatial information\'s internal and external clients by: -o the collaborative acquisition, management, discovery, access, visualisation, and delivery of spatial and non-spatial information products and serviceso processing requests for the production of integrated data, information, mapping, web maps, web applications and spatial web services in accordance with approved protocols and procedures.o creation of innovative solutions and efficient processes including modernisation of data catalogues and migration to cloud infrastructure• ensure the integrity, management and maintenance of the state remotely sensed image library digital archive in accordance with queensland government security and privacy principles and relevant evidentiary legislation• support the advancement of queensland\'s spatial information through development of technical specifications, reports, policy and procedural documentation• collaborate with all tiers of government, industry, funding agencies, educational institutions, community groups and academia to maximise the value of spatial information ensuring the ongoing relevance of spatial information services and activities• maintain knowledge of current and emerging technologies associated with mapping and surveying, geographic information systems (gis) and associated products and services• communication in both written and oral form with clients, stakeholders and departmental officers at all levels, assisting in the provision of advice on technical issues related to spatial information products and services applications to remain current for 12 months.this work is licensed under a creative commons attribution 3.0 australia license.

title: erp data conversion lead
description: join one of the largest global leaders in ohs as an erp data conversion lead for an initial 6 months contract based in geelong. you will be responsible for designing the data migration strategy as well as choosing the most suitable tools and methods to ensure a smooth transition of the data to enable successful project delivery on to a cloud erp platform. your responsibilities include: data extraction as per extraction rule provided by the client business or third-party implementation partner. working collaboratively with client business users /mdm team on data cleansing.  working on data transformation (update to legacy system after business approval). data reconciliation with business sme/leads. providing data as per template (template shared by third party cloud conversion team). data corrections as per error analysis shared by third party cloud team/client business. managing master & historical data reconciliation (prior to load to cloud/hand over to third part vendor) with business and get approval prior to release experience working on deliverable-based projects leading development of data migration tools day-by-day implementation plan you will have: prior erp data conversion experience into cloud erp, preferably oracle cloud erp covering financials, procurement and project financials leadership experience to work in a fast paced project environment and work to timelines and achieve milestones. consultative and advisory skills to liaise and guide business sme\'s on data conversion rules, conventions and decisions. contact prachi nawathey 03 83999949

title: warehouse associate
description: job descriptionacross international (www.acrossinternational.com.au) is a leading science-based company that manufactures laboratory equipment for use in material processing, heat treatment, and r&d. we are a rapidly growing company with an excellent opportunity for a candidate interested in the quality control and repair of scientific equipment. our australian branch is looking for an immediate, full-time position that offers excellent salary, healthcare benefits, and a great working environment. join our team of highly motivated, professional individuals and start your career on the right track!----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------job title: shipping clerkresponsibilities\uf0b7 process, package and ship orders accurately\uf0b7 organize stocks and maintain inventory\uf0b7 inspect products for defects and damages\uf0b7 examine ingoing and outgoing shipments\uf0b7 organize warehouse space\uf0b7 receive, unload and place incoming inventory items appropriately\uf0b7 check, verify and fill customer invoices\uf0b7 abide by all company safety and hygiene regulations\uf0b7 contribute ideas on ways to improve or optimize warehousing procedures\uf0b7 keep warehouse clean and organized dailyrequirements\uf0b7 proven warehouse experience\uf0b7 ability to operate forklift, hand truck, pallet jack and other warehouse equipment\uf0b7 adequate knowledge of warehouse data system\uf0b7 team player with organizational skills\uf0b7 ability to lift or move heavy products > 20kgs\uf0b7 high school diplomajob types: full-time, part-timesalary: $19.00 to $20.00 /hourexperience:customer service: 1 year (preferred)licence:forklift licence (preferred)work eligibility:no work eligibility is required, i am willing to sponsor the right candidate (e.g. visa) (preferred)

title: data modeller
description: as an experienced data modeller joining our enterprise data architecture team, we want you to bring your experience and best practice data modelling principles to the project teams you will work with. you will be working closely with our enterprise data architect and various data producer/consumer system stakeholders right across our business to continue the build-out of our world-class technical data strategy. our data modellers drive the standardised definition of our data domains and assist the business users and technology teams to incorporate these into their landscapes to enable business agility and innovation. we anticipate that to excel in this role you will: work closely with data architects and various system stakeholders to develop and maintain data models and definitions across all lines of business advise and implement best practice data modelling production, storage, and consumption standards maintain the glossary / data dictionary be involved in project initiatives to drive alignment to our data principles and standards build and maintain strong relationships with our key architects and stakeholders understand and document how data is, or will be used, and its implications on people, processes, products and technology. to be successful in this role, you will need to have: understanding of data modelling principles experience in developing both logical and physical data models data analysis and mining skills strong analytical skills ability to translate business requirements to technical requirements ability to translate high level design into specific implementation steps experience working with agile teams. with the additional skills being advantageous: software engineering background financial industry experience. you will bring a resilient character and relish opportunities to stretch yourself. if this sounds like you then get in touch! we also welcome candidates from different backgrounds who believe they have what it takes to succeed. if the above sounds like the right opportunity to further your career, apply via the link below or contact chirag.bhojani@macquarie.com for more information. the corporate operations group (cog) brings together specialist support services including workplace, human resources, market operations and technology. cog\'s purpose is to drive operational excellence through business-aligned services with a focus on quality, cost and risk. cog comprises the following divisions: digital transformation and data, business improvement and strategy, business services, human resources, market operations, and technology. find out more about macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. at macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. the one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. if you\'re capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team. we facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. talk to us about what flexibility may be available. our technology returner program is an opportunity for you to re-integrate yourself into the workforce following an extended professional career break. find out more and apply at https://www.macquarie.com/au/about/careers/jobs/returner-program

title: property team assistant
description: company : worley primary location : aus-vic-melbourne other locations : aus-nsw-sydney job : facilities support schedule : part-time employment type : contractor job level : experienced job posting : aug 11, 2019 unposting date : sep 2, 2019 reporting manager title : vice president property : at the end of april 2019, worleyparsons combined with jacobs’ energy, chemicals and resources (ecr) division, to create worley. together, we are a leading global provider of professional project and asset services in the energy, chemicals and resources sectors. we have almost 60,000 amazing people in around 60 countries across the world covering the full lifecycle, from creating new assets to sustaining and enhancing operating assets for our customers. our exciting combination will create new opportunities for you to join us. the transition will take time, so in the short-term you may see references to our heritage companies in your application process. with the global merger, worley is undergoing a significant property and lease planning and rationalisation program with an immediate focus on lease consolidation and delivery of effective economic solutions to the integrated offices and project teams. to assist with increased workload since the merger, we are seeking to appoint a property team assistant to provide business and administrative support to our global property team during the integration period . this is a 12-month fixed term part time contract role working approximately 30 hours per week (4 days). the role can be based in either melbourne or sydney. key responsibilities provide the property team with support including business analysis, data reporting, management reports, market research and analysis; ensure all new lease agreements, sub leases or renewals are uploaded to the database system with all updates vetted and approved; assist in the management and preparation of request for approvals (rfa’s) including preparation of cost analysis, and manage the lease approval process; and assist with the creation and preparation of property analysis spreadsheets, documents for internal clients, presentations and/or publications. about you experience in the property industry, or completed/undertaking appropriate tertiary qualifications in a property or related field; highly competent in ms office suite, particularly excel and powerpoint presentation; understanding of working with different cultures and in different time zones would be an advantage; able to work on multiple projects of various size and complexity and manage competing priorities; and willingness to work flexibly to accommodate seasonal demands. this is a great opportunity to join a successful global team and genuinely influence and shape the way our prestigious organisation performs. when you join worley, you’ll join an equal opportunity employer that believes in the inherent benefits of a diverse workplace, that promotes inclusion and flexibility. we encourage applications from a diverse population of people that reflects the range of countries, cultures and contexts spanned by our operations. we also work flexibly at worley and are open to a range of proposals about what arrangements would best suit our people’s needs. you must have current unrestricted working rights for the location(s) of roles you are applying for, to be eligible for consideration. to apply now for this role please complete the online application process through the worley website www.worley.com please note: no agency representation or submissions will be recognised for this vacancy.

title: graduate research assistant
description: to advance humanity - inspire curiosity curious to learn? keen for a new challenge? want to use your knowledge to make a difference? then we are looking for you!!! the company for over 19 years, ozgene has been one of the leading companies for biotechnology and medical research in the world. our vision is to advance humanity by inspiring curiosity, striving for constant innovation with the aim to provide our clients with the best service. the position ozgene is seeking two full-time graduate research assistants to support scientific processes in our laboratory. candidates should hold a bachelor of science majoring in molecular biology, genetics, biotechnology or an equivalent major. teamwork as well as good written and oral communication skills are required for this role. as a member of our laboratory you will work closely with a variety of staff members to promote a high standard of work in supporting scientific procedures. your duties will include understanding of general laboratory practice meeting laboratory safety requirements range of laboratory procedures data analysis undertaking sample preparation perform analytical testing and reporting ensure equipment and laboratory is kept clean and tidy this role does not require any previous experience working in a laboratory. our vision our vision is to expand ozgene by building our team members from the ground up. we want curious people, that are not afraid of a challenge and want to use their knowledge to advance humanity. we will provide you with support and coaching in regards to our organisational excellence culture. our philosophy focuses on using your skills to stabilise and improve our laboratory processes. providing you with the conditions to channel your curiosity into exceptional service to our clients. please forward your resume, in confidence, to careers@ozgene.com.

title: reintegration program facilitator
description: reference: vg/6754aug at the department of justice and community safety, we’re looking for people who want to make a difference. people who take pride in their work. people who get things done. people who are committed to making victoria a safer place. we embrace diversity and strive to have a workforce that reflects the community we serve. we’re all about recruiting the best people, regardless of gender, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation or cultural background. if you think you can do the job and would be a good fit for our department, we’d love to hear from you. the department is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and recognises that children’s rights need to be respected, their views welcomed and valued, and their concerns taken seriously and acted upon. if you’re having any trouble viewing this ad and would like it or any attachments in an accessible format (such as large print), please don’t hesitate to get in touch with the contact person listed on the ad. for more information on working with us and our recruitment process, please visit justice.vic.gov.au/careers we’re proud of the important work we do across victoria. want to be part of it? a great opportunity now exists for a suitably experienced professional to join our team as a reintegration program facilitator at hopkins correctional centre in ararat. about us hopkins correctional centre is a male medium security facility, focused on preparing prisoners for their transition back into the community. about the role the reintegration program facilitator is responsible for the development, delivery and evaluation of a range of group and individual program activities that are aligned to the transitional, personal development and reintegration needs of prisoners. in this role, you will: deliver programs in conjunction with service delivery providers, including co-facilitation with stakeholders and partners and monitoring service delivery to ensure achievement of outcomes maintain appropriate data collection to inform the planning, development, implementation and evaluation of programs and services delivered facilitate group support sessions to offenders and provide individual sessions when required. about you as our ideal candidate, you will have experience in program development, delivery and evaluation. your creativity, excellent interpersonal skills and commitment to support and develop others, will help you to be highly successful in the role. how to apply please click the apply button on this advertisement. applications should include a resume and covering letter. attachments can be uploaded in .doc, .docx, .pdf, .txt or .rtf formats. please note: when submitting your application online, there will be questions pertaining to a number of the position\'s key selection criteria to which you are required to respond.  favourite job print share 41 jobs are currently listed for department of justice and community safety job type: full time / until 2 august 2020 job classification: vpsg3 contact: tracey.griffin@justice.vic.gov.au job attachments: 6754 - reintegration program facilitator - pd.docx

title: retirement and savings analyst
description: see yourself being part of a large, transformational change? this could be the role for you! who we are at iress, we believe technology should help people perform better every day. since our beginning in 1993, people across financial services have trusted us to take their performance to the next level. from the world’s most established financial brands to new and disruptive players, we help improve every aspect of our clients’ businesses so that they can work better, every day. iress is one of australia’s largest technology companies and employs more than 1,900 people across australia, united kingdom, south africa, canada, new zealand and asia. the role you will collate and maintain data relating to the investment & superannuation platform industry. what you will be doing monitor, collate & prepare data on investment & superannuation platforms manage information relating to investment funds ensure that product changes are applied to our software solution in an accurate and timely manner what you will need a genuine interest in understanding software applications at an in-depth level a disciplined understanding of paying attention to detail & commitment to providing a quality service strong investigative and organisational skills strong computer literacy skills general knowledge and interest in the financial services industry, specifically within the areas of investments and superannuation why work with us competitive remuneration global opportunities casual dress, flexible work policy access to learning and development programs health benefits including private medical insurance iress community 3 days’ leave per year for charity initiatives global 36-hour hackathon cycle to work scheme 25 days holiday plus bank holidays profit share plan up to 26 weeks’ paid parental leave for primary carers (up to 4 weeks for secondary carers), and the ability to work part-time when returning to work. employment type employee time type full time

title: senior data consultant
description: salary packaging to suit your personal and financial circumstances rewards platform: your hard work won’t go unnoticed at deloitte holistic wellbeing program: free flu vaccinations and free health assessments an amazing opportunity to make an impact that matters with high profile clients - be a part of one of the fastest growing teams in the act. what will your typical day look like? as a senior consultant, you will be part of designing and implementing business intelligence and data management solutions for our key clients. you will be responsible for: data preparation, transformation and presentation using sql on several different database platforms working with the wider business to influence the strategies, architecture & design. delivering insights through a range of corporate data sources through the application of analytics, data mining and real-time decision making techniques and applications. supporting clients defining their strategy and building internal data governance framework- testing, security, accuracy and consistency. provide analysis and consultation on data quality issues for clients. about the team big data, information and analytics. three words that spark apprehension in most businesses. our team of experts are constantly curious and excited about combining our wonderful array of technological expertise to transform data into our clients’ most valuable assets, making their work smarter. our data scientists are supported with resources, training and tools they need to excel at their work, but also the freedom and power to create their own paths forward to make a difference. enough about us, let’s talk about you. we’re looking for someone with: a current security clearance or ability to obtain one (australian citizenship required) a minimum of 2 years of data management experience experience working with a structured project delivery environment, with preference of exposure to australian government clients (defence highly valued) experience with data warehousing techniques and technologies, with advanced sql skills proven experience with scripting data visualisations with an enterprise bi tool such as tableau, qlik, power bi etc. experience of cloud solutions (aws, cloudera, google analytics or similar) why deloitte?at deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. we value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated. next stepssound like the sort of role for you? apply now.if you have any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role, contact the talent acquisition team via the deloitte careers page. we’d love to hear from you! this position is only open to australian citizens due to the nature of client engagements. for other positions, we encourage non-residents, non-citizens to view our careers page and apply. by applying to this job you will be assessed against the deloitte global talent standards. we\'ve designed these standards to provide our clients and candidates with a consistent & exceptional deloitte experience globally. deloitte touche tohmatsu is the dttl member firm in australia ("deloitte australia"). "deloitte" is the brand under which tens of thousands of dedicated professionals in independent firms throughout the world collaborate to provide audit, consulting, financial advisory, risk management, tax and related services to select clients. requisition code: auexp165117

title: flood hydrologist
description: job description flood hydrologist job reference number 9102 & 13568 aps level 3 - aps level 6 (professional officer - hydrology) classification (bom broadband 5) group national forecast services program public safety section flood, tsunami and storm surge services location brisbane, 4000 or melbourne, 3008 status ongoing working hours full time $58,554 to $89,463 per annum, plus an additional 15.4% salary range superannuation closing date thursday, 22 august 2019 at 11:30pm aest applicants australian citizenship – see eligibility requirements a degree or diploma of an australian educational institution, or a comparable overseas qualification, which is appropriate mandatory requirements to the duties; or other comparable qualifications, which are appropriate to the duties. victoria dodds (07) 3239 8665 contact officer victoria.dodds@bom.gov.au 9102, 13568 1 job description about us the bureau of meteorology is one of the few organisations that touches the lives of all australians and all australia, every day. we are australia\'s national weather, climate and water agency, in the environment and energy portfolio of the australian government, operating under the authority of the meteorology act 1955 and the water act 2007. we have expertise and services to help australian prepare and respond to the realities of their natural environment, including droughts, floods, fires, storms, tsunami and tropical cyclones. our products and services include observations, forecasts, warnings, analysis and advice covering australia’s atmosphere, water, oceans and space environments. we also undertake scientific research in support of our operations and services. through regular forecasts, warnings, monitoring and advice, we provide one of australia\'s most fundamental and widely-used public services. our employees and contractors work across australia and remote islands, providing services from the antarctic to beyond the equator, and from the indian ocean to the pacific. to deliver maximum value and impact for australians, the bureau is strengthening the services we deliver to the public. to achieve this, we have embarked on a program that will design, implement, and transition to a new way of providing climatological, hydrological and meteorological services. this program will ensure we are even more connected with local communities: sharing customised insights and data to help australians make more informed decisions, and working with partners, such as emergency services, to protect the lives and livelihoods of all australians. further information is available at http://www.bom.gov.au/strengthen/ position overview the national forecasting services group of the bureau of meteorology delivers a multi-hazard forecasting and warning service for australia. as part of this group, the flood forecasting and warning section has a team in every state and territory that deliver flood forecasting services. services provided during times of flood include running calibrated hydrologic flood models, preparing and issuing flood watches and warnings and liaising with emergency services and other responsible agencies and the media. the successful applicant will work in the queensland flood team. this role will build strong relationships with customers in queensland, including emergency services and water agencies. they will support in the development of enhanced tools, techniques and documentation to support the flood warning service in queensland and contribute to australia\'s national flood warning service. suitable applicants will preferably have a strong technical background in hydrology, meteorology, engineering or science with a background and experience in flood forecasting, flood hydrology, hydraulics or catchment modelling. 9102, 13568 2 job description the ideal candidates will be excellent communicators, with the ability to communicate complex information clearly and demonstrated experience in liaising regularly with internal and external stakeholders including the media. suitable candidates will be highly motivated self-starters, and able to work within an interdisciplinary and diverse work environment under limited supervision. the role may require interstate travel and shift work during flood events, with overtime available in addition to the base salary when applicable. experience working in an operational environment will be highly regarded. job responsibilities/duties under general professional supervision: 1. lead and/or participate as a team member in the preparation for, provision of, and post- event analysis of operational flood forecasting and warning services including the briefing of external agencies, and the media. 2. undertake and report on hydrological and hydraulic studies to develop, implement, maintain and calibrate models within operational flood forecasting systems; assist in the design and implementation of verification procedures and contribute to performance reporting. 3. be available for shift work and inter-state deployment for extended periods during flood events and for training and development. 4. maintain close links with colleagues in data & digital who maintain the flood warning observation network, and monitor flood warning data and systems to ensure readiness for operations. 5. contribute to the preparation and maintenance of information held in business documents, standard operating procedures, quality management and corporate information systems. 6. contribute to service development and business improvement projects as required, with the aim to promote service excellence. projects may include introducing flood forecasting and warning services to new areas, undertaking modelling advancements and enabling product enhancement for operational flood forecasting and warning to meet customer needs. 7. represent the bureau and liaise with both internal and external stakeholders, working collaboratively with other groups on joint tasks as required. 8. carry out other duties within the national forecasting services group, as required. 9. comply with all bureau work, health and safety policies and procedures, and take reasonable care for your own health and safety and that of employees, contractors and visitors who may be affected by your conduct. 10. be aware of, and apply as necessary, the principles and practices of the various elements of the bureau\'s social justice strategy. duties representing highest function: 1 - 3 9102, 13568 3 job description immediate supervisor: national flood services manager qld selection criteria applicants are required to address the selection criteria. responses to the selection criteria should be limited to a maximum of 300 words per criterion. for information on how to address the selection criteria refer to a guide on addressing selection criteria for applicants. 1. technical knowledge: a proven record of high-quality work experience and professional competence in either flood hydrology, hydraulics, hydro-informatics or meteorology, supported by relevant qualifications. post-graduate qualifications or studies in water engineering, hydraulics, or hydrology would be advantageous. 2. professional experience: expertise and experience in the delivery of operational flood forecasting and warning services. experience and knowledge of the hydrology and meteorology required for flood forecasting in queensland would be advantageous, or; professional competence, knowledge and experience in design or operational flood hydrology and/or hydraulics, with particular emphasis on the application of computer-based models. 3. communication skills: communication skills, both written and verbal, of a high order including the ability to write and report clearly on technical and operational matters. in particular, this position requires the demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with the media, emergency management community and all internal and external stakeholders before, during and after flood events. 4. effective teamwork: demonstrated experience as an effective team member in an operational team or on a time critical project. demonstrated capability for innovation, personal drive and integrity in achieving outcomes in a technical environment based on customer needs. 5. stakeholder engagement and liaison: well-developed interpersonal skills including experience liaising effectively and building and maintaining productive networks with internal and external stakeholders, industry partners and colleagues. experience of working with these stakeholders in queensland would be advantageous. 6. social justice: knowledge and understanding of the principles of the bureau\'s social justice policies and a commitment to apply them in practice. merit list the selection process will establish a merit list that may be used to fill similar positions within 12 months. how to apply your application will consist of a resume, including contacts for two referees, and provide your responses to the selection criteria (maximum of 300 words per criterion). when addressing the selection criteria, you should take into consideration the position overview, the job responsibilities, the selection criteria and the relevant section of the integrated leadership system (ils) and aps work level standards when writing your response. 9102, 13568 4 job description where possible include specific examples of your work experience that relate to the job using the star method: situation what was the situation? task what tasks were involved in that situation? action what actions did you take? results what were the results of those actions? if this sounds like the opportunity you are looking for, submit an online application through the bureau of meteorology career website by the closing date. recruitability the bureau of meteorology is committed to supporting the employment and career development of people with disability. recruitability applies to this vacancy. under recruitability you will be invited to participate in further assessment activity for the vacancy if you choose to apply under recruitability; declare you have a disability; and meet the minimum requirements for the position. workplace adjustments we provide reasonable adjustments such as access, equipment or other practical support at relevant stages of the recruitment process. additional information to find out more about the employment conditions at the bureau, please refer to the bureau of meteorology enterprise agreement 2018. for further information on our recruitment process and how to apply refer to our careers website. should you experience any difficulties with accessing the erecruit system and applying online, please contact the recruitment unit by email jobs@bom.gov.au or phone (03) 9669 4401. 9102, 13568 5

title: engineer
description: orica is the world’s largest provider of commercial explosives and innovative blasting systems to the mining, quarrying, oil and gas and construction markets, a leading supplier of sodium cyanide for gold extraction, and a specialist provider of ground support services in mining and tunnelling. orica has a diverse workforce of around 11,500 employees and contractors, servicing customers across more than 100 countries. our purpose is to make our customers successful, every day, all around the world. we take pride in operating safely, responsibly and sustainably. together, these enable us to grow and create enduring value for our shareholders. about the roles orica yarwun makes an important contribution to the local and broader community, employing more than 200 permanent employees and 100 contractors in the gladstone area. the yarwun facilities manufacture and supply critical products to the mining and infrastructure, agriculture and other industrial sectors, with products including nitric acid, ammonium nitrate, sodium cyanide and ammonia. the team at yarwun have immediate and permanent vacancies for process / operations support / chemical engineers in their production / manufacturing teams. the successful candidates will: be responsible for the identification and management of short to medium-term operational performance parameters for the site’s production plants; lead daily production reporting; support technical and engineering systems and tools (including safe and optimal operating envelopes) to support operations; provide day-to-day discipline process/chemical engineering and process safety systems support to operations and projects; lead and contribute to management of change processes, including providing discipline reviews; lead and contribute to risk assessments, incident investigations and resolution actions; provide coaching and training through interaction with peer functions and departments; provide oversight and ownership of production data to support growth and continuous improvement opportunities. what you bring a hands-on, can do approach, with an entrenched safety focus; a recognised degree qualification in chemical engineering; 5+ years industry experience in operating facilities and/or epc environments; senior engineers welcome to apply - remuneration commensurate with experience; candidates from the oil and gas, petrochemical, power and water industries, with relevant experience, are encouraged to apply; demonstrated competencies in technical discipline, including design and engineering discipline review experience; good understanding of standards, process safety systems, including experience with technical management of change processes; rpeq (preferred) or able to obtain; rights to work in australia. what we offer the opportunities, facilities and environment associated with working in an international organisation; great family friendly location on the queensland coastline, offering various city and rural lifestyle options; diverse, inclusive and supportive team environment; flexible career paths opportunities and competitive salary packages; training programs, opportunities and initiatives to ensure your continued growth.

title: master data analyst - governance, anz
