title: inside sales representative
description: the company tnt and fedex officially joined forces on 25 may 2016. a combined fedex and tnt will enable us to more effectively grow and compete, to better meet the evolving needs of our customers and the global marketplace. for our future team members, as part of one of the strongest transportation and logistics companies in the world, this means more opportunities to grow, learn and succeed. as we continue to combine the strengths of the companies, we have exciting and challenging opportunities for new, talented team members in our tnt sales team. as tnt is part of the fedex family of companies, this role will support the operations of both fedex express and tnt in australia, and will be based at tnt’s tullamarine depot. the opportunity as an inside sales representative, you will be responsible for developing long term customer relationships enabling high levels of retention and acquisition of new business via outbound phone and electronic based communications. working monday to friday, you will be in control of a territory and focused on growing the small to medium sized customer market. your day to day activities will include retention calls to existing customers, following up on cold and warm leads to convert into sales, accurately updating the sales systems, and cross selling our full range of products, services and technologies. your drive, ability to deliver an excellent customer experience, and a proven track record in accurate data entry against targets will assist in ensuring you are successful in this very exciting and challenging role. skills & experience 1-2 years telephone sales / customer service experience proven track record in achieving sales targets pc literate & intermediate skills in microsoft office ability to communicate with impact ability to build first class relationships recent graduates welcome! the philosophy people–service–profit (psp). we take care of our people so that they can deliver impeccable service to our customers who will give us the profit necessary for fedex to be successful. our success in the industry is attributed to our people. through our psp philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages employees to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. we care for our employees’ wellbeing and value their contributions to the company. the culture we honor innovation, integrity and commitment. we have many formal policies, procedures and programs to bring out the best in our staff, individually and in teams. the mission we strive to be the best company to work for with the best service and the best brand in our industry the benefits competitive salary (incentives & bonus scheme) annual sales conference, awards and recognition, corporate events and more... full training and support in a friendly team culture excellent career progression opportunities with a global organisation special employee discounts on gym memberships, computers, electronics, health insurance, travel packages, and much more… if you have the above skills and are looking for an exciting and rewarding career, click “apply” now! we look forward to hearing from you!

title: recruitment administrator
description: fast paced recruitment firm that specialises in both white collar and labour hire recruitment has an opportunity for a recruitment administrator to join their growing team. your positivity, energy and willingness to work hard will stand you in good stead to secure this role. part of a larger business this organisation is going through some exciting change and with it will presents opportunity. you will be experienced in administration type of roles, great with people and thinking on your feet in this fast paced support role. predominately supporting a blue collar labour hire desk with all admin, candidate and compliance related tasks this role will also support the wider team of 5 - 6 recruitment consultants with admin duties: key tasks: assist and hold candidate interviewsbuild up a temp contractor data base for a busy 24/7 labour hire businessassist with weekly payrollassist with looking after key accounts on a daily basisdaily rostering of tempsall admin and office support dutieswriting, posting and managing advert responseaccount management the key to this role is attitude, too much will never be enough, you will be positive in your approach, have plenty of energy and be not afraid to role your sleeves up. recruitment industry experience will be highly regarded, particularly in the labour hire space. this is a tremendous opportunity for the right individual to establish themselves in a reputable organisation and if you are keen develop into a recruitment consultant in the medium term. if this sounds like you please submit your application and if you wish to know more please call 1300 890 554 and speak to jo.

title: dts & twc itc engineer
description: dts & twc itc engineer-trcs-aume02067682 description at bombardier transportation, our trains and rail solutions move millions of people safely and reliably around the world, every single day. join us, and you’ll be part of a global team, sharing knowledge, experience and ideas across countries and cultures, and boosting our reputation as a global leader in rail technology. your work will have a truly human impact, connecting communities, cities and businesses, and helping people to get where they need to be. it’s all about progress. if you’re ambitious, driven and team-spirited, this is your opportunity to build a career as dts & twc itc engineer in melbourne, vic. purpose of the role: install and test & commission the signaling dts (data transmission system) & twc (train to wayside communication) system in accordance with the contractual commitments and applicable process and documents. primary responsibilities: prepare, update & submit on time installation, test and commissioning documents (records, reports, method statements, technical documents, requirement management and etc) in accordance to the required specification.qma (quality management assurance) monitor, supervise, & report the site installation activities and ensure sub-contractor’s quality of work achieves the desirable quality level.report all issues related to materials (mncr), design issue(ncr), faulty equipment(fr), following the process of change order, before site execution, contract awareness is necessary in related field, configuration management, planning, follow internal process to raise any non-conformities found at site.troubleshoot the system errors found and liaise with engineering team for remedial actions.co-ordinate with engineering (dts&twc) to set up melbourne lab and perform system tests before release to site.undertake the site test & commissioning activities. perform system functional tests and ensure that all interfaces to the signalling dts&twc systems are appropriately tested according to the procedures. register the test results and obtain signoff from the customers.integration between the onboard system, communication, wayside system is required.preparing a plan and ensuring to deliver as per committed plan,troubleshooting, log analysis in case of any issues encountered.subcontractor management and training of the subcontractorpunchlist reconciliationproper tracking database for all subcontractor issues on the siteempowerment of the subcontractor including training, demonstrating, supervisingcross verification/random check. safety and environment responsibilities: demonstrate a personal commitment to the she cultural framework, policies, safety essentials and management system requirements and expectations.develop and maintain an awareness of she hazards and associated risks and demonstrate a commitment to eliminate or minimise those risks.understand and effectively undertake she accountabilities.strictly follow the local safety rules and procedures as stated in the health and safety plan qualifications key requirements: bachelor\'s degree in telecommunication, electrical, related fields3+ years of work experience in signalling systems with dts(data transmission system) & twc(train to wayside communication system) backgroundexperience with cisco switches is must.experience with data network.experience with wifi, antennas, radio communications is required. about bombardier transportation bombardier transportation is a global mobility solution provider leading the way with the rail industry’s broadest portfolio. it covers the full spectrum of solutions, ranging from trains to sub-systems and signaling to complete turnkey transport systems, e-mobility technology and data-driven maintenance services. combining technology and performance with empathy, bombardier transportation continuously breaks new ground in sustainable mobility by providing integrated solutions that create substantial benefits for operators, passengers and the environment. headquartered in berlin, germany, bombardier transportation employs around 39,850 people and its products and services operate in over 60 countries. bombardier is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, national, or local laws. job: field services primary location: au-vic-west melbourne organization: transportation schedule: full-time employee status: regular job posting: 13.08.2019, 3:01:37 am unposting date 27.09.2019, 11:59:00 pm

title: graduate/junior gis analyst
description: about us eco logical australia pty ltd is one of australia’s leading environmental assessment, strategic conservation planning and ecosystem management consultancies. we believe that we make a significant contribution to improving environmental outcomes in australia by delivering high quality consulting services that combine a landscape approach with sound scientific principles, strategic thinking, effective communication and integrity. due to our company’s continued and sustained growth we have an opportunity for an enthusiastic gis analyst to join our team and learn from dynamic and highly respected environmental professionals in our perth office. about the role this position will be responsible for the provision of gis support, mapping and spatial analysis services to environmental planning, ecology, heritage, water and bushfire projects. you will generally be involved in spatial data creation, data management, spatial analysis, map production and other project outputs. additionally, report writing, tender preparation, general project assistance and some field work may be required. about you you will meet the following essential criteria: tertiary qualifications in gis or environmental science with a strong gis focus (demonstrated by academic transcript) have up to three years’ professional experience as a gis officer or similardemonstrated skills and experience using arcgis (arcmap and arcpro)exceptional written and verbal communication skillssound time management skillsability to build and nurture internal and external relationships, provide gis support across simultaneous projects, and deliver required outputs within budget and time deadlines efficient problem-solving skills and ability to work independently when required. it’s also desirable that you have: an awareness of the biodiversity of the swan coastal plain bioregion and relevant spatial datasets an awareness of relevant commonwealth and state legislationexperience with other gis platforms such as envi and mapinfo and ability to convert datasets to or from various platforms. we offer competitive remuneration reviewed annually birthday leave – yes, a paid day off on your birthday!study assistance program and corporate training programflexible working arrangements travel discounts and membership through our corporate traveller programmembership to a professional associationemployee assistance program for you and your familyability to salary sacrifice for additional annual leave and superannuation contributionsannual staff conferencegenerous reward and recognition programa workplace culture underpinned by our values of o listen first o share your genius o be courageous o feed the culture how to apply please forward your application (cover letter, short cv, response to selection criteria and copy of your academic transcript) to bec south, hr coordinator, via hr@ecoaus.com.au before close of business friday 6 september 2019. your email should reference “perth graduate/junior gis analyst” in the subject line.

title: materials technician
description: perform materials testing procedures under supervision in accordance with departmental standards, specifications, policies and procedures.• assist with investigation and research projects using project management principles.• assist in the analysis of test data and the drafting and preparation of technical reports.• participate in all prescribed training and development opportunities required under the trainee contract.• whs is a key accountability of this role and successful applicants must perform whs activities and responsibilities. applications to remain current for 12 months. job ad reference: qld/319517/19 closing date: thursday, 22 august 2019this work is licensed under a creative commons attribution 3.0 australia license.

title: advertising specialist
description: over the last 20 years, lentil as anything has grown to occupy a prominent status in melbourne\'s cultural mindscape, providing a hub for the community to engage with each other, food, music, art and events. we offer individuals the chance to experience feelings of dignity and inclusion. and the disenfranchised and disadvantaged or otherwise to engage with their local community and build trust, understanding, and mutual respect.maintained solely on the goodwill of our patrons private donations, and the tireless efforts of our volunteers, lentil as anything is not only involved in providing a space for the disenfranchised to re-engage but is also engaged in community-minded efforts against food waste, through our food without borders food recovery programs; urban renewal and transformation through community gardening initiative urban gardens, and international cultural exchange programs, featuring theme nights, cultural and language classes, and more.key responsibilitiesplanning, developing and organising advertising policies and campaigns to increase the number of patrons coming to the restaurants, increase the donations onsite and online…advising all the divisions of lentil as anything on advertising strategies and campaigns to reach target markets, creating consumer awareness and effectively promoting the attributes of goods and services.coordinating production of advertising campaigns involving specialised activities, such as artwork, copywriting, social media and social media placement, within time and budget constraints. analysing data regarding consumer patterns and preferences. interpreting and predicting current and future consumer trends.qualifications/accreditationessential: studies in journalism/advertising.more than 5 years of experience in equivalent or comparable roles.experience in hospitality greatly preferred.at least 2 years of international experience in the field required.fluent in at least two languages, one of them english.extensive experience and expertise with google g-suite applications, in particular, power-user expertise in google drive office suite applications.self-starter and able to work without supervision.the successful candidate should understand the special character of a not-for-profit organisation based on volunteers and a pay-as-you-feel model like lentil as anything.job type: full-timesalary: $65,000.00 /year

title: data management lead
description: the role: as the data management lead you will focus on data matching, data reconciliation and data quality activities to ensure the reliability and integrity of the client directory data. you will act as an interface between the unit and hospital and health service stakeholders as a point of expertise and escalation. further duties include: co-ordinate the data management work flows between the client directory management unit and hospital and health service. assist with the development, administration and management of continuous improvement projects to improve and drive service delivery standards. identify and manage risks for the team, plan for contingencies and ensure staff are trained on changes to protocols, practices and procedures. are you right for this role?to be successful in this role you will have knowledge and skills with data matching and the use of administrative and clinical information systems particularly with respect to patient demographic data as well as ability to analyse, successfully resolve and provide expert advice on data management enquiries. furthermore, you will have experience in managing staff in line with contemporary human resource management policies, procedures and practices including employment equity, anti-discrimination, occupational health and safety and ethical behaviourabout health informatics services - ehealth queensland: health informatics services provides quality advice and development of material relating to information management priorities, strategies, and policies.the team provides the following functions:  information management strategy – the setting of strategic information management direction and assisting customers better manage information, including through the development and implementation of policy and governance. clinical records management - providing strategic direction and authoritative advice on clinical records management and facilitating a coordinated approach for data access management. health standards and capability - working collaboratively in the development of clinical data set definitions and codesets, primarily intended to support direct patient care and health care provider communication and lead efforts to build health informatics competency and capability across queensland health ehealth queensland is one of the largest information communication technology operations in the state. it is responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of information systems and technologies so that queensland health employees and health providers have access to information that supports the delivery of health care. benefits of working with ehealth queensland: by joining ehealth queensland you will work within a fast-paced, challenging and supportive environment where every employee plays a critical role in our ongoing success.you will enjoy a variety of benefits, including:  competitive salary + generous superannuation and leave loading flexible working arrangements diverse work culture career training and development to apply for this exciting opportunity, submit your resume and a short statement (maximum 2 pages) on how your experience, abilities, knowledge and personal qualities are relevant for the role, taking into account the key responsibilities and attributes noted in the ‘how you will be assessed?\' section.this work is licensed under a creative commons attribution 3.0 australia license.

title: data entry administrator
description: data entry, state government organisation, full time temporary position, eastern suburbs, immediate start your new company this reputable state government organisation services the victorian public and are solely committed to taking appropriate action in the case of emergencies and minimising the impact and harm on the wider community and environment . based in the south eastern suburbs, their mission is to implement and follow strategies and policies that allow for efficient responses in critical situations. your new role due to a backlog in a busy period of the year, an exciting full time temporary opportunity has been created for a data entry officer to join this team that prides itself on promoting collaboration and cooperation in a busy working environment. you will be working within a dynamic environment and this full time position will see you reporting into the payroll manager and perform a range of administrative tasks to provide support, including, but not limited to; assist the payroll team with completing all data entry required and information processing provide support with maintaining all records and files in accordance to policies and procedures adhoc administrative tasks in the office where relevant communicate effectively with the team to ensure status and completion of all data entry tasks what you\'ll need to succeed to be successful in this role it will be highly regarded to have a strong data entry background and proven experience. ideally also to have experience working within a state government environment and possess an ability to adapt quickly and execute all tasks efficiently within given time frames. this role requires a highly self-driven and organised candidate with excellent communication skills. what you\'ll get in return this is a fantastic opportunity to be involved with a recognised government body where you will be rewarded with the prospect of career development opportunities. what you need to do now if you’re interested, click ‘apply now’ to forward an up-to-date copy of your cv to kim nguyen via kim.nguyen@hays.com.au [mailto:kim.nguyen@hays.com.au] or call directly on 03 9946 3555. #2189903

title: data warehouse engineer
description: at canva, we work every day to make a significant positive impact on society. our mission is to democratise design and empower creativity for anyone and everyone, on every platform! since launch in april 2013 we have grown exponentially, amassing over 15 million users in over 100 languages. we are one of the world’s fastest growing technology companies with software engineering being the core part of who we are. our data engineering team is seeking experienced data warehousing engineers to help build out our new platforms and systems to support the continued growth of canva\'s technical footprint. we take pride in our focus on software engineering fundamentals and pragmatism. with engineers from previous companies such as google, facebook, atlassian, amazon, and yahoo, the team strives to use the most appropriate tools for the tasks at hand - striking a measured balance between getting things done and long term maintainability. responsibilities hands-on development, tuning, and overall management of our newly acquired data warehouse platform responsibility for the continued development of new features, functionality, and optimisation from raw data ingestion, to the access and modelling layer, through to maintaining the visualization layer providing functional and technical subject matter expertise with respect to data management, business intelligence, and reporting to internal stakeholders across the canva business responsibility for managing planning and delivery of data projects and initiatives across the wider business; in conjunction with experiments, product analytics, and the machine learning team required skills & experience a demonstrated grounding in the data warehousing domain – experience building and managing large data warehouse and data mart environments in the cloud (aws, google cloud, etc) advanced sql scripting skills as well as reasonable proficiency any of the following: java, scala, or python experience developing dashboards and reporting systems an understanding of the hadoop ecosystem and related technologies: mapreduce, hdfs, yarn, hive, presto, impala, etc familiarity with a wide set of data warehouse architectures and methodologies, schemas, and performance / optimization principles excellent written & and verbal communication and collaborative skills company benefits competitive salary, plus equity options flexible working hours – we value work-life balance in-house chefs that cook delicious breakfast and lunch for us each day on-site gym; yoga membership generous parental leave policy pet-friendly offices sponsored social clubs and team events

title: financial accountant
description: about jessie mcpherson private hospital jessie mcpherson private hospital (jmph) is a 103 bed tertiary level private hospital which has been co-located at monash medical centre clayton since 1987. our co-location with monash health provides a unique opportunity for access to world-renowned research and teaching facilities. jessie mcpherson private hospital also has a wider official specialist role for greater melbourne, regional victoria and interstate in such specialties as cardiology, cardiothoracic surgery, neuro-surgery, gastro-surgical, high acuity maternity and neonatal services. about the role the role requires a professional, experienced in supporting financial decision making by collecting, analysing, investigating and reporting financial and business data. the key responsibilities are: financial analysis and reporting; end of month processing and reconciliations; support annual budget build; respond to financial enquiries by gathering, analysing, summarising and interpreting data; support annual financial reporting process; accounts payable and receivables management; and other related duties as defined from time to time by the finance manager and director corporate services. about you essential experience profile high degree of self-direction, initiative and motivation. excellent attention to detail. relevant tertiary qualification, minimum of bachelor of business/commerce with accounting specialty. professional qualification or working towards ca or cpa is desirable. relevant professional or business experience. strong ability to negotiate and influence others. excellent communication skills. highly developed problem solving and stakeholder management skills. self-managed and able to set and work towards deadlines/milestones. ability to work with stakeholders in the facilitation of solutions, and to develop engagement and understanding. demonstrated experience in systems and business analysis. stakeholder engagement/management. business requirements and process documentation. ability to work under pressure and deliver to tight time frames. ability to work collaboratively across organisational boundaries and build strong working relationships with customers, vendors and team members. desired experience profile knowledge of the healthcare environment flexibility and adaptability demonstrated ability to meet objectives in a changing and face paced environment experience with operations and change management strategic thinking skills monash health recognises the value of equal employment opportunity and is committed to patient safety and promoting fairness, equity and diversity in the workplace. at monash health we are relentless in our pursuit of excellence and work to our six guiding principles. preferred candidates will require a clear police check and a current working with children’s check prior to any offers of employment being made. as part of our selection process, you may be invited by email to participate in an on-camera video interview. please note, applications will be accepted via the monash health online mercury system only. email applications will not be considered.

title: program support officer, achievement program
description: support the delivery of the achievement program in victoria work with a diverse team enhancing health promoting environments in early childhood services, schools and workplaces be a part of australia’s most trusted cancer ‘not for profit’ organisation full time fixed term position for 12 months – st kilda road, melbourne about your environment since our establishment in 1936, cancer council victoria has developed an international reputation for our innovative work in cancer research, prevention and support. as an independent, not-for-profit organisation, we play a leading role in reducing the impact of all cancers on all people. the prevention division aims to reduce the risk of cancer in the victorian population through social marketing, advocacy, professional training and providing policy advice based on the best available evidence. this involves action to affect individual behaviours as well as to influence the broader physical and legislative environment. the prevention division includes a broad range of cancer prevention and screening programs including the achievement program which aims to support workplaces, schools and early childhood services to enhance their health promoting environments. it does this through assisting organisations to achieve set quality standards and by providing a fully integrated quality framework for prevention. the achievement program sets quality benchmarks for health promotion action, as well as providing consistency across victoria as part of the broader community effort to improve health and wellbeing. about your opportunity we are seeking a program support officer to join the achievement program team. reporting to the education coordinator, your role is to: provide high-quality support to early childhood services and schools to engage with and progress through the achievement program provide expert advice to members regarding progression through the achievement program implement activities to build the capacity of health promoters, education members and workplace members participate in data analysis and monthly, quarterly and annual reporting required for effective monitoring and evaluation of program activities all about you we are looking for someone with: tertiary qualifications in public health, health promotion, social sciences or a related discipline or relevant experience. demonstrated knowledge and experience in supporting and implementing public health projects, programs or policy. sound understanding of settings-based health promotion principles. sound relationship and communication skills (written and verbal) particularly in communicating health promotion practice to an education audience what we can offer you a base salary within range $59,823 - $66,208 pa plus superannuation and access to a generous not-for-profit salary packaging program (up to $18,550 of your salary tax-free) https://www.accesspay.com.au/employee/what-is-salary-packaging/ the opportunity to make a positive impact on the lives of those affected by cancer a flexible and supportive workplace, with excellent work-life balance and opportunities for career progression and development to apply and for more info aboriginal and/or torres strait islander peoples are encouraged to apply. culturally and linguistically diverse applicants are encouraged to apply. to apply for this opportunity download a position description and forward your resume and cover letter to hr@cancervic.org.au. ensure that your cover letter addresses the key selection criteria detailed within the position description. for more information contact tope adepoyibi on (03) 9514 6674. cancer council will only make contact with applicants that are shortlisted for interview. we are also unable to respond to recruitment agency enquiries. all offers of employment will be made subject to satisfactory completion of employment checks including evidence of right to work in australia, a national police check. applications close 19 august 2019

title: accounts payable officer
description: medhealth group is australia\'s most trusted provider for health solutions across australia, the medhealth group is made up of multiple independent businesses providing specialist medical, rehabilitation & return to work, employment, business and legal services. currently we have an excellent opportunity for a finance officer to join our corporate team based in our melbourne cbd office working on a full time basis. about the role reporting to the financial controller this role will see you conducting accounts payable and accounts administration duties within the finance team. key tasks will include: liaison with relevant internal stakeholders regarding enquiries and claims processes ensure all data is accurate and maintained as per service agreement and compliance procedures general accounts administration as required assisting the wider finance team with adhoc accounts duties as required about you you will be an experienced finance officer with excellent knowledge of accounts payable process along with: excellent attention to detail; excellent time management skills and ability to work within a deadline driven environment; high degree of initiative and ability to work proactively excellent communication skills both written and verbal and; intermediate skills using microsoft office and software programs successful applicant will be required to produce a satisfactory police clearance working for medhealth group medhealth group is committed to our team members, working for medhealth not only offers you a very rewarding career, but we also offer: career development and progression opportunities nationally; career development and progression opportunities across the work health group; discounted health insurance; road side assistance and; supportive friendly environment further details about medhealth group can be found via our website: www.medhealthgroup.com.au medhealth group promotes a workplace that actively seeks to include, welcome and value the contributions of all people and encourages people with a disability, aboriginal and torres strait islander people, and people from culturally diverse backgrounds to apply.

title: business & geospatial data analytics specialist
description: specialist role small professional team conveniently located just off the m4 at huntingwood endeavour energy is a ‘poles and wires’ business. we are responsible for the safe and reliable supply of electricity to 2.4 million people in households and businesses across sydney’s greater west, the blue mountains, the southern highlands, the illawarra and south coast. we are 50.4 per cent owned by an australian-led consortium of long-term investors within the private sector operating the network under a 99 year lease. the remaining 49.6 per cent is held by the nsw government. our customers are central to our plans. we’re committed to delivering better value for customers by reducing our costs, without compromising safety or services. about the role based at huntingwood, this role is primarily responsible for monitoring, collecting, analysing, interpreting, manipulating, reporting and distributing spatially and asset related referenced data. this involves gathering and documenting business level and technical requirements, from both internal and external sources, necessary for developing and actioning programs of work on technical asset data to ensure timely delivery of quality of data relating to streetlighting. the role requires specialist understanding of the use, purpose and data models of key streetlighting systems. it provides advice to senior stakeholders on how best to interpret spatial data. the challenges of the role are:  to be agile and adaptable to new technology within the geospatial community and understanding and evaluating the impact on the company. integration of existing systems into an integrated sap operational platform communicating information, which can sometimes be highly technical, in a way which customers and peers can understand and derive meaning from. this information will be used to justify/implement change in an environment where employees are sometimes resistant. maintaining and ensuring the quality of data integrated within various information systems, whilst at the same time maintaining a clear focus ensuring company information needs continue to be met. this will require an ability to objectively assess the future internal and external spatial landscape and to discern a commercially appropriate direction amidst a multitude of competing agenda.  about you degree qualified in surveying or geospatial science, you will have experience in similar role within the utilities, energy, public services, education or telecommunications industry. you have highly developed analytical skills, a sound knowledge of esri arcgis software and experience in spatial data management with the ability to query data in ms sql. a result driven achiever and innovative problem solver who can generate workable solutions and resolve complaints, you possess highly developed interpersonal and communication skills and the ability the engage with a diverse range of stakeholders, both internal and external. key to your success in this role is your ability to work effectively within a busy environment with multiple and concurrent projects. our diversity commitment: endeavour energy is an equal employment opportunity (eeo) employer and we encourage diversity within our organisation. diversity and inclusion makes our organisation better, safer, stronger and more competitive. we are proud of our differences and are committed to actively shaping our workplace into one that is inclusive and where individual contributions are valued. women, aboriginal and torres strait islanders and people with a multicultural background are strongly encouraged to apply. applications close 5pm on 26 august 2019.

title: new graduate, associate consultant
description: university summary: vmware recognizes that today’s students are tomorrow’s trailblazers and we value the opportunity to benefit from your fresh perspective. if you thrive in an open, innovative, technology-driven culture, vmware could be the place for you! you will be exposed to a wide range of software platform technologies that are utilized by customers all over the world. business summary: vmware is a global leader in cloud infrastructure and business mobility. vmware accelerates customers’ digital transformation journey by enabling enterprises to master a software-defined approach to business and it. with vmware solutions, organizations are building extraordinary experiences by mobilizing everything. our customers are responding faster to opportunities with modern data and apps hosted across hybrid clouds, and safeguarding customer trust with a defense-in-depth approach to cybersecurity. at the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. do you dare to do the stuff you’ve always dreamed about? dare to explore at http://careers.vmware.com. vmware offers cutting-edge cloud infrastructure and security services to companies of all shapes and sizes. our world is all about technology, and that world is growing because the imagination, ingenuity and talent of our teams knows no bounds. we believe that creativity sparks innovation and inspires our employees to think of vmware differently and change the world around them. job role and responsibilities vmware academy is a global development program that is designed to fast track new graduates from in-depth training into successful careers within the worldwide sales and services organization. as a part of vmware academy, you will begin your journey by being immersed in several weeks of collaborative training known as foundation (classroom) at a designated vmware location. upon completion of foundation training, you will return to your home office and move into role based (on-the-job) training over the course of 4-6 months depending on role and location. during your role based training you will continue to develop your skills and product knowledge while creating meaningful mentor relationships that will ignite your career. after role based training, you will have completed academy and transition into your role and business unit. with continued development, manager support, and ongoing mentorship your growth is limitless. we are looking for an associate who is passionate in the below role: associate consultant the associate consultant will work with our highly talented and experienced vmware professional services team to deliver creative solutions to our customers to help unlock the benefits of our vmware products. in this role, you will use your technical, consultative, communication, and leadership skills to support the successful implementation of vmware software solutions (cloud, mobility, network/security) in a variety of industry verticals and customer environments. you will have the opportunity to work directly with the client and other team members on the day-to-day tasks involved with the solution delivery, including, but not limited to: planning, customer assessments, system configuration, testing, training, troubleshooting, and technical issue resolution. this job opportunity is not eligible for employment-based immigration sponsorship by vmware. required skills: bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering and any relevant field of study. passionate about technology. strong analytical skills. excellent social and communication skills (both written and verbal). high interpersonal skills with the ability to work well in a team and customer-facing environment. preferred skills: hands-on it experience from either internships, co-ops, work experience and/or projects. application development and coding experience. leadership experience through either leading extracurricular activities (e.g. university clubs/committee) or volunteer work. technical knowledge of or prior experience using vmware products strong foundation and knowledge of it basics, including (networks, security, storage, compute, etc.) other requirements tonote: be able to start in march 2020 (program start date). this role is based in melbourne, vic. kindly state in your cv summary why you are interested in applying for this position. you must have the legal right to work in australia to apply for this position (e.g. australian citizen or australian permanent resident) recent graduates who have graduated within 12 months before the va program start date (march 2020) are welcome to apply.

title: campus secretary
description: haileybury is one of the leading schools in the asia-pacific region with campuses and education programs at keysborough, brighton, berwick, city (melbourne), darwin and china. the school has enrolments exceeding 5,000 across its operations, and is acclaimed for its outstanding academic achievements, small class sizes, broad range of co-curricular activities and international opportunities. haileybury is seeking a campus secretary at its city campus. this is a full-time, permanent position commencing as soon as possible. responsibilities include: reception duties, including distribution of incoming and outgoing mail and email manage parent, staff and student enquiries student-related duties, including assisting with attendance records, processing student bus passes, accessing the student database set-up enrolment interview appointments with heads of school provide back-up support to the health centre (including absentee data base) collate year book data extra duties as directed by the head of campus benefits of working at haileybury work for the largest school in australia myki card provided highly competitive salary plus 11% superannuation 9 weeks annual leave cbd location professional development opportunities you are the ideal candidate if you: have previous experience in a reception/administration position are calm and patient with excellent communication skills are efficient and process driven hold a working with children check card value and build collaborative working relationships

title: business analyst
description: location: melbourne, australia work type: permanent full time salary range aud 90,000 to aud 100,000 jetstar thrives on innovation! we are always looking to employ ambitious and proactive professionals to help our business work smarter and more efficiently. you will be encouraged to think innovatively whilst developing and maintaining best practice. as part of the group customer strategy team, you will be responsible for reporting and providing insight into the drivers behind our customer advocacy through our net promoter score (nps). the role supports various analytic tasks, including monthly reporting, ad hoc analysis on customer advocacy drivers at both a group and airline level as well as delivering on the customer strategy for the jetstar group. this role requires the incumbent to be a strong customer and team advocate to ensure customers (both internal and external) are at the heart of what we do. reporting to the manager for customer projects, your main accountabilities will include: manage the preparation of executive reports on jetstar’s customer npsdevelop insights that assess the driver of advocacy to support business decision makingsupport changes to ensure best practice approach to customer insights to assist with decisions and prioritisation within the businesssupport the inputs for business cases to best consider the customer in decisions impacting our customer experiencebuild and manage self-service reporting functionality within powerbi and other data driven systems participate in the development, communication, and implementation of the overall jetstar customer strategysupport project delivery for the jetstar group customer strategy and related tasks as requiredable to travel internationally where required. to be successful in this role, you will demonstrate the following skills & experience: demonstrated experience in data analyticsexcellent microsoft office suite skills (particularly powerbi) with the ability to communicate information that tells a story, highlights key insights and influences ceo, executivesself-motivation with a positive attitude and commitment to deliver high quality outputs to tight deadlines accurate, reliable and efficient analysis of data from multiple sources and business expertsstrong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyability to work as a part of a team, including across cultures with international based stakeholders. about us the jetstar group has airlines in australia, new zealand, singapore, japan and vietnam. since launch in 2004, we have grown from a team of 700 to 7,600 and have flown more than 250 million passengers. collectively we now offer more than 5000 flights a week to more than 85 destinations in 17 countries and territories across the asia pacific region, with a fleet of more than 130 aircraft. our culture jetstar is alive with a sense of adventure. day in and day out, our teams search for new places to fly, new ways to add value and new ideas to improve performance. if you love the road less travelled, you’ll love working here because ours is a team who innovate every day, thrive on delivery, support each other and celebrate our successes. you’ll be supported to challenge, anticipate and explore while you work will connect people and enrich lives. we encourage diversity and aim to create an environment where our employees feel valued, respected and enabled. our benefits team members have access to heavily discounted fares to destinations all over the world – not only for team members, but for their favourite travel companions too. our staff travel benefit includes discounts on airfares, accommodation, car hire and travel insurance for both domestic and international travel. discounts can be used within the jetstar group airlines, qantas and other partner airlines. reference number: r60638 contact details: company: jetstar date posted: 6/08/2019 4:01:00 pm

title: health & wellbeing partner
description: health & wellbeing partner reece is an australian icon. you probably know us as australia\'s largest supplier of plumbing and bathroom products. we have been around for almost 100 years. but that\'s just one side of us. we\'re a major public company with over 6,000 people, 600 locations and more than 10 business lines. we thrive on new ideas and have the courage to make them happen. about the role: we are looking for an experienced health and wellbeing partner to join and support our safety and wellbeing team in the reece support centre in burwood. key responsibilities of the role include but are not limited to: understanding national workers compensation schemes, experience in managing complex workers compensation claims and return to work of employees. . this includes mental health and long term absences; partnering with our advisory team where appropriate managing non-work related injury and illnesses, liaising with treating practitioner’s , including the facilitation of independent medical examinations ensuring up to date workcover documentation from employees, branch management, insurers and medical practitioners have an understanding of premiums, relevant state legislation and a strong ability to investigate and dispute claims where neccesary. ensuring relevancy of workcover and ohs procedures, policies, forms and documents for best practice assist in the development and application of risk assessments assist with incident investigations, determining root cause and corrective actions visit branches to assist them with any safety & wellbeing initiatives and return to work planning about you to be successful in this role you will have: proven experience in providing quality injury management strategies and confidence to drive professional judgement associated to workplace health and wellbeing initiatives. experience in returning employees back to work effectively and efficiently a strong understanding of workers compensation legislation and the resources available to get employees back to work be digitally savvy with a passion for data and analytics. a team player who is capable of being empathetic, influential with a continuous improvement mindset. this is an important hire for the business, the successful candidate will be an excellent communicator in providing valuable advice for the network and your tight knit team. if this sounds like you and you want more information about the role, please apply now. how can you build a career with reece. reece is different. we\'re a successful company that doesn\'t like to make a fuss of our success. we\'re a big business that works hard to retain the great things from when we were a small business. we value common sense as highly as a university degree. we encourage people to have a go and don\'t mind if they fail. we promote people based on performance, not age. reece is a place where people make a real difference. and that\'s the secret to our success - having the right people, with the right attitude in the right roles. we\'re looking for the right people now. people who like people. people who like to talk but also like to listen. people who like to perform. people who can recognise an opportunity and seize it. people who are prepared to promote themselves. read on. you will quickly discover whether you might be the right person, and whether we might be the right place for your career. if you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you\'ll enjoy your career with us!

title: bookkeeper
description: about the company grant thornton is a leading business adviser that helps dynamic organisations to unlock their potential for growth. our brand is respected globally, as one of the major global accounting organisations recognised by capital markets, regulators and international standards setting bodies. about the role you will get involved a broad range of activities including: australian statutory compliance work under the direction of a ca or cpa, which may include: financial statement preparation and basic taxation returns, setup of client files including backup and rollover of general ledgers, work papers etc general client work including data entry, transaction coding, reconciliations (bank, debtors, creditors, gst reconciliations) preparation of complete and accurate work papers to support client financial balances and tax return balances skype, email, telephone and face-to-face contact with extended gtal pa team skills and experience you’ll be agile, responsive and bring innovative ideas to the table. your passion for understanding your clients’ businesses will see you go beyond addressing technical issues to developing actionable growth recommendations. this role will suit someone with the following skills, experience and attributes: minimum 1 years’ experience in financial compliance type work excellent written and verbal communication skills good problem solving and analytical skills ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines ability to work efficiently and accurately strong work ethic and a genuine interest contributing to the growth of our business knowledge of myob ae and/or myob small business products a plus demonstrate a working knowledge of word for windows and excel diploma in accounting / tafe qualification preferred. culture at grant thornton, we encourage our people to bring their whole selves to work. we recognise, appreciate and harness our people\'s individual skills and talents. you will thrive in our down to earth yet entrepreneurial environment which empowers our people to succeed within a social work culture. we recognise the increasing importance of flexible work options and family friendly work practices in maintaining a diverse, adaptive and high performing workforce able to meet our current and future business needs. benefits attractive salary free annual gym membership ca support regular social events how to apply to apply, please click on the apply now button, complete our online application form and upload your cv. if you experience any technical difficulties applying please contact the grant thornton people & culture team on gttalentscouts@au.gt.com

title: demand forecasting specialist
description: demand forecasting specialist challenge yourself in this executive level positions available in domestic and international revenue management take pride in joining a dynamic role within a highly commercial environment multiple roles available: 1 x 12 month fixed term contract 2 x permanent positions as a qantas employee, you’re already helping us to embody the spirit of australia each and every day. and with this role, there’s a real opportunity for you to showcase that spirit in new and exciting ways – while taking your career to exciting places as well. located within revenue management we are seeking a demand forecasting specialist to join our team. this key role will see you accountable for maximising network revenue outcomes through optimal and accurate forecasts at a market level across a portfolio of significant origin and destination (o&d) network flows, with revenue responsibility of over $500m per annum. this role is highly analytical and will work with many stakeholders across different route groups. in addition, the position will require someone who has a curiosity around drivers for supply and demand and determining the best approach on how to react to the market and our competitors in a dynamic, fast moving and highly competitive environment. your main responsibilities will include: identify and execute revenue maximisation strategies, market optimisation and process improvement for allocated origin and destination network flows monitoring, validating and influencing the o&d forecast for a strategic set of o&d’s recognize and pro-actively adjust the forecast to changing passenger flows due to market events, economic impacts, schedule change, competitor action design and evaluate the effectiveness of individual and joint market strategies direct and oversee demand planning for peak periods and special events affecting multiple markets distil large data sets into meaningful management information to communicate market performance and trends and to drive revenue improvement actions develop and maintain in-depth understanding of the complex analytical and statistical models used in revenue management in order to optimise revenue outcomes identification and ownership of process enhancements and simplification and standardisation of working practises you’ll have - degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, operations research or another applied quantitative discipline and working knowledge of statistics and forecasting techniques strong conceptual, analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to synthesize complex situations, formulate solution sets and present results in simple, understandable terms stakeholder engagement across sales, groups and pricing business units to enable open communication, collaboration and opportunities and ensure to ensure price to demand synchronisation working knowledge of statistics and forecasting techniques an interest in optimisation problem-solving, economic game theory, elasticity, and consumer buying behavior previous experience within an airline revenue management function or financial trading would be highly advantageous we’re often asked to achieve the impossible, but we boldly take on the challenge knowing we’re not alone. when we work together, we accomplish more than we could’ve ever imagined. qantas is an equal opportunity employer, so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of an organisation that encourages diversity, supports charities and environmental initiatives. we encourage aboriginal and torres strait islander, and people of all backgrounds to apply. if you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application. if you’re ready to step into a culture that will challenge and excite you, submit an application and let’s explore how we go places together. applications close wednesday, 21st august 2019

title: 2019 - undergraduate environmental scientist
description: make amazing happen ! with the ever-changing landscape of infrastructure and development in australia and new zealand, we are excited to be seeking our next cohort of undergraduates. we are seeking enthusiastic undergraduates who love problem solving, working in diverse teams and who share our passion for excellence in client service and project delivery. at aecom we believe that infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. our 87,000 professionals around the world partner with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for generations to come. from transportation, water and energy, to buildings and national governments, aecom is the world’s premier infrastructure firm. whether you are an engineer, planner, scientist or data expert, we are looking for people who share our purpose and are passionate about improving the communities in which we operate. opportunities are available in our geoscience and remediation services team. your development as an undergraduate, you will have the chance to work alongside graduates, technical experts and industry leaders. you will gain exposure to iconic projects that help shape and connect our cities and communities. this will be a fantastic opportunity to build long-term meaningful connections for your career’s. we will provide you with support and direction to ensure you have a positive placement with us and return to university inspired. minimum requirements key responsibilities + assist team and project managers by developing good working relationships with clients during the delivery of projects + develop good relations with your team and other teams across multiple business areas and locations preferred qualifications + undertaking a tertiary qualification in environmental science + interest in site work and getting hands on. + a strong sense of commitment, a willingness to learn, and a desire to work in a dynamic deadline driven environment + excellent written and verbal communication skills + demonstrated time management and organisational skills what we offer when you join aecom, you become part of a company that is pioneering the future . our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. we ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions inclusion, diversity and overall employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. our core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only delivering a better world , but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. as an equal opportunity employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

providing sovereign, agile and hyper-scale cloud services to the government and its partners.  vault’s marketing team is responsible for managing vaults reputation (public relations), branding, and collateral.

of the engineering in our products, systems and service offerings keeps our customers ahead. abb\'s motion business is the largest supplier of drives and motors, globally. we provide customers with the complete range of electrical motors, generators, drives and services, as well as mechanical power transmission products and integrated digital powertrain solutions. we have an exciting opportunity tools and teams to exceed customer expectations while ensuring sustainable operations your responsibilitiesworking with local management teams to: prevent mistakes and defects in products and avoid title: chiller assessor
description: an exciting opportunity for an experienced and motivated chiller assessor currently exists to join our brooklyn plant. located just 15 minutes west of the melbourne cbd, our brooklyn plant is a 5 day, multi-species operation with the capacity to process up to 1,400 head of cattle and 8,200 head of small stock per day. the successful candidate will be responsible for: visually assess carcases as per aus-meat / msa requirements check documentation use a hand held dcu to enter grading data upload and generate reports calibration of equipment correct grade positively identified by company grading system report any no compliance of carcase segregation to senior management the successful candidate will possess the following: previous experience in meat processing facility statement of attainment in chiller/ assessment for aus-meat / msa highly regarded computer literate understand and comply with workplace health and safety standard demonstrated interpersonal and communication skills. reliable transport. ability to work as part of the team and individually ability to follow jbs australia policies and procedures ability to pass a drug and alcohol test strong work ethic ability to communicate and work seamlessly with internal stakeholders well trained, motivated employees are the key to our success. jbs understands that employment is a partnership. we are committed to offering a positive work environment, continuous learning and appropriately rewarding the people who make our company a success. interested in applying? click apply apply here: www.jbssa.com.au/jobs jbs australia – attn. kristine mccormack

title: datastage engineer
description: a global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, the capgemini group is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients\' opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. it is a multicultural company of over 200,000 team members in more than 40 countries. the group reported 2018 global revenues of eur 13.2 billion. people matter, results count. learn more about us at www.capgemini.com let\'s talk about the team: our insights and data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. our clients are among australia\'s top performing companies and they choose to partner with capgemini for. a very good reason - our exceptional people.due to continued growth within capgemini\'s insights & data practice we intend to recruit a number of datastage engineers with relevant consulting and communication skills. if you are already working in a consultancy role, or. have excellent client-facing skills gained within large organizations, we would like to discuss our consultant opportunities with you. let\'s talk about the role and responsibilities: design parallel jobs and job sequences. deign - data mappings and metadata sheets design generic jobs leveraging run time column propagation (rcp) - multi instance parallel jobs performance fine tuning and troubleshooting + debugging on parallel jobs. script complex sql queries. design and schedule control m batch flows. datastage administration let\'s talk about your qualifications and experience: proven working experience as datastage engineer for. 5+ years preferably on ibm information server - infosphere datastage 11.5 parallel edition understanding of iis - infosphere datastage design and run time architecture exposure and knowledge on grid/cluster architecture experience in datastage administration knowledge on control - m architecture knowledge on custom operators and server/parallel routines. understanding of mainframe ebcdic files and cobol copybooks multi layouts (read & write) strong in understanding and writing shell scripts. knowledge on the shell commands, awk, sed, perl scripting etc. basics of message queues and xml/xsd parsing in datastage good understanding on metadata and data lineage knowledge on rdbms concepts. database exposure on oracle and teradata (added advantage) good understanding and exposure on confluence, jira, bitbucket, bamboo tools knowledge on devops ci/cd. should have good understanding an exposure towards agile delivery. * education level - degree in computer science or. related field; * 8+ years of etl, data warehouse and data management experience have worked on rdbms such as oracle and teradata proficient in unix shell scripting understanding of financial services industry could be advantageous. what happens next and what can we offer you? interested? passionate people are capgemini\'s ace of spades. we believe that every one of us is an architect of positive futures. we invite you to join us to discover a career that will challenge, support and inspire you. working at capgemini you\'ll find the rewards are more than just financial. not only will you work alongside inspiring colleagues with a world of experience, but you\'ll also have access to great benefits including, salary continuance insurance, paid parental leave, education assistance, salary packaging, the ability to purchase additional leave; as well as discounts on entertainment, financial and wellbeing services, travel and shopping. talk to us about working part-time or. full time. ranked among ethisphere\'s 2019 most ethical companies in the world (for. the 7th year running!), our seven values are at the heart of everything we do - honesty, boldness, trust, team spirit, freedom, fun and modesty. as social innovators, we are committed to making a positive impact on the planet and our communities. capgemini is a proud to be equal opportunity employer and all applicants must be legally entitled to work in the country the role is based out of, unless otherwise stated within the job advertisement. proof of work entitlements and visa status will be required prior. to and/or. at time of offer. successful applicants will be required to complete a security and reference checks prior. to commencement of employment. please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or. other third parties will not be considered. #li-ha1

title: 2020 - ibl - hr response associate vic
description: your responsibilities: • 12-month, full time, paid internship commencing in january 2020 gain invaluable industry experiencework within a global organisation that is making a real difference our twelve-month, full time industry based learning program provides undergraduates with practical ‘hands-on’ work experience that will set you apart from your peers. you will be a part of a program designed to give you real work experience and optimise your professional development for future opportunities. you will benefit from: being involved in interesting work that will build your core technical and business skillsaccess to internal and external training opportunitiesdirect support and coaching from your manager and peersbeing involved in gsk’s volunteer programs to assist the broader community this is a unique opportunity to gain exposure to all facets of human resources across all areas of our business. working in the hr response centre, your responsibilities will include providing advice and guidance to employees and managers, general hr administration and interesting project work. you will be responsible for updating and maintaining hr documentation and webpage, co-ordination of hr information sessions and benefit programs with 3rd party suppliers. you will assist with hr communications and promotion of employee benefits, preparation of hr reports and data august. our recruitment process involves eligibility questionnaire at application, world of gsk online assessment, video interview and assessment centre. this process takes place over the course of around 8 weeks, updates will be regularly communicated across email. why you?  you must be in your penultimate or final year of your undergraduate degree upon commencement in the program. preferred qualifications: we are looking for passionate, high-performing and motivated students to join our program. you must be in your penultimate or final year of your undergraduate degree in hr, commerce or related degree to be eligible. you will have: an interest in pursuing a career in the healthcare industry is favourableexcellent written and oral communication skills along with initiative and an eagerness to learnhigh attention to detail, rigor and process, strategic thinking and problem-solving skillsexcellent project management, to manage and prioritise multiple ongoing projectsability to quickly build strong internal & external networks why gsk?: at glaxosmithkline (gsk) we are bound by a global promise to keep patients’ interests at the heart of everything we do. we are committed to driving innovation and best practice in the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries, leading with ethical approaches to all our activities, access to medicines and reinvestment into the communities we operate in. at gsk we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. we aim to create an inclusive workplace where all employees feel engaged, supportive of one another, and know their work makes an important contribution. contact information: you may apply for this position online by selecting the apply now button. important notice to employment businesses/ agencies gsk does not accept
