production, you will be: managing and maintaining data analytic dashboards create and modify production reports/dashboards as required to support our leadership team identifying important production trends and insights/root causes of issues investigations into data integrity to ensure accurate reporting can be achieved engage with internal stakeholders to identify and deliver productivity improvemen about the role we are looking for an experienced data analyst to join our inland rail operations team. supporting key business analysis activities you will identify and deliver capacity and productivity improvement opportunities for our iron ore rail operations division. this role is a great opportunity to further develop your data analytical and project management skills in a site-based production environment. you will be part of a team supporting the world?s first fully-autonomous heavy haul, long distance railway system. working a 5:2, 4:3 roster and reporting to the specialist - production, you will be: managing and maintaining data analytic dashboards create and modify production reports/dashboards as required to support our leadership team identifying important production trends and insights/root causes of issues investigations into data integrity to ensure accurate reporting can be achieved engage with internal stakeholders to identify and deliver productivity improvements department pdp representative and business case development skills and experience c class driver\'s license analytical background strong tibco spotfire experience strong experience in microsof office suite in ms excel basic database configuration and sql knowledge project management experience why work for workpac? we have a team of dedicated recruiters, most of which have in field knowledge of the industry, who make continuous contact to ensure you are happy with not only workpac\'s service but our clients. we are committed to ensuring you are happy and safe, you are our most valuable asset! workpac professional have over 45 offices throughout australia, this means you have the flexibility to work anywhere in australia with us. a

title: senior associate, third party, advisory
description: work type: permanent full time location: aust - vic metro, aust - nsw metro exciting new opportunities providing 1st line controls assurance support support and drive nab\'s controls transformation agenda join our diverse and supportive team  “our new enterprise controls structure is a critical step towards our goal of establishing strong 1st line risk and controls capabilities at nab, and setting the australian and global standard for a first line banking risk function”. what is this role all about? the senior associate, third party is a common point of subject matter expertise for enterprise controls teams and provides first line controls assurance support to nab\'s divisions. this role is critical in providing specialised services and advice across the enterprise to ensure that all third party risk management activities are completed in accordance with nab policy requirements. as the successful candidate you will be a common point of subject matter expertise for one or more third party risk domains below: business continuity & disaster recovery environmental & social sustainability information security, data & privacy financial crime health & safety operational risk & compliance subcontractor as well, provide risk advisory support in relation to third party risk matters to nab\'s divisions. this role is critical in driving understanding and change to create a centre of excellence for third party controls including the uplift of nab\'s controls infrastructure. what will i be responsible for? providing advice and guidance to the business to ensure all outsourcing and third-party arrangements are within the group risk appetite statement and associated legal entity risk appetite statements supporting the design of controls with control owners across the enterprise and facilitating documentation in risksmart for targeted controls; confirming appropriate implementation of controls supporting the business to build or uplift supplier controls supporting the business to complete the outsourcing materiality assessment (oma) and third-party limits assessment (tpla), providing the ma endorsement and if applicable facilitating risk (cro) sign off performing assurance over supplier performance in meeting risk requirements proactively identifying changes that are third-party related and ensuring that oma is completed supporting the communication of best practice and driving consistency across the enterprise specific to third-party assurance activities supporting divisional control teams with the execution of key processes related to third-party assurance activities proactively managing the relationship with enterprise risk including input and feedback on 2nd line risk policies and frameworks related to third-party suppliers  skills and experience required to excel in this role: you will be a resilient and confident individual with strong communication skills and extensive experience in transformation and change management. you are a motivated self-starter who can work autonomously and has substantial experience in a similar role. having worked at one of the big 4 or other large financial institution you will also have experience across at least one of the following risk domains business continuity & disaster recovery environmental & social sustainability information security, data & privacy financial crime health & safety operational risk & compliance subcontractor ideally you will also have 2-5+ years in operational risk management influencing experiences to adjust stakeholder’s way of working experience in control design and assurance methodologies experience in the change risk process related to third-party suppliers tertiary qualification in a business-related discipline post graduate qualification desirable  how to apply if you are ready to take the next step in your career, we are keen to hear from you! please note, candidate screening and interviews may take place prior to the advertised close date. to be eligible to apply, you must have australian or new zealand citizenship or permanent residency status. please apply via the link.  at nab we support workplace flexibility. have a chat to us about how this can work for you…

title: network engineer
description: hbf is australia’s fifth largest private health insurance provider, and the largest in wa. as a not-for-profit health insurer with no shareholders, our focus is solely on delivering greater benefits and the best experience possible for members. the opportunity we currently have an exciting opportunity for an experienced network engineer to join hbf’s infrastructure team! this position contributes to the hbf promise by planning, coordinating, implementing and maintaining data communication services, with a focus on maximum availability and performance to customers across multiple platforms related to lan, wan, voice, san and server technologies key responsibilities deploy, manage and maintain all internal and external network devices and their associated components capture, review and audit all device logs from multiple devices, appliances and systems communicate and highlight any concerns to the infrastructure manager and the infrastructure team that may impact any of our managed environments in development, release, integration and production for all data and voice services provide level 3 technical network support to internal and external customers as required to support the existing 24/7 operational environment review, assess and complete any change control tasks that are assigned to the network engineer position within the itsm system as part of the day to day operational support of such voice and data services escalate all tier 1, tier 2 network related issues to the senior network engineer and infrastructure manager in the first instance to ensure there is visibility within the ict senior management team, and to enable the infrastructure manager to implement appropriate contingencies participate in all dr related testing of all infrastructure services related to voice and data as required  about you to be successful in this role, you will have: 5 years + experience in it/network engineering along with qualifications in computer science or electronics engineering demonstrated experience supporting public and hybrid cloud networking solutions. advanced knowledge of networking systems and software covering local area networks (lans), wireless networks (wlans), and wide area networks (wans) strong understanding of emerging technologies in the data and voice communications sphere and their potential commercial application knowledge of industry standards and government regulations relevant to data and voice communication services experience with system / application monitoring tools desiriable: strong experience in networking protocols experience with linux based operating systems. appropriate cisco certification itil foundations certification  benefits as an employer, hbf offers a range of benefits including a competitive salary, access to flexible working arrangements, wellness days and paid parental leave, generous subsidies on hbf health and general insurance, and much more! how to apply to apply, please click on the "apply for this job" button and send through a copy of your recent cv along with a covering letter outlining why you want this position. please note that a current national police check (valid within 3 months) will be required as part of the selection process and the right to work in australia is compulsory. applications close midnight, 31 august 2019. at hbf, we don’t just accept difference we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our community. hbf is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. recruitment agencies, please note that all hbf vacancies are managed by our internal recruitment team. should external assistance be required we will reach out to our panel of providers. unfortunately, unsolicited agency applications will be returned without review. your support is very much appreciated.

title: research officer
description: the fenner school of environment & society is a world-leading centre for cross-disciplinary environmental and sustainability research, education and policy-relevant advice. through cutting-edge research and insightful analysis, our academic experts create social, economic and environmental impact and deliver real-world solutions to address complex environmental challenges. sustainable farms is a new and innovative project that is rapidly developing its scope and reach. you will provide technical and logistic support to two projects focused on the ecology and biodiversity of australian farms: one quantifying how dams and shelterbelts contribute to farmland biodiversity; and the second linking data from different sources (long-term monitoring and remote sensing) to make predictions about farmland biodiversity at landscape scales. both projects require collaboration with partners in different academic disciplines, and in industry and government organisations. applications are invited from individuals who love solving problems, investigating patterns in data, and working as part of a team. the successful candidate will display a desire to contribute to world-leading environmental and biodiversity research and will have in-depth knowledge of current statistical methods. you will also be committed to sharing your knowledge with the community to improve agriculture outcomes for both farmers and the environment. this appointment is fixed term for two years with an anticipated end date of october 2021. to see what the science at anu community is like, we invite you to follow us on social media at instagram and facebook the australian national university is a world-leading institution and provides a range of lifestyle, financial and non-financial rewards and programs to support staff in maintaining a healthy work/life balance whilst encouraging success in reaching their full career potential. for more information, please click here. for further information please contact martin westgate on t: (02) 6125 9286 or e: martin.westgate@anu.edu.au anu values diversity and inclusion and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to those of all backgrounds and identities. people with a disability are encouraged to apply. for more information about staff equity at anu, click here. application information in order to apply for this role please make sure that you upload the following documents: a statement addressing the selection criteria. a current curriculum vitae (cv) which includes the names and contact details of at least three referees (preferably including a current or previous supervisor). if your cv does not include referees you can complete these online when prompted in the application form. other documents, if required. applications which do not address the selection criteria may not be considered for the position. please note: the successful applicant must have rights to live and work in this country.

title: medical representative
description: iqvia™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. formed through the merger of ims health and quintiles, iqvia offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward. medical representative join us making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. it takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients. forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning. job id: r1084470

title: systems engineer - account se
description: what you’ll do do you want to be a trusted advisor that is an advocate for your customers? you will look to develop the technical relationship with some of cisco\'s key customers every single day. do you love technology? then working as a systems engineer at cisco is the place for you. come be a collaborator, a consultant and a forward-thinker. who you’ll work with you will get the opportunity to work a select group of accounts in the victorian region as an account se. as a cisco systems engineer (se) you will be a part of a dynamic and creative team of technology influencers. cisco ses are vital members of the organization who develop technical solutions to assist our customers achieve their business outcomes through the use of cisco\'s extensive technology portfolio. industry leading development programs ensure you will become and remain a technical authority who is entrusted to guide and educate our customers towards building technical solutions that drive innovation within their companies. you will join the strongest se team in the industry and peer with account managers and sales specialists who are invested in your success. at cisco, we are crafting, implementing and securing the networks of the future and making amazing things happen every single day. we bring together the best minds in the industry to help our customers accelerate their businesses in a safe and scalable way, helping them lead their own industries. who you are you are an expert systems engineer (se) with a strong background in one or more of our key technical pillars: data centre & cloud, enterprise networks, collaboration, security and iot. you will partner with our account executives in a pre-sales technical role, promoting and showcasing cisco solutions. you have industry knowledge and years of technology experience to aid in technical selling, explaining features and benefits to customers and crafting and configuring solutions and products to meet specific customer needs. you will gain access to the palette of cisco technologies and applications in a variety of vertical markets. in additional to technological aptitude and the ability for accelerated learning you know the latest, you have social, presentation, interpersonal and problem solving skills that evoke passion and confidence. required skills & abilities: 3+ years of networking\\telecommunications\\datacenter industry related experience as well as cisco product experience or relevant experience in key competitor offerings in technology area. pre-sales experience required. typically requires bs/ba (ee/cs) or equivalent. ccnp ccdp or similar vendor certification highly regarded. a strong multi-domain skillset across collaboration, campus and branch networks, security, data centre and cloud and iot is also helpful. excellent written and verbal communication, listening, and strong presentation skills. ability to work effectively and chip in as a team member. strong analytical skills: ability to assess a problem and resolve with an effective course of action. why cisco at cisco, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people. we connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better. we innovate everywhere - from launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building cisco services that accelerate businesses and business results. our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more – from cities to your everyday devices. we benefit everyone - we do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities. we are cisco. cisco is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.

title: sales development representative
description: job description about australia & new zealand our growing team of 1200+ employees work together to deliver world-class science products and solutions to a wide range of key markets. with commercial, manufacturing and distribution sites scattered across australia and new zealand, including melbourne, brisbane, sydney, auckland, adelaide, newcastle, and perth. our scope covers life sciences, specialty diagnostics, food, dairy & beverage, environmental & industrial, healthcare and analytical instruments including commercial, customer service, technical service, supply chain, finance and operations. how will you make an impact? from driving market share through generating, qualifying and nurturing leads that build pipeline for the anz sales organisation. this role owns the process of discovering, engaging and advancing new opportunities from initial outreach to the point of hand-off to the sales force. a key requirement is to conduct business dealings with customers in a way that creates a superior experience that will set the stage for future product sales. what will you do? prospect into multiple organisations through phone calls, networking, e-mail/e-marketing, social media and other information sources to produce qualified leads and set appointments at a rate that is aligned with the organisation’s growth plans. data sources include but are not limited to: select recipients of mailers/emailers – ie literature downloads select recipients of invitations to seminars/webinars, roadshows, other events other marketing leads sample requests awarded research grants lost opportunities achieve or exceed goals for qualified leads and appointments set on a monthly basis qualify sales leads based upon specific lead qualification criteria definitions. manage a leads pipeline with persistent focus to obtain and win business. provide baseline research within targeted accounts to identify key contacts and critical account information prior to prospecting calls. utilise a crm system to accurately and effectively track activity; and update account, contact, lead and opportunity information, as appropriate. learn and demonstrate a fundamental understanding of the company technology. promote the company’s solutions with various management levels and professionals across technical and business disciplines. articulate the company\'s value proposition to decision-makers across multiple industries to assess buying interest. develop superior customer service relationship with prospects. proactively continue company product and competitive product and market knowledge via website, on-line webinars, and marketing information. participate in sales, product and systems training, marketing campaigns, special projects as presented by the company to develop appropriate sales development skills consistent with company philosophy, policies, and procedures. education bachelor’s degree or equivalent relevant experience in life sciences (preferable) experience 1+ years of experience in a sales, demand, or lead generation focused role (preferable) previous industry/lab experience (preferable) experience and ability to build and maintain cross-departmental, multi-functional and collaborative relationships preferred. knowledge and experience with business software applications including ms outlook suite (outlook, word, power point, excel,) and virtual communication tools required. knowledge of marketing techniques and databases used in marketing a plus. experience with salesforce.com preferred; or an equivalent crm solution. knowledge, skills, abilities high energy, ambitious, self-motivated, assertive, and goal oriented. demonstrated active interest in advancing success of prospects. exceptional verbal and written communication skills. active and attentive listening ability. excellent time management skills. a knack for conducting independent research and data mining. capacity to absorb complex information and apply it accurately and quickly coachable with a willingness to learn and take direction. ability to work independently while also being a team player. ability to understand and successfully promote technical offerings and solution sets. exhibits a high degree of flexibility in adapting to a rapidly changing business environment.

title: e-commerce trade manager
description: decjuba is an australian privately-owned women\'s fashion label that delivers amazing at every touch point. we are currently operating over 120 stores across australia and new zealand… but it doesn’t stop there, as we grow so does the opportunity to join our amazing team! at decjuba we… we have a strong focus on innovation and are dedicated to pushing ourselves to be better than yesterday… we are our own competition! we are passionate about our #dream team and are committed to continuous learning and development to set our team up for success! right now we have an exciting opportunity for an e-commerce trade manager to join our digital team. you will be responsible for the profit potential for the decjuba online stores and will work with the ecommerce and merchandising teams to manage the day to day trading of all websites. a few more responsibilities.... you will... be accountable for developing and executing a short and long-term commercial strategy to exceed our kpis. ensure a strong stock position is maintained across the season so we can achieve our budgets and maintain availability targets, and a forward forecasting stock position coordinate with our key teams to plan our online trading calendar  help our teams to make sure trade direction is translated on site so our customer experience is amazing report to teams to ensure trade direction is reflected on site so that our customers journey is maximised provide weekly plans for individual kpi’s using our sales history, company strategies and trading patterns and be able to change these forecasts if needed prepare daily and weekly reports to help the business understand performance, problems and trends ensure that the product launch is online, on time and with all the correct information do you have ....? experience managing an e-commerce trading team merchandising, trading and stock management experience knowledge of shopify and ap21 would be great but not essential good knowledge of excel strong attention to detail and analytical skills. and are process and data driven a "can do" attitude and a drive to succeed an ability to analyse and interpret data and be able to action the data great delegation and time management skills and can effectively prioritise projects according to tight deadlines excellent written and presentation skills  at decjuba we are committed to making our customer look and feel amazing, but we are also passionate about our greatest assets…our people! a business that thrives on success, a team with a love for all things fashion. don\'t miss out on the opportunity to work with an incredible brand… join team d today!

title: chief compliance officer
description: about the team the leadership team provides revolut with the vision, the drive, and the direction to continue its rapid growth and development into a major international finance business. from risk, to finance, to people, the leadership team is our c-suite level grouping that sets the tone and agenda for all areas of the business and is comprised of some of the brightest and most successful people in the business. about the role we\'re looking for a chief compliance officer to join our team in melbourne, australia . reporting directly to the global cco / ceo, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading all risk management activities relating to conduct risk, financial crime risk and policy management as well as supervising head of regulatory compliance and head of financial crime compliance at revolut australia. what you\'ll be doing:implementing the global policies, and localisation of procedures for anti-bribery and corruption, whistleblowing, modern slavery and market abuseworking closely with our global regulatory compliance function to address any differences in the global policies and procedures and local requirementsensuring risk management processes for anti-bribery and corruption, whistleblowing, modern slavery and market abuseidentifying regulatory challenges and changes relating to anti-bribery and corruption, whistleblowing, modern slavery and market abuse to ensure these are addressed/implemented in good timeliaising with key internal (e.g. legal, risk, mlro, regulatory compliance, etc) and external (e.g. regulators, advisors, vendors, partners etc) stakeholders as requiredmanaging strong reputation for engaging openly, constructively and collaboratively with all market participantsmaintaining positive feedback from regulators, partners and trade bodiesactive participation in industry-level eventsembedding a clear conduct risk taxonomyfinalising policies and procedures for all types of conduct risks, with a clear view of the inherent risk, strength of control, residual risk and key risk indicators using real time dataautomating controls, monitoring of key risk indicators and testingimplementing our rolling compliance planeffective governance of conduct risk, this includes regulatory compliance leading/inputting into any debate on conduct risk, ensuring conduct risk management information is effective and ensuring the appropriate decisions are made at the appropriate seniorityensuring conduct risk management is integral to the design of products and customer journey and that the ‘business’ understand the conduct risks they own and ensure they have credible systems and controls for doing soset, lead and manage the culture of risk and compliance across the team in the local business and work with our uk legal, risk and compliance teams to define our risk appetite in the local market what you’ll needproven cco expertise in retail banking, and experience with setting up a second line of defence functionbroad experience in managing risk and compliance issues within a regulated businessknowledge of legislation and regulation relating to emi, banking or trading activitiesability to scale teamstechnical background with a robust and independent mindset ability to create and implement simple, elegant solutions a little about us we believe that there are better ways for people to control their money. easier, fairer ways. revolut started in 2015 with fee-free card transactions abroad. we’ve since added current accounts, business accounts, savings, insurance, and even cryptocurrency trading. we reached 6 million customers in july 2019 and we’re adding another million every quarter. and we’re only just getting started. come and help revolut build the world’s first truly global bank. what we are looking for from employee 1 to employee 1000, you will be slotting into a global team that shares a number of traits. you can work autonomously and take ownership. we thrive with the space and responsibility to solve problems. you operate best without lots of bureaucracy. we don’t hide behind fancy job titles or clunky processes ‘because that’s how things are done’. you approach work in a logical way. we are not afraid to make mistakes but we use data and logic to backup decisions and improve understanding. and you share our mission to improve people’s relationship with their money. the benefitscompetitive salarybiannual equity bonusesall the latest tech you needskip the commute and work from home once a weekroll with a free revolut metal subscription please only submit an application for one posting.

title: sales representative / sales rep
description: friendly team environment. easy parking in easy to get to location in the eastern suburbs. excellent opportunity to assist with various marketing tasks to support the sales & marketing manager and expand your skills. opportunity to grow your career in an inclusive family business. about us... rae-line a reputable and fast-growing company within the commercial upholstery and sports padding industry, is currently seeking an experienced sales team member to support growth and develop in local and interstate markets. based in kilsyth melbourne, you will be part of our small and friendly cross functional sales team working closely with the sales & marketing manager and product development team. about the role... as a successful candidate you will be on the road representing the rae-line group, generating leads, following up with customers and converting sales. main product focus is our \'the canvas seat cover company - car seat covers\', with potential future involvement in our \'commercial upholstery\' and \'sports padding\' products. about you... a self-motivated individual with a full understanding of the sales process and great customer relations management skills. you are comfortable to be in regular contact with new and potential customers and are able to perform the duties and responsibilities listed below with minimal supervision. you will be heading out into the market place, growing our brand awareness and bringing new opportunities to the team; duties include but are not limited to: core tasks: planning and conducting sales trips throughout australia. liaising with current and potential clients on a daily basis via phone, email and face to face. identifying business development opportunities and make initial contact. achieving and maintaining rapport with customers and work to give them the best possible service. accurately passing on customer requirements to the inbound sales team. maintaining / updating client notes and records as required in our crm system. following up new leads and warm lead conversion. post trip reporting, data entry and follow up. preparation & communication of information for both existing and potential customers. performing any other duties as reasonably directed. about you... the ideal candidate will have the following skills: previous experience in a similar role. have the ability to learn quickly and think on their feet. positive and professional attitude is essential. must be computer literate and be able to utilise a crm. must have ‘excellent’ english communication skills (verbal & written). excellent listening skills. microsoft office – excel (intermediate level). must be a great team player. demonstrated ability to convert prospects and close deals. solid experience in opportunity qualification, pre-visit / call planning. success in qualifying opportunities involving multiple key decision makers. an understanding of sales principles, methods, practices, and techniques. self-motivated, with high energy and an engaging level of enthusiasm. able to perform basic calculations in order to assist the estimators. ability to travel regularly to conduct sales visits. 50% to 75% out of office. ability to travel and attend sales events or exhibits. ability to work individually and as part of a team. high level of integrity and work ethic.. current australian driver’s license. how to apply… we are not currently asking for a resume from you. simply complete your work history & education information on the application page. you are welcome to include any certificates or licences in the education section to assist us in assessing your suitability for this role. shortlisted applicants may be requested to submit a resume at a later date. if you are looking for your next opportunity and genuinely enjoy finding that next customer and great customer service this could be the role you have been waiting for, please do not hesitate - apply now!

autonomously and in a team environment.current victorian driver\'s licence.with our office based in sunshine, victoria, this position would suit someone that lives in the western suburbs.job type: (preferred)licence:drivers licence (required)language:english (required)work eligibility:the candidate can work permanently with no restriction on hours (required)

title: planning analyst
description: david jones wants to inspire people by providing an exceptional experience. as one of the leading international retailers, we\'ve done this by curating the world\'s leading brands across fashion, beauty, home and food. by enabling and empowering our employees, david jones ensures that we are a destination for endless possibilities.  our team of planning analysts is responsible for managing and supporting our stores by ensuring accurate, timely and effective management of cost ratios and financial reporting. you will interface directly into stores and retail operations team.  in this role you will: develop and maintain all financial reports and user modules, including those with macros, for stores and cost centres. provide advice and assistance to stores and cost centres with the management of financials and systems assist and administer the forecast process for stores and cost centres maintain all databases and records to ensure accurate and timely information complete relevant and accurate financial analysis, using complex systems and data, including tm1. complete all financial transactions and reporting required for each month end  to be a part of a team that will play an integral role in the success of our everyday operations, you will: be advanced in microsoft excel, and proficient in tm1 server administration, sql and visual basic for applications (vba). be proficient in creating macros and running reports. have the ability to analyse data and be able translate and interpret information to stakeholders and allow decision making. have strong analytical skills using sound numeracy and financial reasoning demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills have the ability to manage multiple deadlines & work independently.  you will be rewarded with: competitive remuneration and incentive packages david jones employee discounts being surrounded by a great team who are inspired to make a difference for our customers opportunities for career progression - there are always opportunities for those with aspirations!
